Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: "elicited" = "el-iss-it-ed": a soft C, not a hard one.

session_synopses.Dead: You speak with the dead soul of a fisherman, who tells you where you are: on a river that flows to Baldur's Gate. However, you're probably too far away to get there before the worm in your brain transforms you into a mindflayer.

node_data.text: CinematicNodeContext: Player gets to their feet groggily.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player gets to their feet groggily.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As you wake, the tadpole squirms in your skull.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Check yourself for injuries.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Other than the infection, you're more or less intact. A miracle, given everything you've been through.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player glances over themselves

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *But it'll all be for nothing if you don't find help soon.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The tadpole is a death sentence, and the clock is ticking. You need a cure.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Concerned expression

session_synopses: This is the dialogue each avatar gets when they wake up on the beach in WLD_Main_A Crash site.It's a call to action to find a solution for the tadpole before you turn into a mindflayer.

session_synopses.Recruitment_AD: As you walk down the road, Astarion calls out to you. He's got something dangerous trapped and needs your help to finish it off.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Your skull throbs, your muscles ache. Memories of the last day swim through your head before taking form.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lae'Zel solo scene, custom cameras may be required.

node_data.speaker: Lae'zel
node_data.text: Summon your resolve. The ghaik tadpole will not be the end of you.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The pain brings the world into focus. Whatever this place, you know Vlaakith's protocol: you must locate a githyanki crèche.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *It is only a matter of days before tentacles split your lips, and your skin turns to gore.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *At a crèche, you will find your kin. The tadpole will be removed, and you will be purified.*

session_synopses: Laezel wakes up and reflects on what she needs to do after the crash. Vlaakith'ka sivim hrath krash'ht: VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het.

session_synopses.Dead: You speak with the dead soul of a fisherman, who hurried to the crash site when he saw your ship fall from the sky. At the site he saw a mindflayer, disguised as a beautiful woman, and was killed by Intellect Devourers (brains).

session_synopses.AD_Rock: A player passes by a hidden Harper cache. If they pass a Perception check, they discover the rock hiding the cache. Otherwise, they just comment on the nearby ocean view.

Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer.text: *You approach the dying monster. This is the thing that abducted you.*

Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer.text: *You could end its life here and now, if only you didn't feel...*

Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer.context: NodeContext: Bewildered. That was the last emotion you were expecting.

Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer.text: *The poor creature is on the brink of death, but there's still time.*
Mindflayer.context: NodeContext: The mind flayer has you under its control now, you earnestly mean this line.

Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer.text: *You'd give your life to save it, to nurse it back to health!*
Mindflayer.context: NodeContext: The mind flayer has you under its control now, you earnestly mean this line.

Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer.text: *But then the feeling slips. The creature's mind seems to focus elsewhere.*
Mindflayer.context: NodeContext: With a bit of relief that the mind flayer's focus on you is abating.

Mindflayer.speaker: Player
Mindflayer.text: Take advantage of the lapse - break free.

Mindflayer.speaker: Narrator
Mindflayer.text: *The monster lies exhausted, defeated. Its eyes - wet, orange pearls - radiate malice.*

session_synopses.Mindflayer: The player approaches the dying mind flayer. During the dialog the player describes how the mind flayer still tries to telepathically dominate him or her into feeling compassion for the creature. In the end the player can give in to the mind flayer (which results in death) or resist.
session_synopses.PAD_SeeWoundedDevourers: You meet with some Intellect Devourers: walking brains essentially that are nasty creatures. They attack you. As non-gith you have no idea what these things are. As gith, you know very well.

PAD_FightingFishers.speaker: Player
PAD_FightingFishers.text: Must have been fishing when these monsters came. Bad luck.

PAD_FightingFishers.speaker: Player
PAD_FightingFishers.text: Hm. Wouldn't wish that fate on anyone.

session_synopses.PAD_FightingFishers: Player clicked on a fisher's corpse on the beach that's near an intellect devourer's corpse, and remarks they must have put up a fight.

VB.speaker: Shadowheart
VB.text: Some sort of chapel or sepulchre... but dedicated to whom?

PAD_Return.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_Return.text: Dead goblins over there. Worth checking for supplies maybe.

session_synopses.VB: Shadowheart reacts to discovering a mysterious, half-ruined chapel. It's not immediately clear what deity it was built for.
session_synopses.PAD_Return: Arriving at a juncture in a path, companion Shadowheart points out an opportunity to look for supplies.

AD_SanctumStatue.speaker: Narrator
AD_SanctumStatue.text: *You do not recognise the language on the plaque.*
AD_SanctumStatue.context: NodeContext: Reading a plaque Selûne pronounced seh-LOON-eh

PAD_RichSarcophagus.speaker: Narrator
PAD_RichSarcophagus.text: *Here lies the Guardian of Tombs. Through knowledge comes atonement.*
PAD_RichSarcophagus.context: NodeContext: Reading the inscription on a sarcophagus.

session_synopses.AD_SanctumStatue: Reading a bronze plaque at the feet of an unidentified statue.
session_synopses.PAD_RichSarcophagus: Player reads the inscription on a plaque in an abandoned chapel dedicated to the god Jergal.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: You'll die a bloody pauper unless you take a few risks.

AD_BanditsDiscussion.speaker: Taman
AD_BanditsDiscussion.text: Why don't we just wait a while? Make sure it's safe.

AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.speaker: Quelenna
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.text: Well, that's one less greedy bastard to share the loot with.
AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: with a shrug - found a dead companion and sees the bright side

EntranceDoor.speaker: GROUP_Act1_CHA_FL1_BanditGuard
EntranceDoor.text: That you, Gimblebock? Everything all right out there?
EntranceDoor.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. He's reacting to them trying to open it and thinks they're his accomplice, a gnome called Gimblebock (ɡɪmbəl-bock)

EntranceDoor.speaker: Player
EntranceDoor.text: Gimblebock triggered some trap. He needs help - now!

EntranceDoor.speaker: GROUP_Act1_CHA_FL1_BanditGuard
EntranceDoor.text: Yeah? And who are you? Probably your trap that did him in...
EntranceDoor.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. Player just tried to convince him his boss - a bandit leader - was injured by a trap. He's calling us out on the lie

EntranceDoor.speaker: GROUP_Act1_CHA_FL1_BanditGuard
EntranceDoor.text: Come through that door, and you're getting a knife in the guts.
EntranceDoor.context: NodeContext: Speaking to players through a locked door. he's threatening the player, who just tried to convince him his boss - a bandit leader - was harmed by a trap. He's bluffing a little bit and is more worried than he's letting on

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Warryn
BanditWestInteraction.text: You! Not another step, hear me?
BanditWestInteraction.context: NodeContext: Sharp ultimatum mixed with a little surprise. Found the player approaching from the side of the structure.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Warryn
BanditWestInteraction.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hollering down to Gimblebock, his leader (down some steps behind Warryn, out of view).NodeContext: Hollering down to Gimblebock, his leader (down some steps behind Warryn, out of view)

BanditWestInteraction.text: CinematicNodeContext: Alerted by Warryn, Gimblebock hurries up to confront the player
BanditWestInteraction.context: CinematicNodeContext: Alerted by Warryn, Gimblebock hurries up to confront the player

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction.text: What's this then - trying to creep around us and loot the crypt? Not happening.

BanditWestInteraction.speaker: Gimblebock
BanditWestInteraction.text: Or is it the ship you're after? Don't matter either way - it's ours, all of it.

VB_BanditsLeaveReaction.speaker: Player
VB_BanditsLeaveReaction.text: Lucky those bandits valued their own hides over their loot.

AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.speaker: Taman
AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.text: We'd have been safer in the crypt!
AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: reacting with shock on seeing a dead friend

AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction.speaker: Gimblebock
AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction.text: How the hells did that happen?!
AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction.context: NodeContext: seeing a companion crushed by a boulder - he thinks it was an accident but is unnerved

session_synopses.AD_BanditsDiscussion: Discussion between Gimbleboc and Taman before the scene against them triggers. They're arguing about whether to investigate the crash (this segues into the beginning of their intertactive dialogue when you get near enough)
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Caster_01_CrushedReaction: A bandit reacts to finding one of her companions dead in an apparent accident. She looks on the bright side.
session_synopses.EntranceDoor:
This is the same character as Andorn, the bandit guard within the chapel.

This character is talking to the players through a door - he's locked the door and is on the other side, so they'll be talking TO the door and can't see him.

The player is talking to a gullible bandit through a door - the bandit is inside a chapel dungeon and his friends are outside. The player has probably either killed them or scared them away at this point. The guard is not very bright...
session_synopses.BanditWestInteraction: Alternate version of the confrontation scene between Gimblebock and his bandits at the crypt - triggers if the player approaches the scene from the side, alerting Warryn first.
session_synopses.VB_BanditsLeaveReaction: The player comments on how they talked the bandits into leaving (or companions react to the player's successful persuasion).
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Melee_02_CrushedReaction: A bandit sees the corpse of one of his companions, killed by a falling boulder
session_synopses.AD_Bandit_Melee_01_CrushedReaction: A bandit sees one of his friends crushed (dead) by a boulder and doesn't have a great deal of sympathy
session_synopses.AD_BanditReaction: A bandit exclaims in alarm/indignity upon spotting the player 'trespassing' near a tomb they intended to loot.

session_synopses.VB_TrapReuse: You click on a broken trap on the ground and find it useless.

VB_LowerFloor_1.speaker: Player
VB_LowerFloor_1.text: This place wasn't built for the living.
VB_LowerFloor_1.context: NodeContext: Karlach: She's enjoying exploring here.

PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.speaker: Player
PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing.text: They didn't want to surrender their valuables, even after death.

VB_SideChamber_1.speaker: Player
VB_SideChamber_1.text: Looks like someone wanted to bury their secrets.

AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.text: Hells! Something's coming out of the crypt!
AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised.context: NodeContext: Terrified - we just emerged from a seemingly abandoned crypt she was trying to break into

AD_BanditGuardWarning.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardWarning.context: NodeContext: He's in an abandoned chapel, looting, and has just spotted the players. He calls to his friends for help and enters combat

AD_JergalInsideTomb.speaker: Richly Adorned Sarcophagus
AD_JergalInsideTomb.text: Dost thou think to rush fate? See to the dead first.

Jergal.text: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player
Jergal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jergal climbing out of his tomb and standing up before the player

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: So he has spoken, and so thou standest before me. Right as always.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: What a curious way to awaken.

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Now I have a question for thee: what is the worth of a single mortal's life?

Jergal.speaker: Player
Jergal.text: A peaceful undead. Interesting. Why aren't you attacking me?

Jergal.speaker: Withers
Jergal.text: Dull your weapons as you wish.

AD_BanditSanctumSearching.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.text: Rotten food, dusty altars... where's the bloody treasure?
AD_BanditSanctumSearching.context: NodeContext: Referring to his surroundings in an abandoned chapel. He's searching for a way to open the crypt, or some treasure. Muttering to himself

AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked.context: NodeContext: spotted the player - shouting to alert her companions as she becomes hostile

PAD_GasPit.speaker: Player
PAD_GasPit.text: I can't see any way to disarm it.

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in an adjacent room just collapsed, startling them

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditCrashBanter.text: The roof caved in - this place is a deathtrap!
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: Panicking - these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound

AD_BanditCrashBanter.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditCrashBanter.context: NodeContext: these characters are robbing an abandoned chapel and the roof in one of the rooms just collapsed. They don't know what's happening and are VERY twitchy. The roof in one of the rooms just collapsed, and they're reacting to the sound, this guy is trying to take control of the situation and calm his companions

VB_Skeleton_1.speaker: Player
VB_Skeleton_1.text: Armed scribes - but no sign of a struggle.

AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardCallHelp.context: NodeContext: alarmed - he's a tomb-robber in an abandoned chapel, and the players just surprised him. He's calling his friends to help as combat begins

PAD_JergalStatueReaction.speaker: Player
PAD_JergalStatueReaction.text: That statue. It seems they worshipped some kind of... scholar?

AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.text: Barton? Oh gods, somebody killed Barton!
AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit.context: NodeContext: just found a dead friend - Barton - and is furious as she starts to hunt for the killer

AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.text: How'd you get past Andorn? Back off!
AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting.context: NodeContext: She was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel and is surprised to see the players who have either killed or sneaked past her friend 'Andorn'. She's entering combat.

AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.speaker: Mari
AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor.text: It's... open? Could've sworn I hadn't cracked it.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.speaker: Player
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.text: I feel a presence here - a power. The patron god of this place?
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.context: NodeContext: Player is stepping into an abandoned chapel and still feels the holy presence of the goddess Selune (seh-LOON-eh). She is a tranquil, protective deity.

VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.text: Whoever that even is. No intact symbols here, no dedications - nothing.
VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart.context: NodeContext: Mocking her companion's pious reference to the moon goddess, of whom she is no fan.

AD_BanditGuardSurprised.speaker: Andorn
AD_BanditGuardSurprised.context: NodeContext: he's part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - the player just entered, surprising him. He calls for help as he backs away, in combat

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: We have nothing more to discuss. Continue on thy way, as if I were not here.

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: I must attend this place, after so many years away. We will see each other again soon.

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: When the time is proper. I do not know that hour any more than dost thou.

JergalWandering.speaker: Withers
JergalWandering.text: But I do know that the longer thou standest here, the farther away our second meeting becomes.

VB_Artefact_1.speaker: Player
VB_Artefact_1.text: A lot of effort to hide one sarcophagus.
VB_Artefact_1.context: NodeContext: Said with reverence and a touch of fear.

VB_Sanctum_1_WithShadowheart.speaker: Shadowheart
VB_Sanctum_1_WithShadowheart.text: I don't recognise this. Who was worshipped here?

AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.text: Clear off - we got here first!
AD_BanditSanctumSpotting.context: NodeContext: seeing a threat, preparing to attack

PAD_FoundCoins.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundCoins.text: A strange coin. I wonder what it's worth.

AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_OnlyBarton.speaker: Barton
AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_OnlyBarton.context: NodeContext: Calling out to possible intruder

session_synopses.VB_LowerFloor_1: This triggers has the player unlocks a door and enters a secret and, until now, hidden crypt.
session_synopses.PAD_SuccessfulGraverobbing: Voicebark dialog after robbing the amulet from Jergal chapel, about whether it was right to loot the place. Its guardians might have been killed by the player. Or the guardians might have engaged the player, but they found a way to get out without killing them all, by fleeing or distracting them. Or the player might have sneakily escape the guardians.This is played on the party after they leave an area, so Speakers are roughly interchangeable here, the undertaking is assumed to be a party effort.
session_synopses.VB_SideChamber_1: VB upon noticing the book chained and padlocked to the table in the side room.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSurprised: Players emerge from a seemingly abandoned crypt, startling a bandit on the other side of the door. Afterward, the bandit attacks.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardWarning: A bandit who is part of a crew looting an abandoned chapel - at this point, he's seen the players entering the chapel - 'the uninvited guests' - and thinks they're after the same loot as his crew. He's calling his friends to help.
session_synopses.AD_JergalInsideTomb: Jergal reacts to a player touching his sarcophagus when his servants (the skeletal clerics) have not yet been killed.
session_synopses.Jergal: After the party has slain a group of undead scholars, the judge of death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumSearching: A bandit in an abandoned chapel who is searching around an altar for a way to open a passage into the crypt, which is in the corridor outside. He's frustrated, twitchy and nervous. This place is creepy.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerUnlocked: A bandit in an abandoned chapel calls to her companions for help upon spotting the player
session_synopses.PAD_GasPit: Player characters comment when the player interacts with a trap that has been spotted but not yet triggered
session_synopses.AD_BanditCrashBanter: A group of bandits in an abandoned chapel - they're hoping to loot the place and are a little on edge. Abandoned chapels often have traps or undead guardians. they're startled by a loud noise from one of the side-chambers. The roof just caved in, and the bandit are trying to figure out a plan of action. What they don't know is that the roof collapse was caused by the players who just broke in.
session_synopses.VB_Skeleton_1: Player characters are commenting on skeletons in a chapel. Even though the corpses look like they are scribes, they are all armed.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardCallHelp: One of a group of bandits looting an abandoned chapel. He's just been surprised by the players who have infiltrated the same chapel. He's twitchy and on edge, and now he's in a fight and needs his friends.
session_synopses.PAD_JergalStatueReaction: Player succeeds/fails passive check to recognise statue of Jergal.
session_synopses.PAD_ButtonBlocked: The player has pressed a button only to find it won't move - because it deactivates a trap they haven't triggered yet.
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerFoundDeadBandit: A bandit in an abandoned chapel finds one of her companions dead
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerSpotting: A bandit who was trying to pick a lock in an abandoned chapel - at this point, she's seen the players intruding on her position and tries to alert her friends as she enters combat
session_synopses.AD_BanditLockpickerOpenDoor: Mari realises that the door she was trying to unlock is suddenly opened, but she has not unlocked it.
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_2_WithMysticShadowheart: A mystic comments that they feel the power that once resided in an abandoned chapel. Shadowheart responds. Neither of them recognise which god this place is dedicated to.
session_synopses.AD_BanditGuardSurprised: A bandit guarding the door to an abandoned chapel that his crew are looting. The player just surprised him and he calls for help as he enters combat
session_synopses.JergalWandering: death--Jergal--climbs out of his sarcophagus to greet them. He has been locked inside for years by the god Helm to atone for his part in raising the Dead Three, wicked gods who are now plotting to conquer the realms. Jergal is emotionless and excessively formal, both resigned to his fate and that of others. He is here to assist the party because that is his divine oath, not out of any true desire to act. Players can attempt to goad or attack him, but to minimal effect, as he is functionally immortal. His only goal was to see their faces, so he can find them at camp later to offer further assistance.
session_synopses.VB_Artefact_1: Players notice the tomb containing the Selune artefact.
session_synopses.VB_Sanctum_1_WithShadowheart: Shadowheart (a cleric) remarks that she doesn't recognise the patron god of a mysterious abandoned chapel.
session_synopses.AD_BanditSanctumSpotting: The bandit in the chapel's inner sanctum spots the player and starts combat.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundCoins: Player finds a soul coin inside Jergal's chapel.
session_synopses.AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert_OnlyBarton: Crypt bandit is on alert - likely after some masonry collapses nearby.(Same as CHA_Crypt_AD_BanditsSanctumWaitingAlert but with only Barton as a speaker.)

PAD_Jewelry.speaker: Player
PAD_Jewelry.text: Necklace has a Harper sigil. Why were they here?

Crevice.speaker: Narrator
Crevice.text: *At the back of the crevice lies a bag, enfolded in the chitinous squabbling of spiders. A shiny gold coin pokes from its mouth.*
Crevice.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player looks into the crevice. We see a bag at the bottom with a coin sticking out.

Crevice.speaker: Narrator
Crevice.text: *The creatures clutch the pouch possessively. You have no doubt: a spider egg is nestled within.*

Crevice.speaker: Player
Crevice.text: Speak softly to the spiders in hopes of calming them.

session_synopses.PAD_Jewelry: Player finds a necklace at the watchtower. If they pass a History check, they recognize it as belonging to the Harpers. If they encountered the Harper documents hidden in the CRA cave, the player senses a pattern.
session_synopses.Crevice: The player peeks into a crevice to see a coin pouch covered in small spiders.

AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.speaker: Damays
AD_ReturnAnyCombat2.text: Eyes on the toad-freak. We can't risk it escaping.

AD_TieflingsLeaving.speaker: Damays
AD_TieflingsLeaving.text: Observe - and listen. You'll hear goblins before you see them.

AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses.text: They must have carried something useful.

AD_OpenCage1.speaker: Nymessa
AD_OpenCage1.text: Shoot it down. Let's kill this thing.

AD_LaeZelDead.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelDead.text: Hold it together. We've got to finish what we started.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: Of course it's dangerous. One of them carved up Zorru's whole squad.

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: And let the goblins have it?

AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.speaker: Damays
AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro.text: No. We take it to the grove.

AD_LeavingAnyCombat2.speaker: Damays
AD_LeavingAnyCombat2.text: I can't remain here. It's too dangerous.

PickASide.speaker: Lae'zel
PickASide.text: You've but one chance. Join me, or die.
PickASide.context: InternalNodeContext: The player persuaded the tieflings that they should kill the creature

AD_LaezelCombatComment.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelCombatComment.text: Let me down, and I'll show you true might!

session_synopses.AD_LaezelReactsToAttack: Lae'zel is in the cage. The player attacked her.
session_synopses.AD_ReturnAnyCombat2: Damays (and Nymessa) got dragged into a combat from another situation (ex.: the brains at the crash site, the bandits at the chapel). Damays plays this AD when the combat ends, while he returns to the cage.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingsLeaving: Two tieflings discussing goblins, who might be nearby.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelInspectsCorpses: Damays and Nymessa are dead. Lae'zel says this once, then will inspect the corpses.
session_synopses.AD_OpenCage1: A tiefling encourages you to shoot down a cage containing a strange creaturfe (Lae'zel).
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelDead: Two tieflings that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comment that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_LaeZelTieflingsIntro: Two tieflings argue about what to do with Lae'zel. Nymessa thinks to leave her alone. Damays wants to take her back to camp.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelDeadSolo1: A tiefling that faced a strange creature (Lae'zel) comments that it is finally dead after battle.
session_synopses.AD_LeavingAnyCombat2: |Tieflings joined a random combat and were dragged far from Lae'zel Recruitment. They will leave out of stage while saying this instead of going back to the scene.|
session_synopses.PickASide: Occurs if the player tells the tieflings to lower Lae'zel and kill her, or if player lets the tieflings try to take her away. One last chance to choose a side.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelCombatComment: A random combat was dragged up to Lae'zel Recruitment (bandits, brains, etc.); Lae'zel is still in the cage. She says  this AD only once, after a player's turn.

Resting.speaker: Narrator
Resting.text: *The adventurer sleeps soundly, his breath steady, his wounds expertly bandaged.*

session_synopses.Resting: Small dialogue when you find Liam sleeping in the den after freeing him in the goblin camp.

AD_GreetingPlayer.context: NodeContext: Calling out to someone she has seen but not met. Friendly and inviting.

VB_HagLeaves.speaker: Player
VB_HagLeaves.text: That old woman was certainly memorable.
VB_HagLeaves.context: NodeContext: Positive but unsure. She was charming but also strange.

session_synopses.AD_GreetingPlayer: This is the hag calling out to a player she doesn't know. The player is a distance from her, and she is cheerily waving a hello.
session_synopses.VB_HagLeaves: VB played when the player sees the Hag leave the Den.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: And we'll have a dog, right?
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: They don't allow 'em in Baldur's Gate. Cats, though...
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: A little orange cat! And a house with a little door so it can come and go as it pleases.
2.context: NodeContext: Enthusiastic, planning for the future.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: ... and a high fence to keep eavesdroppers out.
2.context:
NodeContext: Just now noticing the player. Following Bex's line: 'And a house with a little door so it can come and go as it pleases.' A little wary but not too bad
-- who is this perosn who's approached them?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Don't mind me. I was just passing through.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: No bother. We're just daydreaming, anyhow.
2.context: NodeContext: Friendly again-- player doesn't mean harm.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: What about you? Big plans for when you get to the city?

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I'll be keeping to myself. People tend to stare at me.

2.speaker: Danis
2.text: But... I've heard there's all sorts in the city. It might not be like it was in Elturel. I mean - in Baldur's Gate, they give you a chance.

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: Good luck to you. Wish us a little too. I think we'll all need it.

session_synopses.2: This pair are a young couple dreaming about their future plans in Baldur's Gate. They're optimistic-- as long as they have each other, they'll make things work. Early/ mid-20s, youthful enthusiasm.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: Dance upon the stars tonight. Smile and pain will fade away. Words of mine will change - no. Become - ugh.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lightly strumming her lute. Not looking at the player. NodeContext: Softly singing. Sadness in every note. There is a small pause between every line as you softly sing.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: What's that tune you're singing?

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: More like butchering. Don't know why I bother.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at lute - frustratedNodeContext: Speaking of her own music. Embarassed and frustrated with herself. Dejected.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Are you all right?

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: No. I'm moments away from a grisly death...
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at player. NodeContext: Sarcasm mixed with frustation.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: ...at the hands of this bloody song. I can't... nothing fits, you know?
Bard.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Why are you songwriting now? Hardly the best time.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: I... we lost people on the way here.
Bard.context: NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: And the dead deserve to be remembered. That's what my teacher always said.
Bard.context: NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: This grove could become a battlefield soon enough. It's not the time for music.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: I know. I should be packing up, but I need to finish this song. It's... it's important.
Bard.context: NodeContext: Player has advised her to leave. But she can't - she has to finish her song. Frustrated, mainly at herself.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Snatch the lute out of her hands and smash it.
False

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: You horrid, horrid beast. What is wrong with you?
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches out to grab Alfira's lute. Alfira stays seated - twists her body to the side out of the way. While saying first phrase. Stands up after first phrase. Then says 'What is wrong with you?'. Holding own lute close.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: Get the hells away from me.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding own lute close.NodeContext: Angry.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera starts on the bard, then pans to the animals.InternalNodeContext: We should be able to hear the bards song in the background, overshadowed be the animals complaining.NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Animals.speaker: Spar
Animals.context: NodeContext: The animals are listening to someone sing and play the lute. They hate the sound and are uncomfortable.

Animals.speaker: Player
Animals.text: Don't mock her - she's trying her best... I assume.

Animals.speaker: Spar
Animals.text: Oh no! Whatever shall we do?
Animals.context: NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.context: NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.

Animals.speaker: Corinna
Animals.text: My head is melting! I'm leaving before the damage is permanent.
Animals.context: CinematicNodeContext: The critters leave.NodeContext: amused, ironic, making fun of the player.

AD_StartingOver.speaker: Alfira
AD_StartingOver.context: NodeContext: Player has convinced her to start from scratch with the song. Doubts herself. Hates what she's working on. Dejected.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.context: NodeContext: Gently singing. Sad but hopeful.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Smile and pain will fade away.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Words of mine will turn to ash.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: When you call the last light down.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Moon. Sun. All remind me of your grace.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Faith. Care. All the love I can't repay.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Moon reminds me of your grace.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: All the love I can't repay.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Rest and know that I will pray.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Moon. Sun. All remind me of your grace.

AD_FullSong.speaker: Alfira
AD_FullSong.text: Faith. Care. All the love I can't repay.

session_synopses.Bard:
Alfira is a young bard who was apprenticed to a woman called Lihala. On their journey to the camp, they were attacked by gnolls, and Lihala died horribly.
Alfira is trying to compose a song in honour of the teacher she loved so dearly, but is struggling. The player can help her play, talk ther through the lyrics, steal her instrument, or even convince her to give up music.
This is a very soft and touching moment in the grove. Should Alfira finish her song (with the aid of the player) she will stand up and sing it in a cinematic scene.
session_synopses.Animals: This occurs as the bard, Alfira is playing her lute. The animals are NOT impressed and making fun of her and the player. They are very dramatic.
session_synopses.AD_StartingOver: AD that plays after the bard has been told to start over. She is holding her lute. Not plucking it occasionally but not really playing.
session_synopses.AD_FullSong: The bard is playing on her lute and singing the full song the player helped her compose.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.text: These tieflings prove fragile. I've a mind to end their misery myself.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.speaker: Wyll
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.text: Harsh. Remind me to stay on your good side.

VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.speaker: Lae'zel
VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll.text: You were never on my good side.

session_synopses.VB_FishOutofWater_WithWyll: Lae'zel remarks on the tieflgins' frailty, and the party responds.

session_synopses.AD_ToronCurious: Toron notices you speaking with the strabge ox, but he's not too concerned, just curious.
session_synopses.AD_OxReaction: This AD plays after you have spoken with the ox with SwA, if you linger or pass by the ox again.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Why didn't we stop her? We should've stopped her!
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Blaming yourself for your daughter's death

AD_Parents.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents.text: We didn't do this, do you hear me? It was Kagha.
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: You know where you husband's mind is going and you won't have it - firm, voice like still. Hint of violence.

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.text: Cursed druids. I hate them all.

Guard3.speaker: Mino
Guard3.text: Few outsiders are allowed in here - be respectful and do not interfere.
Guard3.context: NodeContext: 'tread on eggshells while you're here - or else.'

Guard2.speaker: Maggran
Guard2.context: NodeContext: SFX only - animal sound. Do not record.

AD_Protesters.speaker: Rechel
AD_Protesters.text: Do all the damn rituals you want - we're not leaving 'til it's safe!
AD_Protesters.context: NodeContext: Angry, Shouting at some druids who're trying to force them out of the grove and into danger.

AD_Protesters.speaker: Amek
AD_Protesters.context: NodeContext: Angry, Shouting at some druids who're trying to force them out of the grove and into danger.

AD_ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
AD_ParentsScene.text: Step back - you sully our holy ground!

SoloParentA.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA.text: All Arabella wanted to do is help. But you and half the grove stood by and let her die - alone.

SoloParentA.speaker: Locke
SoloParentA.text: Get out of my sight. For your own good.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsSeeCorpse.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the corpse of your daughter. Hysterical. Grieving.

node_data.speaker: Maggran
node_data.text: *Roar!*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Threatening roar + aggressive stance from the bear/druid. But he doesn't attack.

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: Calm, Maggran. Give them a chance.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druid guard raises a hand to her bear colleague, stilling him.NodeContext: She's addressing the bear, but 'give him/her a chance' is more for the player's benefit.

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: You - get back.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jeorna (druid1) turns to address the player.NodeContext: Entry not up for discussion.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Ignore them and proceed.

node_data.speaker: Maggran
node_data.text: *Roar!*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear roars and looms ferociously.

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: Stop! Another step and Maggran will tear you open like a sack of grain.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gestures towards the bear on 'and Maggran'.NodeContext: Anger starting to boil over. Between the refugees and us, she's had enough of outsiders and their demands, Stop is addressed to the player - they're pushing their luck and Jeorna's bear-druid colleague is ready to rip them apart.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: No need for threats. Why can't I move around freely here?

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: It's forbidden to outsiders - Kagha's orders.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bear-druid glowers menacingly when druid says 'see what happens'

Guard1.speaker: Jeorna
Guard1.text: Your companion vouched for you, but you're being watched. Respect our grove.
Guard1.context: NodeContext: Terse. The player's been granted entry but the guard isn't too welcoming.

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Let my daughter go - right now.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the guards face - have the feeling of a showdownNodeContext: AbSolutely furious and ready to fight ever single druid with your bare hands if you have to. These people took your daughter  - and you're going to get her back.

ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
ParentsScene.text: She's a thief, hellspawn. And you will wait for Kagha's judgement. Now get back.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over her - roaring in her faceNodeContext: Snapping back at the woman. The child is a thief and a liar as far as you're concerned. Right in her face as you snap at her to get back,

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Argh. Let me through, mragreshem, or I'll rip your damned throat out!
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Move as if to push past the guardsNodeContext: You've lost your temper, you're pushing past - utterly furious

ParentsScene.speaker: Maggran
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Transform into a bear. Stamping the ground and roaring - the tieflings jumpe back wards.NodeContext: Roar in rage as you transform into a bear

session_synopses.AD_Parents: Situation 1: Locke and Marrick have learned their daughter is dead - killed by Sagha and her snake. Situation 2: Locke and Marrick have been denied entry into the inner grove. They are standing close to the entrance trying to figure out their next step. Marrick is happy to charge in but Locke is advising caution. Their daughter is inside.
session_synopses.Guard3: A druid guarding the entrance to the inner part of a sacred druid grove. He curtly warns the player to behave.
session_synopses.Guard2: Maggran (druid guarding the entrance to the inner sanctum of the Emerald Grove) is in bear form. He delivers curt, bestial one-liners if the player has speak with animals. He doesn't want them around. He has a lone human fallback line should he somehow transform.
session_synopses.AD_Protesters: Three tieflings voice their anger at how they're being treated by the druids of the grove. They've been barred from entry into an innermost section while the fdruids conduct a ritual that will ultimately seal off the grove.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsScene: (script comment: it is repeated, but I don't want it to be culled out)This occurs as the player approaches the scene. Locke and Marrick are arguing with two druid guards - trying to get in. Their daughter is inside but they are being denied entrance.Tensions are high and voices are raised. This is a tense exchange.
session_synopses.SoloParentA: This is for the edgecase in which one of the parents has died. In this case - Locke, the husband survives. In the first scenarion he rewards and thanks the player for saving his daughter's life - lamenting briefly on their lives without Arabella's mother.In the second, he learns that Arabella has died. He is overcome with grief and rage at losing both his wife and daughter.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsSeeCorpse: This is the edgecase in which the player takes Arabella's corpse and dumps it in front of her parents. They are hysterical with grief.
session_synopses: Three druids guard the entrance to the inner part of their sanctuary, blocking any outsiders. They're on edge, having recently driven back some outraged tiefling refugees who know the druids hold one of their children captive. One of the druids transformed into a bear during this confrontation, causing the tieflings to back down. Now we try to gain passage while tempers are still running hot.
session_synopses.Guard1: Jeorna, one of the druid grove guards, speaks to the player after they've been allowed entry. She's curt and not greatly pleased that we're allowed inside.
session_synopses.ParentsScene: Marricko and Locke are trying to force their way past multiple guards to get into the inner grove. Their daughter was taken by the druids and stands accused of thievery. This is a tense scene - the threat of violence close to the surface. Their daughter is NOT present - she is in the inner chambers of the druid grove.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Barth
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Don't make me hurt you, boy.

AD_AdventurervsKid.speaker: Meli
AD_AdventurervsKid.text: Too late. Looking at you is painful enough.

Trainee1.speaker: Umi
Trainee1.text: Oh! Uh... right. 'Go for the heart.'
Trainee1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.NodeContext: Shy, guilty, repeating what teacher told him. Too shy to respond to player directly.

AD_HideoutTrespass.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutTrespass.text: Fine. I'll just go tell the guards you kicked us out of our home.

Pickpocket_002.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket_002.text: I don't have money or anything to sell. My p-partner does that.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Little slow on the uptake, aren't you?

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Not sure why you're poking your nose in our business, though.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Player
HideoutKid_001.text: I don't even know what your business is.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: This is our hideout, but hey, maybe you didn't know.

HideoutKid_001.speaker: Mol
HideoutKid_001.text: Because of that, I'll give you a ten-count to leave.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer.text: Only going to ask you one more time, boy. Hand over my locket.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer.text: I don't have your ugly locket. I've never even seen it before!

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurer.text: Hand it over or I'll slap the teeth out of your head.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer.text: Don't you dare lay a finger on that child.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Player
RobbedAdventurer.text: Raise a hand to that child and you'll lose it. Your choice.

RobbedAdventurer.speaker: Meli
RobbedAdventurer.text: Guards! This human is trying to hurt me and my friend!

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mirkon
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Sorry about the nest. You guys find anything good today?

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Nah. Everyone's got junk. Worse than junk.

AD_HideoutGuards.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutGuards.text: Don't worry, kid. In Baldur's Gate, purses practically grow on trees.

AD_MerchantLeaves.speaker: Mattis
AD_MerchantLeaves.context: NodeContext: Prompting, building confidence in his little sister.

AD_Trainee3Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee3Responses.context: NodeContext: Patiently, warning them to stop arguing.

VB_FoundStolenGoods.speaker: Player
VB_FoundStolenGoods.context: NodeContext: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place

HideoutGuard_002.speaker: Zaki
HideoutGuard_002.text: You don't look so tough. Mol fought off a hobgoblin all by herself.
HideoutGuard_002.context: NodeContext: Tough guy act from a kid. Potentially referring to Lae'zel (toad-lady)

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: Do we get to wear armour too?

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee2Responses.text: No. We have nothing that would fit you.
AD_Trainee2Responses.context: NodeContext: Sad. Child has no protection.

AD_Trainee2Responses.speaker: Ide
AD_Trainee2Responses.context: NodeContext: Doesn't understand that she's in danger.

AD_Trespassing.speaker: Mattis, Meli, Mirkon, Silfy, Zaki
AD_Trespassing.text: You can't be here! This is our hideout!

CaughtThief.speaker: Narrator
CaughtThief.text: *You suddenly feel something moving against your back and turn.*
CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: Silfy jerks her hand out of the player's pack and stares at them, then she bursts into tears, covering her face.InternalNodeContext: SFX: child crying

CaughtThief.speaker: Player
CaughtThief.text: Ignore her theatrics and grab her.

CaughtThief.speaker: Silfy
CaughtThief.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player tries to grab her, but she escapes their grasp.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Uh, hey. You here to trade or...

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Yeah, I know. I was standing right here, telling her to rob you.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Player
Pickpocket_001.text: You could at least pretend to be sorry.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: I am sorry! Sorry we're still talking about this.
Pickpocket_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sincere, then mocking. NodeContext: Insistent, then mocking.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Look, you caught her. Good for you, you aren't a chump like everybody else around here.

Pickpocket_001.speaker: Mattis
Pickpocket_001.text: Now, do me a favour. Make room for the chumps.

AD_CannotFitCrack.speaker: Player
AD_CannotFitCrack.text: I can't fit through here. Wonder if there's another way in.

AD_Trainee1Responses.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainee1Responses.text: Throat if you can. Wrist if you can't.

AD_PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
AD_PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: Spoken to himself; checking his 'wares'

AD_KidGuardReport.speaker: Mol
AD_KidGuardReport.text: Help! They're trying to kill us!

AD_HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeader.text: We're going to own that town.

session_synopses.AD_AdventurervsKid: Barth is threatening Meli, who has stolen a locket from him. Meli is playing dumb and/or threatening him in return.
session_synopses.Trainee1: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutTrespass: Mol has caught the player in her hideout and advises them to leave, starting to count down. She's threatening and serious.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_002: Not Critpath. A small tiefling girl (7-9 years old), very shy and nervous, is planning on stealing from the player and is surprised that they're talking to her. Though she's a gifted thief, she's not good at lying. There is also a portion of this dialogue where the player can get her to partially admit to having stolen from them.
session_synopses.HideoutKid_001: A young woman in her early teens, crime boss, leader of the thiefling kids in the Den. She reacts to the various ways the player has treated her kids so far, and if necessary, can return items to the player that her kids have stolen.
session_synopses.RobbedAdventurer:
Non-critpath. A human adventurer accuses a tiefling child of stealing a necklace from him. A tiefling guard may intervene if things get out of hand. 

Barth: Angry, but gruff and restrained. 
Meli: Fearless, urging Barth on.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutGuards: The sneaky kids are talking amongst themselves in their secret hideout.
session_synopses.AD_MerchantLeaves: When the scammer (Lim) and the pickpocket walk away, having stolen from the player.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee3Responses: Gan (and possibly Ide) recieve combat training from an adult tiefling. They're both tiefling girls aged 9-10. Too brave. Don't know the danger ahead.
session_synopses.VB_FoundStolenGoods: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place
session_synopses.HideoutGuard_002: Little kid talkign to the player-- trying to be tough.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee2Responses: Training in combat with an adult tiefling. Ide is 9-10. Nervous, but trying to be brave
session_synopses.AD_Trespassing: A crime reaction dialog said by the kids in the Thiefling Hideout.
session_synopses.CaughtThief: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player catches the small tiefling girl (7-9 years old) is stealing from them. The player can grab and shake her, as per design.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_001: Non-critpath. A tiefling merchant kid who's trying to distract the player while his partner/sister steals the player's belongings. Orphaned street rat, works for Mol (Boss kid in the hideout)
session_synopses.AD_CannotFitCrack: Player found a crack through which they potentially can or cannot enter the kids' hideout.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee1Responses: Training in self-defence with an adult. Umi is 8-9 years old and timid.
session_synopses.AD_PickpocketTrader: Scammer kid mutters to himself after having swindled someone.
session_synopses.AD_KidGuardReport: Player is fighting Mol and the other kids. The kids are calling for help from the other tieflings.
session_synopses.AD_RobberKid: Child pickpocket, bored out of his mind, talking out loud.

AD_Training.speaker: Wyll
AD_Training.text: Good work, kids. You're all heroes, each and every one of you.

session_synopses.AD_Training: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.

DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolTampered.text: The Idol of Silvanus! Round up the intruders - we've been patient enough.

session_synopses.DruidAttack_AD_NoticedIdolTampered: AD when the druids realise their sacred idol has been tampered with. This is the straw that breaks the camel's back, and they start attacking the tieflings and the players.

AD_DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
AD_DenIntro.text: Halsin, why would you go anywhere with that fool.
AD_DenIntro.context: NodeContext: To himself / the air - his friend Halsin is missing because of the man he / you just knocked out.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.context: InternalNodeContext: Remember he could have been KO by Aradin. The flag PostConfrontationDone will make him move after the dialogNodeContext: mrag-RESH-em. Means 'shithead' in infernal. Zevlor has just woken up after being punched in the face by Aradin. He's groggy and pissed off.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: A cheap shot - to be expected from a drow. But you helped us, so instead of killing you, I'll just ask:
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Sneering, barely keeping his temper in check

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Who in the Nine Hells do you think you are?

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: I'll survive a sore jaw. What I won't tolerate is a stranger waltzing in here and interfering in our business.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Lucky for you, you seem to have spooked that adventurer trash into leaving.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Whatever your business, I'd see to it quickly - the druids are forcing everyone out.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Cautionary - his people are also being forced out

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: This attack will only strengthen their resolve.

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: I won't be staying long - I just need to find a healer.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: They've started a ritual to cut the grove off from the world outside.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: We can't stay, but we'll be slaughtered if we leave - we're no fighters.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Weary, doesn't know what to do

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: This ritual - is there no way to convince the druids to stop it?

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: I've tried. Kagha - their new First Druid - won't even see me.

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: You, though... I know it's not your business, but she owes you for saving this place.
DenIntro.context: NodeContext: Slowly and thoughtfully - considering you, idea just occurring to him

DenIntro.speaker: Zevlor
DenIntro.text: Perhaps you could persuade her. For more time to prepare, if nothing else.

DenIntro.speaker: Player
DenIntro.text: I'll see what I can do.

session_synopses.AD_DenIntro: Zevlor is looking over the Grove after the Raiding Party Confrontation (or looking at Aradin if Aradin is KO)
session_synopses.DenIntro: In these dialogues, Zevlor reflects on what's happened (an attack of goblins at the gate, which the player helped with) and his mistrust of and bitterness towards the druids who are reluctantly hosting his people. He is exasperated, furious, but also eager to meet anyone who could help. He'll show a flash of anger and frustration at the start if the player struck him, but is pragmatic enough to calm himself once he realises you could be more help to him than harm.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: We wasted so much time fighting each other.
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The danger has passed, but there was much infighting in the druid grove, which he believes put them at higher risk.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: Silvanus taught us a lesson by letting an outsider save us.
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: Players are the outsider here - they saved the druid grove from both infighting and a goblin attack.

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.text: To think we almost finished the ritual...
RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would have sealed off the druid grove from outsiders and driven out the tieflings is over. She's ashamed to have been a part of it.

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.text: I felt honoured when I was chosen to participate. Now I feel guilty I didn't object.
RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The ritual that would have sealed off the druid grove from outsiders and driven out the tieflings is over. She's ashamed to have been a part of it.

RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4.text: Do you hear them? The birds. They're beautiful.
RitualDruid4.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped and the goblin threat dealt with. She's emerging from a time of intense anxiety. She's exhausted emotionally, but feels calm for the first time in a long time.

RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
RitualDruid4.text: I've thought of nothing but goblins and tieflings for so long, I stopped listening.
RitualDruid4.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped and the goblin threat dealt with. She's emerging from a time of intense anxiety. She's referring to her anxiety preventing her from listening to the birds in the grove.

AD_RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
AD_RitualDruid1.text: Complexum tuum... it's still in my head.
AD_RitualDruid1.context: NodeContext: Prnounced: Com-PLECK-soom TOO-oom, He's got a chant stuck in his head.

AD_RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
AD_RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblins threat against the grove has been defeated. Inwe is still scared - she's not convinced the threat is really gone.

AD_RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2.text: How could we be so blind?
AD_RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, but the goblin threat remains. Karrik feel betrayed by Kagha.

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra... did I say that out loud?
RitualDruid1.context: NodeContext: Dazed. He's been chanting for days. Pronounced: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah

RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
RitualDruid1.text: We've been chanting for days. I need some rest.

PAD_RecognizeRite.speaker: Player
PAD_RecognizeRite.text: That ritual. A common growth spell, but... altered, somehow.

PAD_RecognizeRite.speaker: Player
PAD_RecognizeRite.text: But nothing to worry about... right?

AD_RitualDruid4.speaker: Elwyn
AD_RitualDruid4.text: The grove isn't safe. Not anymore.
AD_RitualDruid4.context: NodeContext: The ritual to seal the druid grove off and drive out the refugees has been stopped, but goblins still threaten the grove. Elwyn worries that without Kagha - the mastermind of the ritual - they are rudderless, easy targets.

session_synopses.RitualDruid2: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Kerrick is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Kerrick is furious - he feels betrayed by Kagha, and doesn't quite care if she's been killed.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Kerrick has calmed down a good bit - now that the danger's passed, he's seeing things with a bit more clarity. The player always encounters Kerrick around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.RitualDruid3: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Inwe is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Inwe is ashamed at her involvement.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Inwe is still a bit shaken - she knows the threat is over, but she's still jumping at shadows.The player always encounters Inwe around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.RitualDruid4: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Elwyn is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Elwyn is conflicted - she knows why the ritual had to be stopped, but she's scared that they've been left defenceless.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Elwyn is calm but exhausted, the weight of the goblin threat finally off her shoulders.The player always encounters Elwyn around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid1: This AD plays after the druid's ritual has been stopped. In this AD, Aelar is dazed from days of chanting.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid3: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Inwe was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Inwe is feeling sorry for herself. She's overcome with shame for being a part of a shadow druid plot.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Inwe isn't quite convinced the danger is over. She's jumping at shadows, imagining danger where there's presumably none.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid2: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Kerrick was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Kerrick feels angry and betrayed - he thought he was part of something good when really he was being used.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Kerrick is reflective and calm. The threat is gone, but there's much to be learned from it.
session_synopses.AD_BirdSender: |Druid sending a bird to find Halsin. |
session_synopses.RitualDruid1: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Aelar is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Aelar is in a daze - several days of chanting have left him a bit loopy.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Aelar is still exhausted, but he's gathered his senses, more or less. The player always encounters Aelar around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.PAD_RecognizeRite: The voicebark is triggered after talking to one of the druids performing the ritual. It's always a DRUID in the party that react first. This VB won't fire after talking to Kagha and getting all the details about the ritual
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid4: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Elwyn was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Elwyn is preoccupied with the goblins - she's afraid that without the protection the ritual would have provided, they don't have a chance against them.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Elwyn is calm, the weight of the goblin threat finally off her shoulders.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: Stop it! You're not going to find the antidote.

Apprentice.speaker: Player
Apprentice.text: Then help me. Give me a chance to beat this.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: I can't. I can't let you endanger this camp.

Apprentice.speaker: Nettie
Apprentice.text: Please, just sit down. Make your prayers. Let things take their course.

session_synopses.Apprentice: The player is locked in Nettie's lab and has done something to annoy her (ie. Stolen, damaged, or moved something she owned, or been caught trying to pick her pocket.) Nettie has poisoned the player, and is wary of you finding the antidote while looking around.

Transition.speaker: Gerson the Bent
Transition.text: Have you heard? Scouts have just reported the goblins have been neutralised. The way is clear!

Transition.speaker: Gerson the Bent
Transition.text: The others are gathering near the gate - come on!

session_synopses.Transition: This scene plays for people in the Druid Grove if another player kills the Goblin Leaders away from the Grove.

GrieflingFriend.speaker: Memnos
GrieflingFriend.text: These druids are insane - why are they doing this?!

ZenBear.speaker: Ormn
ZenBear.text: You ruined it! You ruined Master's grove!

Prodigy.speaker: Rolan
Prodigy.text: So you can handle yourself. Not bad - those druids really should have known better.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: We no longer need to fear a dagger in the back from our kindly hosts. Thank you - for standing by us.

AD_Refugee004.speaker: Toron
AD_Refugee004.text: Bloody druids! You let us in! You gave us shelter!

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: Emphasis on 'will'. The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

Tiefling004.speaker: Kaldani
Tiefling004.text: I'll take you all on! Just try me.

Trainee001.speaker: Umi
Trainee001.text: I just want to go home.
Trainee001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking down, sadNodeContext: The druids are dealt with. He just wants to go back home and be safe again.

AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack.speaker: Danis
AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack.text: Goblins might not even come. Right?

HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader.text: You're alive! Did you get the idol? Is that why they went crazy?
HideoutLeader.context: NodeContext: surprised, pleased, slightly breathless - she has been hiding from an attack, and just realised it's over

HideoutLeader.speaker: Player
HideoutLeader.text: I don't have it. Let's just be glad we're alive.

HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
HideoutLeader.context: NodeContext: Frustrated to have lost out on a treasure

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: You're a person with many faces.

Tiefling005.speaker: Pandirna
Tiefling005.text: I was able to wiggle a toe earlier - I guess that potion is finally wearing off. Terrible timing, as usual.

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.speaker: Ikaron
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.text: Eerie little black rock. Wonder what it does?

AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.speaker: Okta
AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack.text: Probably rots your fingers off. Leave it be!

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

TieflingLeader.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader.text: I knew Kagha had twisted them, but for so many to turn on us...

TieflingLeader.speaker: Zevlor
TieflingLeader.text: Thank you for standing with us. I need to check on my people, but come see me when you have a chance.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: We managed against the druids, but half our weapons are bent or broken.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: The goblins will run us through unless I get them mended.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Player
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: When do you think the goblins will attack?

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: Could be a day or a season - bad timing for us either way.

Weaponsmith_PostEA.speaker: Dammon
Weaponsmith_PostEA.text: We'll just have to prepare as best we can.

AD_Trainer.speaker: Asharak
AD_Trainer.text: Children - find a place to hide. Don't come out 'til I call.

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.speaker: Zaki
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.text: How long will you be down here, anyway?

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.speaker: Alfira
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.text: Just until it's safe to go out. Don't worry. How about a story in the meantime?
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: Smiling and relaxed - trying to be friendly

AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.speaker: Zaki
AD_BardAndKidAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: A little petulant sounding but you actually really wanted a story

DruidGuard001.speaker: Jeorna
DruidGuard001.text: Time to reclaim our grove. Stand in our way and we'll cut you down.
DruidGuard001.context: NodeContext: Combative. Spoken just before the druids turn hostile against the tielfling refugees.

RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The druids are preparing to attack the tieflings in the grove - and the player.

PetWolf.speaker: Silver
PetWolf.text: Master says you're good. Told me to protect you. But one wrong move, and your flesh is mine.

Protester3.speaker: Xeph
Protester3.text: Thought we were safe here. But nowhere's safe, is it?
Protester3.context: NodeContext: Post-battle. Even in victory, attitude's a little defeated.

ProdigyBrother.speaker: Cal
ProdigyBrother.text: Damn it. How many are there?
ProdigyBrother.context: NodeContext: In the middle of the fight - grim and determined.

PrisonGuard.speaker: Tilses
PrisonGuard.text: You look ready. Wish it were contagious.

ProdigySister.speaker: Lia
ProdigySister.text: I'm glad we were here - who knows what would have happened otherwise?

ParentB.speaker: Komira
ParentB.text: Thanks for gutting the druid bastards. Only wish I could've taken a few myself.

ExcitedBoar.speaker: Tusk
ExcitedBoar.text: I should've known. All two-legs are the same!

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.speaker: Rikka
AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.text: I do need some armour, you know.

AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.speaker: Dammon
AD_WeaponsmithAndGuardsAfterAttack.text: Can't outfit all of you at once.

SnakeKid.speaker: Arabella
SnakeKid.context: NodeContext: whispered, barely audible, head down

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: NodeContext: Second line where she's a bit more awake. The previous line was "You *yawn* woke me up!"

DruidLeader.speaker: Kagha
DruidLeader.text: The brood is restless. The mother strikes!

Protester2.speaker: Amek
Protester2.text: I hope that lot burn in whatever hell they're destined for.
Protester2.context: NodeContext: Post-battle. Still keyed-up and outraged at what's happened.

RangerTrader.speaker: Eramas
RangerTrader.text: Thank you for helping us. Seems like there's still a few real adventurers left.

LINE_DruidToCombat.speaker: Sentry
LINE_DruidToCombat.context: CinematicNodeContext: (idol stolen)InternalNodeContext: Reaction from druids if players steal the idol in their vicinity without being pacified first.

LINE_DruidToCombat.speaker: Sentry
LINE_DruidToCombat.text: The time has come. Remove the outsiders.
LINE_DruidToCombat.context: NodeContext: A grim conclusion at the end - a call for a huge battle between druids and tieflings.

LINE_DruidToCombat.speaker: Sentry
LINE_DruidToCombat.context: NodeContext: Calling for the druids to attack all the inhabitants of the grove.

DruidOpposed.speaker: Rath
DruidOpposed.text: We've won, yes, but at what cost? The peace of this grove has been shattered forever.

Protester1.speaker: Rechel
Protester1.text: The druids have gone mad - save yourself!
Protester1.context: NodeContext: Urgent - there's a bloody fight between druids and refugees unfolding in the grove

Scammer.speaker: Nerela
Scammer.context: NodeContext: She's trying to act natural.

Pickpocket.speaker: Silfy
Pickpocket.text: I think we made those animal people mad.
Pickpocket.context: NodeContext: One of the other tiefling children stole an idol from the druids - she thinks they're attacking because they're mad about that. She's scared.

AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack.speaker: Zevlor
AD_LeadersPrepareAfterAttack.text: We had the druids to worry us before. Not anymore. We can defend this place.

AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.text: This place could use a little light.
AD_TreeCuttingAfterAttack.context: NodeContext: a little wry. she wants to cut down some trees.

RobberKid.speaker: Meli
RobberKid.text: You can beat them, can't you?

AD_SonOfChef.speaker: Ikaron
AD_SonOfChef.text: We're done running. Hold your ground!

AD_ParentA.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentA.context: NodeContext: Whispered - trying to keep everyone calm during the attack.

PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader.text: There goes half my customers. But you'll make up the difference, right?
PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: The druids are all dead. She's miffed to lose her customer base, but is secretly relieved the whole thing is over.

PickpocketTrader.speaker: Mattis
PickpocketTrader.text: Just have to replenish our stock first.
PickpocketTrader.context: NodeContext: The druid attack is over - she's planning on looting the druids' belongings.

ServantPlight.speaker: Arron
ServantPlight.text: This is your last chance. Leave.

ParentA.speaker: Locke
ParentA.text: Never thought the druids would attack. Thank you. We were lucky to have you.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: Killing goblins is one thing, but this...
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: the attack is over, and she's dealing with the nausea she feels in the aftermath.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: ... I think I'm going to be sick.
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: the attack is over, and she's dealing with the nausea she feels in the aftermath.

AD_DruidGuard1.speaker: Jeorna
AD_DruidGuard1.context: NodeContext: Moving to attack - combat imminent

Tiefling010.speaker: Lakrissa
Tiefling010.text: You stood by us. I thought you might. Glad I was right. You might even hang around and help us deal with goblins, by my reckoning.
Tiefling010.context: NodeContext: She's very warm to you. Playful lilt to this without being too light-hearted given the subject matter.

Trainee003.speaker: Gan
Trainee003.text: Leave one for me next time! A little one.
Trainee003.context: NodeContext: Acting tough. The druids are dealt with.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Sorry, no gruel on the pot today.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Now that this druid mess is over, I'm having to store up all the rations I can.

Chef.speaker: Okta
Chef.text: Which... isn't much. But we'll make do.

Stargazer.speaker: Nadira
Stargazer.text: Don't look at me! Those druids are out for blood.

AD_ParentsAfterAttack.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsAfterAttack.text: Think she'll be all right with the other kids?

AD_ParentsAfterAttack.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsAfterAttack.text: Mol will keep an eye on her.

Griefling.speaker: Arka
Griefling.text: Backstabbing filth. Good riddance to the lot of them.
Griefling.context: NodeContext: Lingering anger, She survived an attack by the druids, who'd originally offer her and her people shelter.

AD_HideoutLeader.speaker: Zaki
AD_HideoutLeader.context: NodeContext: quiet, terrified, they're hiding from an attack

AD_HideoutLeader.speaker: Mol
AD_HideoutLeader.text: No, Zaki. It'll be over soon.

Tiefling011.speaker: Zorru
Tiefling011.text: We're stronger than we thought. And the druid fight is proof.

Trainee002.speaker: Ide
Trainee002.text: You fought them all, didn't you? Whoa.
Trainee002.context: NodeContext: Impressed. The druids are dealt with.

session_synopses.GrieflingFriend: Memnos reacts to the druids turning on the tieflings. If the tieflings prevail, he reacts to this also.
session_synopses.ZenBear: This bear is still struck with grief because his master hasn't returned, but he's also incredibly angry because the player has committed a crime.
session_synopses.AD_RangerTraderLootingAfterAttack: Eramas is looking around the adventurers' spot in the Grove for useful stuff for the incoming goblin fight.
session_synopses.Prodigy: Rolan is being Rolan here - full of pride and arrogance, even as he begrudingly admits that the player played a large part in defending them from the druids.
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: Elegis is the gatekeeper for the grove. She is grim but determined to keep her kin safe as the druids attack.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee004: Toron, a tiefling, reacts to the druids attacking him and the other refugees sheltering in the grove.
session_synopses.RitualDruid3: Inwe has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. She's calm and serious - she doesn't want to fight, but she will.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingLeader: Zevlor is a leader who hears commotion between his followers and a rival faction. These lines trigger from when he first hears the noise, investigates, sees a confrontation brewing to when fighting actually starts.
session_synopses.Tiefling004: NPC Dialog during and after the Druid Attack state.
session_synopses.Trainee001: This dialogue plays during and after a group of druids turn on the tieflings in the grove and attack them. Umi is taken into a secret cave to hide during the druid attack. He's frightened while they are attacking, and clearly shaken afterward.
session_synopses.AD_LoversPackingAfterAttack: Lovers go back to packing after attack on Den.
session_synopses.HideoutLeader: During and after the druid attack, Mol is frustrated and a little anxious rather than scared. If she made a deal with the player, tough and resilient when discussing it.
session_synopses.Bard: Alfira is scared but trying to hold it together during the attack. She is with the children in the hideout. She isn't a fighter but is prepared to lay down her life to protect them. She stays in the hideout with the children afterwards.After the attack, if the player has stolen or broken her instrument she is thankful but wary of the player. Otherwise she is grateful that someone has finally stuck by the tieflings.
session_synopses.Tiefling005: Pandirna is guard who is either 1) sprawled on the ground, unable to move. 2) healed due to the player's help. If she's healed, she is ready for a fight and eager to prove herself and protect those she loved. If she paralyzed, she just wants the player to protect the other tieflings - she's convinced she'll die. If she survives, she thanks the player - knowing it is directly because of them that she survived.
session_synopses.AD_ChefAndSonAfterAttack: Okta is preparing meals for the road and Ikaron is snooping around the hag's corner, against his mother's pleas.
session_synopses.RitualDruid2: Kerrick has stopped chanting as the druids prepare to battle the tieflings in a fight to the death. He's ready to do what needs to be done.
