session_synopses.Griefling: A tiefling preparing for the goblin assault on the grove - she's scared but excited about the attack because she sees it as a chance to avenge her friend, Kanon, who was killed by goblins earlier. She's trying to sound more sure of herself than she is.
session_synopses.RaiderViolent: goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.RitualDruid001: This dialogue takes place after the player has successfully fought back an army of goblins that attacked the druid grove. Aelar is still in a bit of a daze from chanting for so long. He doesn't quite believe everything that's happened.
session_synopses.RaiderHardy: A goblin taking part in a raid on a druid grove
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: Dialogue for the lazy bear sleeping next to the elevator after the den has been attacked.
session_synopses.AD_WarchiefAndPotions: The warchief sees through the arsonists who failed to loot the storehouse and orders them to get to looting despite the fire.
session_synopses.EntranceMeetingWyll: Player returns to den after letting Wyll return beforehand. NOTE: A NARRATOR NODE IS REQUIRED IN THE FIRST NODE BECAUSE IT IS A SPEAKER SELECTION WITH A CINEMATIC.
session_synopses.ProdigyBrother: Cal reacts to the successful defence of the Druid Grove, in the event that the prodigy and co were convinced to stay.
session_synopses.RaiderCrafty: goblin raider attacking a druid grove full of tiefling refugees in a huge assault
session_synopses.VoloBear: The bear is shocked by the slaughter of the battle that just happened and wants to leave.
session_synopses.AD_RaidersAtPool: Raiders are having a pissing competition by the water close to the sacred grove.
session_synopses.LeaderKid: Player is speaking to an adolescent girl on the eve of battle. She's mature beyond her years and cynical about their chances of survival. They're standing on the edge of a story circle where children are being distracted from the coming battle, but she's not buying it.
session_synopses.AD_CaringForOx: During the goblin attack. Trying to keep the ox calm.
session_synopses.ProdigySister: Lia reacts to the successful defence of the Druid Grove in instances where she was convinced to stay around.
session_synopses.AD_RikkaAndDoni: Rikka found Doni, so they can go hide together before the goblin attack.
session_synopses.ChefAndSon: Okta and Ikaron are gathering food/supplies for the den's defense. Ikaron is upset after seeing several other tieflings run off in the middle of the night for Baldur's Gate.
session_synopses.GoblinLush: goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.AD_BossyAtPool: Raider taking a piss in the Grove sacred pool.
session_synopses.Wyll: Wyll dialogue if he is an NPC and is in the goblin camp after attack on den victory. In paths where the attack has yet to begin, Wyll is enthusiastic for you to blow the horn and call for battle. After battle, you can recruit Wyll.
session_synopses.PickpocketTrader: Young child is hustling and trying to trade with player on the eve of a battle.
session_synopses.RaiderStupid: Gobin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.Mule1: A speak with animals dialogue where the player can commune with an ox and get a sense of their feelings during and after an attack on the Druid Grove - fear, confusion or elation depending on who wins the fight.
session_synopses.Tiefling001: Rikka is a civilian caught up in the battle at the grove, She is scared, but initially distracted by the search for an eccentric little boy she needs to get to safety before sealing up a hideout.
session_synopses.Apprentice: |Dialog used:- after Attack on Den (tieflings won)- after Goblin Hunt|
session_synopses.AD_ChefAndSonPacking: Ikaron is trying to lift a heavy crate to load onto a cart with Okta packing by his side.
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: She's the gatekeeper at the Druid Grove and speaks these lines before and after a goblin attack that threatens to kill everyone in the place. She's shaken and extremely surprised and relieved to have survived
session_synopses.AD_CoweringStargazer: Goblins have just broken in and started killing unarmed civilians around Nadira.
session_synopses.BackupVictory: Cerys is addressing a crowd of her people after a battle in which their leaders died. She's taken it on herself to take the lead, despite being uncomfortable with the duty..
session_synopses.Trainee001: A child who's been trained to fight - terrified and in denial at the fact that he may just have to.
session_synopses.RaiderBold: goblin raider involved in attack on the druid grove
session_synopses.Sapper_001: goblin with an explosive barrel, participating in the attack on the grove
session_synopses.Weaponsmith: The tiefling weaponsmith is arming the others defending the den and checking their gear.
session_synopses.RaiderCunning: A goblin participating in a large raid on a druid grove - these lines are spoken during and after the fight
session_synopses.AD_HalsinAndDruidLeader: Halsin is speaking with Kagha until the players arrive for a scene. This dialog varies whether Kagha turned good or conflict with tieflings wasn`t resolved - it can be tense or reconciliary.
session_synopses.AD_LoversOverTortured: Danis and Bex are a couple tending to the wounded adventurer while waiting for the attack to begin.
session_synopses.Tiefling010: Tiefling refugee before/after the goblins raid the grove.
session_synopses.RaiderFunny: A goblin taking part in an attack on a group of civilians, hiding in a refuge
session_synopses.RaiderChieftain: goblin raider involved in the attack on the grove - some lines before the attack, one in the aftermath
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingFriendAtGate: Memnos and Arka express relief upon surviving the attack on the druid grove.
session_synopses.RaiderHefty: A goblin raider before/after the raid on the druid grove.
session_synopses.Servant001: Ilderin spent the attack locked in a bunker and we're speaking to her after successfully defeating the goblins. Despite having been saved by us, she is pious and unwelcoming.
session_synopses.AD_PotionRaiders: Two raiders are raiding Ethel's supplies and drinking random potions.
session_synopses.Melee_001: goblin raider attacking a druid grove full of tiefling refugees in a huge assault
session_synopses.AD_Sappers: Three goblin sappers (with explosives) are bored after a fight
session_synopses.AD_TrainerAndGatekeeper: Small talk between Asharak and Elegis at the gate. They're both frightened and looking for distraction.
session_synopses.AD_GrieflingFriend: Memnos prays to any god who might listen as the grove he's sheltering prepares to face an onslaught of goblin attackers.
session_synopses.ParentA: Parent is hiding away in the refuge, awaiting the attack.
session_synopses.Refugee001: Refugee before/after the goblins raid the grove. She has become numb, resigned to her fate.
session_synopses.AD_GettingArmed: Guex is telling some reluctant non-combatant tieflings to arm themselves for the road ahead. He speaks while looking over them picking through a pile of weapons.
session_synopses.WarchiefBrave: goblin raider participating in a huge attack on a peaceful druid grove full of tiefling refugees
session_synopses.TieflingLeader: Zevlor is tense - he's awaiting a long-expected attack on the grove, and the player is likely here to confirm it or perhaps even strike the first blow against him. Zevlor's usual tone is all stiff upper-lip, but at certain points we'll see the cracks start to form.
session_synopses.Ranged_001: The goblins have just won a bloody victory over innocent civilians.
session_synopses.Servant003: Orran spent the attack locked inside the druid lair. We only speak to him in the victory state. He thanks us for our help, but is still keen on us leaving, though he stays polite.
session_synopses.AD_InstructionsForKids: Rikka is firmly giving instructions to children before they depart on a dangerous journey.

session_synopses.AD_Adventurer2AtGate: Plea from one of the adventurers at the gates.
session_synopses.PAD_RaidersDefeated: Context: The raiders that were attacking during plea at the gates have been defeated. Characters ponder what next.
session_synopses.PAD_ConfrontationResolved: READ IN FULL, YOU HAVE TO SCROLL DOWN:VB that plays after DEN_RaidingParty_Confrontation. The dialog ends either with peace having been achieved or with one leader being knocked out by either the opposing leader or a player.This VB has a greeting for each outcome, but there really are three main categories: Player punched a leader, the leaders punched each other OR piece was achieved.Requires two speakers.Speaker 1 is the player who was in the Confrontation dialog, and as such may have punched one of the leaders.Speaker 2 is an accompanying character and as such may be opinionated.
session_synopses.PleaAtTheGate: Initial situation dialog. Adventurers are at the gates of the Den, pleading to be let in while tieflings refuse them entry since goblins are on their trail.
session_synopses.AD_WyllCharge: Originally only meant for Wyll's jumping into combat line.
session_synopses.AD_LeadersArgue: Argument that loops over itself while the leader await the arrival of the player. They are both furious and high-energy, having just survived the goblin encounter.
session_synopses.Adventurer1: Robbed adventurer raiding party and Adventurers Qest dialogues (one-liners). Is fallback for Adventurers Quest in the event Adventurer Leader and Adventurer Raider die.
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerWakesUp: Player when the adventurer leader wakes up after being knocked out in the confrontation of Raiding Party.
session_synopses.OpenGate: The goblins have been narrowly beaten. From on top of the tall front gate, Zevlor shouts down to us, then to someone relatively on his level to open the gate.
session_synopses.AdventurerLeader: Minor dialogues before and after Aradin/ Zevlor's confrontation insider the camp.
session_synopses.Adventurer2:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She’s sarcastic and casually racist.

session_synopses.PAD_Cyanide: Context: Nettie has given the player a vial of poison to take if they start turning into mind flayers. Players reflect on whether they should actually take it if the time comes.Speaker 1 has just promised Nettie they will take the poison if they begin to turn. (SPEAK TO JORDI, The Speaker 1 nodes may need to be changed. )Speaker 2 reacts to Speaker 1 acquiring the poison after swearing to Nettie they'll use it if they start to turn.Gale - Shadowheart: We'll resort to poison if necessary.Lae'zel - Astarion - Wyll - Karlach: It won't come to that - don't entertain the option.
session_synopses.Cyanide: Nettie leads the player into a lab and fetches a thorn. The player doesn't know, but the thorn is a deadly poison. Nettie knows it's the only choice she has - the player could transform into a monster and kill everyone in the camp. She sees this as a kindness - the transformation is terrible - so she has a very 'matter of fact nurse' tone about the whole thing before she scratches you, but will get stressed if you resist. Once she's scratched the player, her tone will be softer - kinder. She plans to sit with you while you pass and make it as easy as possible. The player will have to convince her they're not a threat if they're going to get the antidote. She'll be slow to convince, hesitant to allow any risk to the camp. Nettie is STANDING for this entire dialog.
session_synopses.AD_Busy: Nettie is dealing with a player and has been interrupted by another player.
session_synopses: Nettie is the apprentice of Halsin, the missing druid. We can tell her about the parasite in our heads. She listens with compassion but decides the player is too dangerous and must be quarantined. If she knows about the parasite, she'll invite the player to come with her deeper into her rooms for "treatement."
session_synopses.AD: This triggers as Nettie is at her desk in Halsin's lab, researching and organising. The bird she was treating may have died at this point.
session_synopses.Bird: This bird has been told to go and find Halsin and you're interupting him just as he's getting ready to take flight. He's tense and in a hurry to be gone, so he'll only answer one question before taking to the skies and carrying out his mission.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledStart: Nettie's comments as she walks with the 'infected' player to the storage room, where they will be quarantined.
session_synopses.HealedBird: The 'Wounded Bird' that Nettie was treating after some time has passed (after Goblin Hunt or Attack on Den). The bird's recovering and feels a bit better.
session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleResearch: Player read Halsin's research on the mind flayer tadpole. The VB plays only if they didn't find Halsin already and didn't go through the tadpoled scene with Nettie (otherwise they got all that information from her so it's not a surprise).
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledCombat: The player triggered combat during the tadpoled scene
session_synopses.AD_WithBird: Nettie is tending to a badly wounded bird. The bird is weak, its life hangs in the balance, but Nettie is doing what she can.
session_synopses.LockedUp: During the scene where she scratches you. Nettie is in the lab, sitting at a table, studiying Halsin's notes. The player can still try to persuade her to give the antidote. The player must also accept to take the wyvern poison. The other choice is to kill Nettie.

VB_UnlockedStudy.speaker: Player
VB_UnlockedStudy.text: Well well, what have we here.

VB_EmptyHolder.speaker: Player
VB_EmptyHolder.text: The stone's less worn here. Recently uncovered.

VB_LockedLibrary.speaker: Player
VB_LockedLibrary.text: I can't even see a lock to pick.

FrescoWorking.speaker: Narrator
FrescoWorking.text:
*'The forest rose with claw and tooth
to tear the darkness from its roots.'*

FrescoWorking.speaker: Narrator
FrescoWorking.text: *The mural depicts druid and beast fighting together to drive monsters from their land.*

FrescoWorking.speaker: Narrator
FrescoWorking.text: *It looks like they were victorious. And yet the monsters have returned.*

FrescoVictory.speaker: Narrator
FrescoVictory.text:
*'The towers seized, the battle done,
the moonrise broke the Darkest One.'*

FrescoVictory.speaker: Narrator
FrescoVictory.text: *History or myth. Whatever is depicted here is long past.*

session_synopses.VB_UnlockedStudy: |You retrieved the missing wolf rune, placed it back in the socket, clicked on the 4 runes and now the wolf statue is sinking down in the ground, revealing spiral stairs.|
session_synopses.VB_EmptyHolder: Player finds a slot in the wall where you can fit a slab of stone. This is where we'll place a stone rune, if we find one.
session_synopses.VB_LockedLibrary: Player tries to open a stone door, but it's just a blank slab. There's no place for a key.
session_synopses.FrescoWorking: Player is viewing a mural depicting druids and animals driving monsters from the forest.
session_synopses.FrescoVictory: In a well-lit cave. Player looks at a fresco depicting a group of druids standing over a vanquished army. Pass a test to realise that the army was the army of Shar - a Dark Goddess.

PAD_TunnelTurret.speaker: Player
PAD_TunnelTurret.text: Glowing eyes are rarely a good sign. Best be careful.

session_synopses.PAD_TunnelTurret: Played when discovering one of the druid turret totems.

AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.speaker: Olodan
AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.text: Nature's ruination! You have spoiled everything!

SnakesCourt.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druids are holding court. The child stands with a snake guarding her, facing judgment. She cries out an apology.

SnakesCourt.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt.text: This is madness, Kagha. She's just a...

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: A what, Rath? A thief? A poison? A threat?

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: I will imprison the devil. And I will cast out every stranger.
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Tsk. That damned nose of yours has gone poking in our business.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Shh-shh. No need. It couldn't be helped.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Kagha! What is the meaning of this?

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You think yourself quite the spy, don't you? Go on - tell him.

Denouncing.speaker: Player
Denouncing.text: Forget it, rat. You can explain it yourself.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You'd decline the honour? Very well.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Halsin's always welcomed untouchables to your midst. Defiled the grove for the sake of 'harmony'.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: We've come from Cloakwood to correct his mistakes.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Cloakwood... Shadow Druids? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

PAD_FoundSecretLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundSecretLocation.text: Odd - someone's cut a notch in the tree there.

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Rath
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She's dead. Kagha, we are guardians, not killers!

AD_ReactToDeadKid.speaker: Kagha
AD_ReactToDeadKid.text: She knew the danger. She still tried to run.

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *The rat has hardly left Kagha's side. A distant thought claws at your mind...*

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *... but slips away before it comes into focus.*

AD_OpposedDenounce.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedDenounce.context: NodeContext: An edge of anger in his voice. He was betrayed and is sorting through it.

AD_OpposedDenounce.speaker: Kagha
AD_OpposedDenounce.text: If it's an argument you seek, you won't find it here.

AD_OpposedDenounce.speaker: Kagha
AD_OpposedDenounce.text: Whatever the Treefather's judgement, I will accept it in full.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: Shadow Druids? There's more to Kagha than meets the eye.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: It's time we had a talk with her, don't you think?

AD_OpposedPacified.speaker: Rath
AD_OpposedPacified.text: So much death. So little justice.

KidFreed.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed.text: Ugh. I'm never gonna hear the end of this.

KidFreed.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed.text: If I'd got that stupid idol, I'd be a hero.

KidFreed.speaker: Player
KidFreed.text: What kind of hero did you expect to be?

KidFreed.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed.text: A heroic thief! Mum, Dad, Mol - they all would've been so impressed.

KidFreed.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed.text: Mol said we had to do something, because the old folks weren't doing anything.

KidFreed.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed.text: They were talking when the druids were getting ready to throw us out.

KidFreed.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed.text: Why can't we just stay until it's safe?

session_synopses.AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba: Leader of the shadow druids ADs in combat.
session_synopses.SnakesCourt: Druids hold court to determine whether or not to lock up a tiefling child for stealing their precious artifact. If you fail to stop them, the child tries to run and is attacked by their guardian snakes.Sagha the druid leader is the main player in this scene. She is machiavellian, and flips to evil should the snakes attack the child.
session_synopses.Denouncing: You have confronted Kagha about being a Shadow Druid. This has initiated the transformation of the rats into shadow druids before your very eyes. The shadow druids welcome the circle into their fold; you have to fight, or convince Kagha to come around, which will be very hard - and even harder if the kid died before. Olodan the shadow druid is their leader; slobbering and sleazy.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundSecretLocation: Player notice the tree that contains Kagha's letter from the Shadow Druids. They might find it by chance or know it was there.The note that sends players here reads like this: [The marks crisscrossing the page don't look scribed so much as slashed.]Kagha.Swamp-docks. Tree. Meet me. Alone.Olodan.
session_synopses.AD_ReactToDeadKid: Rath reacts to the tiefling girl being killed by Sagha's snake. Sagha responds coldly.
session_synopses.001: Shadow Druid in rat shape. Trying to use speak with animals or animal handling results in nothing.
session_synopses.AD_OpposedDenounce: Player persuaded Kagha to not join the shadow druids after all. Kagha and Rath survived the combat and are talking together now. Kagha is good, repentant.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter: Player found and read the recruitment letter that Kagha got from the Shadow Druids.
session_synopses.AD_OpposedPacified: Plays after the "Denouncing Kagha" scene, when Kagha is dead. When she is alive, Rath and Kagha have an AD together
session_synopses.KidFreed: |Arabella (Snake Kid) after she ran away from the druid lair.|

Dead.speaker: Rolan
Dead.text: To Baldur's Gate... to Lorroakan... my destiny.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: Those goblins will rue the day they chose to tangle with this grove.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: You and I will do some good here - I can feel it.

session_synopses.Dead: Rolan has been killed. Even in corpse form, his desire to become the greatest wizard in all of Faerun is clear.
session_synopses.Sister: This occurs after the argument betwen Lia and Rolan. Lia is still stewing after the fight. Opportunity to get to know her better and understand the group dynamics.

AD_Guards.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards.text: Don't do this to me, Kanon.

Friend.speaker: Memnos
Friend.text: So much death. So much waste.
Friend.context: NodeContext: Arka is dead. Cold grief - not falling apart, but trying to keep it together.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Ain't sure why ya protected me. Don't care, neither.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: It's too late to make friends, worgmeat. My tribe's comin'.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: They're gonna burn this pretty place for the glory of the Absolute and 'ang ya by yer guts.

Caged.speaker: Player
Caged.text: The Absolute? Can't say I know your god.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: We're burnin' Her name across the face o' the world, we are.
Caged.context: NodeContext: speaking of her god - the Absolute - awe.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: The Absolute is gold from the sky, She is. The blessin' in the storm an' the storm itself.
Caged.context: NodeContext: speaking of her god - the Absolute - awe.

Caged.speaker: Player
Caged.text: An all-powerful goddess that can't get you out of a cage?

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Maybe She sent you to help me. An' ya will, if ya wanna save yer skin.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: And if the tiefs stick a few arrows in us on the way out of here, don't worry. Priestess Gut'll patch us up.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Ain't sure why ya killed yer own to protect me. Don't care, neither.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Mocking

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: It's too late to make friends, worgmeat. My tribe's comin'.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking satisfaction

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: They're gonna burn this pretty place for the glory of the Absolute and 'ang ya by yer guts.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking satisfaction

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: They can try, but they won't be the first goblins I've killed today.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Yeah, 'ow many were there? Four?

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: We got more than ya can 'andle. We're gonna tear yer gate down an' peel yer skins off.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Unless... unless ya listen to me. I can save ya.
node_data.context: NodeContext: cunning

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Help me escape, an' I'll tell my mates to leave ya alone.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Wot do ya say? We 'ave a deal?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It's a deal, signed and struck.

node_data.speaker: Sazza
node_data.text: Then hurry up an' do it. My tribe ain't as friendly as I am.

PAD_Healer.speaker: Player
PAD_Healer.text: A goblin healer? That's a new one. But she might be the only way to keep our skulls intact.

PAD_Healer.speaker: Player
PAD_Healer.text: She's worth talking to, at least.

AD.speaker: Sazza
AD.text: Ah, feels good to be free.

AD.speaker: Sazza
AD.text: I'll repay ya for the favour, 'ave no doubt.

PAD_Freed.speaker: Player
PAD_Freed.text: That goblin is in my debt - should prove useful one day.

PAD_Freed.speaker: Player
PAD_Freed.text: Or it'll come back to haunt us.
PAD_Freed.context: NodeContext: Karlach: A little naive but sincere.

session_synopses.AD_Guards: Several conditions of conversations between Arka and Memnos here: Sazza escaped, sazza was killed, the pair wait for the goblin attack at the gates, or Arka's brother, Kanon, has been killed by goblins.
session_synopses.Friend: Memnos - the supporting optional tiefling character in the Captive Goblin situation, Friend to Arka.
session_synopses.Caged: Character is caged for this entire dialogue If the player saves the goblin captive from being killed, the goblin will try to convince the player to free them and then meet the player later in the goblin camp.
session_synopses:
If the player saves the goblin captive from being killed, the goblin will try to convince the player to free them and then meet the player later in the goblin camp. Note from Swen on this dialogue: ''I also want a different emotion in there. This goblin is negotiating with me. Think a terrorist that is locked up and who is offering their interrogators an option to save their lives if they free her.
It'll be quite the intense conversation.''
session_synopses.PAD_Healer: Played after being told by Sazza about Gut.Speaker 1 is the character who left the dialog. Neutral inquisitive remark about whether the rumoured healer could really help.Speaker 2 is any other party member. Line can be opinionated.
session_synopses.AD: Sazza's ADs when she's in the druid grove. She's in a cage for most of these, or could have been broken out by the player. She's at risk of life and limb but that doesn't stop her from antagonizing everyone around her.
session_synopses.PAD_Freed: This VB plays after Sazza was escorted outside of the Grove.The dialog may play with one or two speakers.Speaker 1 is the character who helped her escape.Speaker 2 is an accompanying party member, and as such may have an opinion on the issue.

session_synopses.AD_Birdsong: Ad where the bird sings (when he is persuaded to sing instead of caring about his nest).
session_synopses.AD_004: Animal sound AD for pet boar in druid grove

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: You came! I have - here! Mol said I should thank you properly. For the harpies.
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: The kid takes something out of his back pocket. If you can suggest that he's holding a pageoff-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: So I wrote you a story!
InHideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: If you can suggest that he's offering the player a page off-camera, that would be very good.

InHideout.speaker: Player
InHideout.text: I've heard enough of your chatter. I don't need more.

InHideout.speaker: Mirkon
InHideout.text: Oh. Umm... okay, I'll... keep it.
InHideout.context: NodeContext: The player refused his gift, saying it's junk

AfterHarpyEncounter.speaker: Mirkon
AfterHarpyEncounter.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cowering in fear (he's hunkering down, with his hands over his face/ears). Scripter note: Use the generic cower or some approximation for consistency with scripter animations.

AfterHarpyEncounter.speaker: Player
AfterHarpyEncounter.text: They're gone. Are you all right?

AD_PlayerWarnings.speaker: Player
AD_PlayerWarnings.context: NodeContext: wondering, a little bit in awe.

CharmedVictim.speaker: Mirkon
CharmedVictim.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome isn't looking at the player, but in the direction the singing comes from.NodeContext: in awe, entranced. Trying not to disturb the singer.

session_synopses.InHideout: You encounter the kid you saved from the harpies in the children's hideout. He wants to thank you, but is still a little shy.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerCharmed: AD when the player is charmed by the harpies.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerUncharmed: AD played when player wakes up from being charmed by the harpies.
session_synopses.AD_GnomeUncharmed: The tiefling kid wakes up fron his trance, he's panicked and (almost) crying because he's so frightened.
session_synopses.AfterHarpyEncounter: Non-critical path. The player has just saved the child from harpies that had enchanted and tried to eat him. He's shy and still scared.
session_synopses.AD_PlayerWarnings: AD played when the player gets close to the harpy situation, warning them that something is amiss.
session_synopses.CharmedVictim: Non-critical path. Unless the player has snapped him out of it, the boy will be enchanted and wanting to get closer to the source of the song.

Captain_AD_TakingTurn_Combat.speaker: Za'krug
Captain_AD_TakingTurn_Combat.text: I'll bleed every last one of you!

PAD_DiscoverTrap.speaker: Player
PAD_DiscoverTrap.text: I don't like the look of that mushroom. I should stay clear.

session_synopses.PAD_DiscoverTrap: The player has discovered a hostile looking mushroom in the DEN Grove Prison. It's origins are from the Underdark, but have been planted by an inquisitive druid.

AD_GreetingPlayer.speaker: Asharak
AD_GreetingPlayer.context: NodeContext: Introducing the player to his students.

session_synopses.AD_GreetingPlayer: Trainer introducing the player to the class. The player has just walked up.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: |Cinematic: The woman cradled a carved wooden box, from which a soft melody chimed.|
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lost in thought, holding the box as it's the most precious thing in the world.NodeContext: Sitting

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Close that box. The music is grating.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: Oh! Of course, how thoughtless. I beg your pardon - I'm not fan of it myself, truth be told.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Closing the music box mid-sentence, cutting music off.NodeContext: Caught by surprise, embarrassed. The last line is her awkward effort at getting you on-side by agreeing with you.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: Said as much to my husband when he made the bloody thing.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: But it kept our little monster quiet. Reason to love it if nothing else, trust me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A tired and exasperated parent, remembering.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: ... how much do you think it's worth? Old Ethel said she'd offer me gold for it.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She closes the box and plays her fingers along the lid. Abruptly, she offers it up.NodeContext: Hesitant and suddenly serious, intent on  your response

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Sell it? I don't think your 'little monster' would like that.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: No, she would not. Near screamed our ears off when my husband tried to leave it in Elturel.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Rueful, remembering her daughter's tantrum

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: We tried to travel light, but... when the gnolls found us, we couldn't... they couldn't run-
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Breaking down into tears as she tries to tell the storyNodeContext: Deep regret, breaking up towards end of sentence

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: I don't... what else can I do? They say you need coin to enter the city. For bribes.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Composing herself, trying to be pragmatic

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: This isn't my problem.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: ... you're right. I'm sure you don't want to listen to my prattling. Sorry.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Hurt but hiding it - she's just told you something heartbreaking and you've dismissed her trauma.

session_synopses: Nerela is wondering whether to sell a music box, the only memento she has of the husband and daughter who were killed by gnolls on the road here. It's a scam - her story is fabricated and the box is a dime a dozen. Player can comfort her or see through her story. Her overall demeanour is weary, fragile (unless you uncover her scam)

RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.text: I told them to run, the idiots.

RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurerAtCorpses.text: You better turn north here, or you'll end up like them.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Ah, the fighting foulblood. Glad to know one of you has a spine.
RaidAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: She cleans her wound, a cut on her arm with a [cleaning cloth]

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer.text: I already regret saving your life.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Ah - bruised your feelings, did I? Excuse me if I don't weep - got problems of my own.
RaidAdventurer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Finishes cleaning wound and puts the [cleaning cloth] away.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: My arm's near hanging off after wise Zevlor left us to die at the gate.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: And then he has the bloody gall to try and blame it all on us.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer.text: He let you in, didn't he? It could have been worse.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: You're trying to be gracious and she's not having any of it.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: We expected a soft job. Something to test the new lad, maybe, but not a bloody goblin nest.
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: She's justifying her actions - they'd taken on a job that seemed simple but quickly got out of hand. People died and she's doggedly maintaining that she's the victim. More explanatory than whiny, though.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Most would've turned tail at the sight. But not Liam, no - he charged them, the stupid bastard.
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: She's genuinely hurt at the loss of this recruit but projecting a knowing persona to hide it, as if his bravery is somehow a rookie mistake. Note of incredulity rather than laughing at him, as if he did something very stupid.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Player
RaidAdventurer.text: I'm guessing that didn't end well.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Nah. He... must've thought we were following. Always the optimist, was Liam.
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: Rare moment of honesty and reflection. Still trying to act tough, but thinking about the fact that Liam may have actually looked up to her and she's let him down.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Hope they cut him down quick before he saw we were gone.
RaidAdventurer.context: NodeContext: Quietly - she's ashamed but still trying to brush it off.

AD_AtCorpses.speaker: Aradin
AD_AtCorpses.text: Lucky you. Done with this shite.

LeaderAtCorpses.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses.text: Thought you was busy with the foulbloods in Halsin's grove.

session_synopses.RaidAdventurerAtCorpses: The adventurer is standing next to the corpses of her comrades she left behind while running for the goblins.
session_synopses.RaidAdventurer:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She’s sarcastic and casually racist.
session_synopses.AD_AtCorpses: Gallows humour, grimly delivered - the 'you' are the corpses of his fallen comrades, who he finds in a forest. But  he's effectively talking to himself.
session_synopses.LeaderAtCorpses: Aradin comes across the corpses of some of his friends, who were lost during the goblin raid. He's in a neutral location at a bridge and observing the corpses of his people and of goblins, who were also killed in the fight.
session_synopses.AD_LeavingCorpses: After encountering some dead adventurers in the forest, Aradin urges his remaining company to keep moving (only plays if he's not alone).
session_synopses.AD_AdventurerCleaningWound: Remira is cleaning a wound she got from the goblins. She winces and grunts in pain while checking out the damage.

AD.speaker: Tracker Torrack
AD.text: No sign of the others yet. You think the fight up front went... bad?

AD.speaker: Warrior Gresh
AD.text: Shut it. Boss would rip ya for talking that way.

AD.speaker: Tracker Worm
AD.text: Least we got the druid to keep ourselves entertained.

AD.speaker: Sharp-Eye Gurza
AD.text: He's boring. Let's find another one.

session_synopses.AD: A quartet of goblins scouts are torturing a druid they captured in the tunnels, trying to find out the location of a weapon for the Absolute. They expect the other goblins will be bursting in the front gate of the grove any minute, and are unaware the others were defeated.
session_synopses.AD_Tracks: Player recognises goblin tracks and comments.

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Did that...? No, damn it. Still nothing.

TieflingGuard5.speaker: Pandirna
TieflingGuard5.text: Maybe - maybe it just needs time to wear off. Fingers crossed the goblins don't return any time soon.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: You. Saw you fighting those slimy bastards.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bowl in hand, paused mid preperation of gruel. Next to a pot with a ladle in hand. Looking at the player, appears annoyed. NodeContext: Gruff sounding. Shouldn't be clear if you're annoyed at the player or not.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds the bowl out to the player. Nods towards it, doesn't expect to be refused. NodeContext: Gruff as you hand the food to the player. Doesn't expect the player to refuse.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: Best to fill your belly now - while we still can.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holding the bowl out. NodeContext: Warmth to her voice despite the gruff exterior. She's obviously concerned about the player but is hiding it.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: See how you feel when your pack is empty - it'll be this or a handful of weeds.
RefugeeChef.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shrug as Okta pulls the bowl back towards herself. NodeContext: Player has rudely turned down your food. You're annoyed and offended.

RefugeeChef.speaker: Okta
RefugeeChef.text: We'll need every bit of strength to make it to Baldur's Gate. Trust me.
RefugeeChef.context: NodeContext: Thinks the player is being a spoilt idiot.Sounds very annoyed now.

AD_TieflingGuard1.speaker: Rikka
AD_TieflingGuard1.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's staring at the dead below.NodeContext: Shocked and scared.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.text: Did you pass out a bowl to everyone?
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Worried about leaving and is trying to busy herself and her son. Sounds gruff but warm.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Mother is chiding him about preparing to leave. He speaks in reassuring tones, he knows she's just worried.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.text: You didn't offer anything to that old woman, did you?
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Suspects the woman is dangerous but is trying to hide it. Passing it off with indifference.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Ikaron
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.text: No. You told me not to.
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Worried for a brief second as he thinks he made a mistake.

AD_TieflingGuard3_8.speaker: Okta
AD_TieflingGuard3_8.context: NodeContext: Feigning indifference, hiding her relief.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear lifts up his head, sniffs the air and goes back to sleep.

ElevatorBear.speaker: Tuffet
ElevatorBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear lifts its head and starts roaring at us. The roar turns into a yawn midway, and he goes back to sleep.

TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
TieflingGuard8.text: We've known enough grief this tenday, traveller.

TieflingGuard8.speaker: Ikaron
TieflingGuard8.text: Don't be the cause of more.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: Glad you made it inside... doubt we'll be safe here for long though.
Gatekeeper.context: NodeContext: twitchy - she's watching the tree-line as she speaks, expecting an attack

Gatekeeper.speaker: Elegis
Gatekeeper.text: There'll be more coming. Goblins hunt in packs.

Gatekeeper.speaker: Player
Gatekeeper.text: You're scared of a few goblins? Pathetic.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Aradin's back with his tail between his legs. I'm glad for your help, but I'd hoped you were Halsin.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: The druid in charge of this grove. At least, he was.

TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
TieflingGuard4.text: Guess if he didn't come back with Aradin, that might not be the case.

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: O Selûne, Our Lady of Silver.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: praying for her dead friend. The goddess she addresses is Selune (seh-LOON-eh)

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: Please, may he rest by Your side.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: praying over the body of her dead friend

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He always knew what to say... when I was homesick.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.text: He never let it show, but he was homesick, too.
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

AD_CorpseMove.speaker: Rikka
AD_CorpseMove.context: NodeContext: remembering her dead friend while standing over his body

VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.text: *Here lies Zevlor. He saved us when all hope seemed lost. Thank you, friend.*
VB_Grave_TieflingLeader.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

AD_TieflingGuard10.speaker: Lakrissa
AD_TieflingGuard10.text: Goblins, gnolls... so many ways to die.
AD_TieflingGuard10.context: NodeContext: Morbid jokes about how to die - jovial.

PAD_ShadowheartBook.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBook.text: A temple of Shar? Where? And what's this about a curse?
PAD_ShadowheartBook.context: NodeContext: First she's heard of this temple.

PAD_BearStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_BearStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Forest Father, we are granted balance.*

AD_Refugee1.speaker: Eramas
AD_Refugee1.text: Is that everything? I think that's everything...

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: Try it again. I dare you.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: You barged in without an invitation. I wouldn't call that friendly.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: See, you're in my territory. And I want you gone.

Squirrel.speaker: Player
Squirrel.text: Back off, squirrel. Or I'll make you.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: Okay, okay, calm down. We can make a deal.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: How about this - you can stay if you keep those ugly feet on the ground.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: I'll even sweeten the pot. Found some weird smelling stuff on the ground. You can keep it. But...
Squirrel.context: NodeContext: sweet but an edge to your voice at the end. You're about to threaten.

Squirrel.speaker: Timber
Squirrel.text: The trees are mine. Follow the rules, and I won't have to intervene. Got it?

PAD_EntranceStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_EntranceStatue.text: *This grove is kept by Silvanus' faithful.*

GruntingKid_Hideout.speaker: Doni
GruntingKid_Hideout.context: CinematicNodeContext: with a nod of greetingNodeContext: abrupt greeting

Refugee4.speaker: Toron
Refugee4.text: We should get moving. Goblins are bound to regroup eventually.
Refugee4.context: NodeContext: Glimmer of hope. Eager to get moving.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.context: NodeContext: Putting on a good front, but slightly afraid. Should still sound confident though.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: My friend's blood not enough? Come to rip me open too?
TieflingGuard11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tiefling raises his weapon half-heartedly.

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Player
TieflingGuard11.text: You've seen other githyanki? Tell me where - or I'll have your head.
TieflingGuard11.context: InternalNodeContext: Prior to gith chokepoint, otherwise this info is useless to the player so failing this option might have them reload for nothing

TieflingGuard11.speaker: Zorru
TieflingGuard11.text: Stand back, toad. I owe you nothing!

AD_Adventurer02.speaker: Barth
AD_Adventurer02.text: Damn this. Damn them. Damn everything.

VB_Grave_AdventurerLeader.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_AdventurerLeader.text: *Here lies Aradin. He yearned for glory and adventure. And he got it.*
VB_Grave_AdventurerLeader.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

VB_Grave_Kanon.speaker: Narrator
VB_Grave_Kanon.text: *Here lies Kanon. He gave his life defending others. He will be missed.*
VB_Grave_Kanon.context: NodeContext: Standing over a grave and reading the headstone.

Rat.speaker: Rat
Rat.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spooked by the hissNodeContext: Scared

AD_TieflingGuard4.speaker: Kaldani
AD_TieflingGuard4.context: NodeContext: Sighing, she's walking around and noticing more problems than solutions in the grove that has become a refugee camp for her people

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: How do you drow do that - find pleasure in killing? I got a goblin myself, yesterday. Shot her through the throat.
Tiefling001.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's closed off, crossing one arm over the other to hug herself, uncomfortable with what she did.

Tiefling001.speaker: Player
Tiefling001.text: I find no pleasure in killing, only regret.

Tiefling001.speaker: Rikka
Tiefling001.text: So even someone like you... feels like this? This is how it is? And it's just going to keep happening...
Tiefling001.context: NodeContext: Instead of giving Rikka strength, what the player told her is pulling her further into herself.

GraveDig.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig.text: *Freshly turned soil shifts beneath your feet as you approach the grave.*
GraveDig.context: NodeContext: The player has approached the grave of the very recently deceased.

GraveDig.speaker: Player
GraveDig.text: Look around cautiously, then dig with your hands.
CinematicNodeContext: Player looks left, then right and then kneels down. Claws at the dirt in an attempt to dig but quickly becomes frustrated and stops as it's not really doing anything.
GraveDig.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks left, then right and then kneels down. Claws at the dirt in an attempt to dig but quickly becomes frustrated and stops as it's not really doing anything.

GraveDig.speaker: Narrator
GraveDig.text: *Your fingers claw at the dirt, losing purchase. If only you had a tool for this.*

Mule2.speaker: Hungry Ox
Mule2.context: NodeContext: Disinterested in the player - you just want to eat.

PAD_ElkStatue.speaker: Narrator
PAD_ElkStatue.text: *By Silvanus, the Old Oak, all death begets life.*

session_synopses.TieflingGuard5: She drank a potion given to her by the hag, with the promise that it would make her strong as steel. It did, but it has paralysed her legs. The effects are temporary, but she's angry and embarassed at the situation she's found herself. She doesn't suspect any foul play on the hag's part. We get a clue about this mysterious old woman selling potions in the cave, and through tagged gameplay can reveal that she's been duped. She is frustrated at herself - she wanted to help in the goblin fight, and instead she is sprawled on the ground.
session_synopses.RefugeeChef: An older woman, responsible for feeding an entire camp of refugees before they leave. She is gruff but has a heart of gold. She offers the player some gruel. Purpose is to highlight how desperate their situation is.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard1: AD for a shelshocked tiefling patrolling the bridge and looking at the dead below. Older tiefling.
session_synopses.PAD_ElevatorUnusable: VB when the player clicks on the elevator, but it's blocked by the bear lying on top of it.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard3_8: This occurs between Okta and Ikaron. Okta is the grumpy chef in the camp and Ikaron is her son, a surly but caring guard. The purpose of these is to highlight their relationship, and how both of them care deeply for the camp, even if they're not the best at expressing it.
session_synopses.ElevatorBear: A bear is sleeping on the elevator, blocking it off from use. She's very tired and doesn't want to get up
session_synopses.TieflingGuard8: A stoic guard. You're a stranger in his camp, and he warns you no to cause trouble. They've already lost a lot of people.
session_synopses.Gatekeeper: Tiefling in charge of operating the gate at the druid's grove. She saw goblins attack and saw the player(s) help to repel them. She's nervous that more attacks will be coming and that the grove's defenses won't hold, which makes her eager to get on the road to Baldur's Gate as soon as possible.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard4: Non-critpath. A tiefling who sees the confrontation with a human adventurer at the grove as part of a systemic prejudice against tieflings. He carelessly led goblins to a grove full of tiefling children, and she doesn't think he'd have done that if there were humans there.
session_synopses.AD_CorpseMove: Two tieflings standing over the body of their killed comrade, about to bury him. Rikka is frustrated and angry in her grief, Kaldani tries to be the voice of reason.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_TieflingLeader: This is the grave of Zevlor, the tiefling leader. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.PAD_ShadowheartBook: Shadowheart reads a book in the druid grove that suggests theres' a temple dedicated to her patron goddess somewhere in the region.
session_synopses.PAD_BearStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.AD_Refugee1: Preparing to go to Baldur's Gate, wondering what to bring.
session_synopses.Squirrel: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the squirrel communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the squirrel speaks like a human. She shouldn't sound like a disney animal. She's serious about getting the player to leave - she sees them as a threat - but she's also cocky about it. She doesn't think she'll have any problem beating the player the player to a pulp.Players encounter the squirrel in the druid grove. For all he knows, they're encroaching on HER territory, and she wants them out. Players have several options to deal with him in SwA - persuading or intimidating her. In both versions, they can kick her to death, if they choose.
session_synopses.PAD_EntranceStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.
session_synopses.GruntingKid_Hideout: Non-critpath. A child who speaks solely in grunts in the thiefling hiedout.
session_synopses.Refugee4: A refugee, anxious about the goblins beyond the gates and the druids within.
session_synopses.TieflingGuard11: Tiefling is afraid of githyanki - he's seen one gut his friend while they were scouting.
session_synopses.AD_Adventurer02: A gruff adventurer complains about being stuck in a grove full of refugees. Wants to get back to the city. Speaking to himself. Grumbling.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_AdventurerLeader: This is the grave of Aradin, the adventurer leader. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.VB_Grave_Kanon: This is the grave of Kanon, the tiefling who died at the gate of the grove. He was killed by goblins. The player is reading out the sign above their grave.
session_synopses.AD_Gatekeeper: A tiefling refugee stands watch on a battlement, unnerved and unsettled. Also has a line for her relief when the danger is gone - 'we can finallly leave'.
session_synopses.Rat: This dialogue has two versions: SwA and non-SwA. In the non-SwA version, the rat communicates via squeaks or through the narrator.In the SwA version, the rat speaks like a human. He can have some rat-like tendencies in hs delivery, but he shouldn't have a squeaky voice or come across comical.Players encounter the rat in the druid grove. He's in pain, with a chipped tooth. He chipped it on an item in a nearby chest. If players are nice to him, he'll lead them to the chest. If players remove the item, the rat excitedly jumps into the chest.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingGuard4: Thie tiefling refugee is trying to keep an optimistic view of things, but as she walks around the grove that they're using as a shelter, she sees too many problems and not enough solutions
session_synopses.Tiefling001: This tiefling recently killed a goblin and is trying to progress the grueling death she caused. She's trying to be strong, but is deeply traumatized. Depending on the player's answer, she'll express her frustration at not being able to deal with it,be shocked, or sink deeper into depression.
session_synopses.GraveDig: This occurs in the DEN. The dead can be Kanon, Aradin or Zevlor. It is a recently made grave.
session_synopses.Mule2: An ox used by the tiefling refugees to tow their wagons. Currently  grazing in the druid grove, it seems bored and unaffected by the dramas unfolding around it.
session_synopses.PAD_ElkStatue: A plaque in the druid grove devoted to Silvanus, god of nature and balance.

session_synopses.WRLD_CleaningTable_Hag: World Behavior for Auntie Ethel wiping down tables while in Hag form
session_synopses.WRLD_TendFlowers_HumanForm: Timeline dialog for Auntie Ethel in human form tending flowers
session_synopses.WRLD_EatingFromTrough: Timeline scene trigger for sheep eating from a trough

IllusionRedcap.speaker: Narrator
IllusionRedcap.text: *The sheep's voice warbles. You realise it's trying to say 'Baa'.*

IllusionRedcap.speaker: Player
IllusionRedcap.text: Drop your eyes and carefully reach out.

session_synopses.IllusionRedcap:
This occurs in the swamp. Sheep wander the area - except they're redcaps (a type of violent faerie) hidden by the hag's illusions. The creatures are pretending to be sheep. 
The illusion can be shattered by an animal handling check. OR if the player preciously succeeded in a perception check in the area.

SurrogateMother.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother.text: Where's the teahouse? What's going on?
SurrogateMother.context: InternalNodeContext: Ethel is in the lair but Mayrina is not in the Lair.

SurrogateMother.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother.text: I got you away from Ethel. You're welcome.

SurrogateMother.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother.text: But where did she go? What is going on?
SurrogateMother.context: NodeContext: Trying to make sense of things. You break off as you jump - frightened.

SurrogateMother.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother.context: NodeContext: Frightened and trying to keep it together as you look around.

SurrogateMother.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother.text: Stay put. I'll be back soon.

Husband.speaker: Connor Vinderblad
Husband.context: NodeContext: Guttural and disturbing. You're a zombie that has a decomposing jaw.

PAD_AfterResurrection.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterResurrection.text: Not quite the outcome intended, but I must say - the technique was excellent.

PAD_AfterResurrection.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterResurrection.text: The spell is cast - what's done is done.

AD_HusbandGrave.speaker: Player
AD_HusbandGrave.text: 'Here lies Connor - beloved husband, and a tasty little morsel to boot.'
AD_HusbandGrave.context: NodeContext: Above a gravestone - a cruel jab.

session_synopses.SurrogateMother: These are the main dialogue states for Mayrina. They included - when the player rescues Mayrina, when the player kills the hag, when the illusion dissapates,  and her main dialogue states in the teahouse (bottom two branches.)
session_synopses.Husband: Mayrina's husband has been resurrected - but he's not the man she married. He's a horrible and decomposing zombie.
session_synopses.PAD_AfterResurrection: The player's found a wand in the Hag's lair and tried to use it to resurrect Mayrina's husband. Unfortunately, it was cursed and he only came back a zombie. The players reflect on using items from evil beings.
session_synopses.AD_HusbandGrave: This occurs above the grave of Connor, Mayrina's husband. It was written by the hag and is a cruel jab.

PAD_HeroGear.speaker: Player
PAD_HeroGear.text: Sword and a hat. Wonder whose.

session_synopses.PAD_HeroGear: A fine sword and feathered hat protrude from the bog. A successful passive Investigation check suggests that long ago a hero came here to slay something, but didn't make it past the first patch of soft ground.

PAD_TriedTart.speaker: Player
PAD_TriedTart.text: Gods spare me, why did I think eating a second one was a good idea?

AD_Occupied.speaker: GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHag, GROUP_Act1_GLO_HagHuman
AD_Occupied.text: Wait just a moment, sweetie. Auntie is busy.
AD_Occupied.context: NodeContext: Someone has tried to talk to you and you've gently asked them to wait. Cheery and pleasant.

session_synopses.PAD_TriedTart: Player eats a disguised Hag Tart, not knowing it's truly rotten and noxious. Brave (or foolish) players can eat the tart a second time, deepening their misery.
session_synopses.AD_Occupied: The hag has been blocked from conversation and another player has tried to speak to her.

Victim_003_PAD_HeartAttack.speaker: Player
Victim_003_PAD_HeartAttack.text: The hag's doing. It has to be.

Victim_001_AD_Dying.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001_AD_Dying.text: The Bite! No. I don't want to die. I don't - Argh.
Victim_001_AD_Dying.context: NodeContext: You're about to puke your guts up and die a horrible death. You feel it coming - you're panicked, scared and terrified.

session_synopses.Victim_003_PAD_HeartAttack: The Player has forced Lorin, the prescient victim, out of his corner in the hag lair. He begs Ethel for mercy, then clutches his chest as he dies of a heart attack - punishment for leaving his post.
session_synopses.Victim_001_AD_Dying: Edgecase for if you don't speak to the victim and he has to die. You're about to puke your guts up after being de-petrified

HusbandGraveForcefield.speaker: Player
HusbandGraveForcefield.context: NodeContext: You just tried to touch a coffin, but it has a forcefield, which hits you with psychic damage.

session_synopses.HusbandGraveForcefield: A forcefield surrounds a coffin. Everytime you touch it, it causes more psychic damage.

session_synopses.Dead: We can speak to Gandrel if he dies - he'll hint at his mission to hunt Astarion on behalf of Maiden Fel. Separate options if it's Astarion himself speaking to him.

session_synopses.Frog_AtReward: This is a small frog in the swamp lands.She has been twisted by Ethel's magic and is desperately trying not to hurt the player - doing everything she can to hold back. If Ethel is dead, the frog is very cheerful and sing song - hopping about. If they player asks for a reward, she cheerfully spits on their shoes and hops off.

AD_HagThankPlayer.text: Come here and let me see you proper, petal. We need to chat.

AD_Argument.speaker: Demir
AD_Argument.text: She went to see you. We know she did.
AD_Argument.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm the situation - you don't want it to get violent and you're also terrified of Ethel/

AD_Argument.text: You know absolutely nothing, you eejit.
AD_Argument.context: NodeContext: Said with a laugh as your shrug the accusations off.

AD_Argument.speaker: Johl
AD_Argument.context: NodeContext: Voice rising. You're getting more angry and you're tired of Ethel dodging your accusations.

Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied.context: NodeContext: You're brother has just died in front of you.

Brother_001_AD_Fallback.speaker: Demir
Brother_001_AD_Fallback.context: NodeContext: Looking around, scared but trying not to show it.

Brother_002_AD_BrotherDied.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_AD_BrotherDied.context: NodeContext: Your brother has died in front of you.

session_synopses.AD_HagThankPlayer: This occurs after the ambush. Player has sided with Ethel and killed the brothers. Player has either not spoken to Ethel yet OR they are wildshaped and cannot speak.
session_synopses.AD_Argument: This argument is the beginning of the situation. The three of them are yelling at each other out in the open. The brothers believe Ethel has taken their sister, while she is denying any knowledge of the girl.
session_synopses.Brother_001_AD_BrotherDied: Occurs when Demir's brother dies in front of him.
session_synopses.Brother_001_AD_Fallback: Player tries to speak to the brother while either the other brother is in the shared Brothers dialogue (and this one missed it for some reason), or because they're waiting for the hag to come back into the house and start her dialogue.

PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.text: Someone cut these men to pieces. I doubt they had time to scream.
PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.context: InternalNodeContext: No idea who brothers are

session_synopses.PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest: This occurs after the player has refused to help the brothers and subsequently finds them dead/one of them dead. It can trigger in the swamp, teahouse or lair, and you may not know that Ethel is a hag at this point (depending on where it triggers). In the first, you've met the brothers, in the second you skipped the confrontation and have no idea who these men are.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Praise his ever-bleedin' axe, praise his throne of flamin' iron. Praise Maglubiyet!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He's speaking to his god, staring upNodeContext: Chanting a prayer fiercely - ma-GLUB-i-yet is the name of his god

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Tryin' to interrupt my prayers? Scared of a real god? You're as gormless as the rest of 'em.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He turns his attention to the playerNodeContext: Sneering, aggressive, but locked in a cage

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Gormless? I'm not the one behind bars.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: They'll turn on you soon enuff... then you'll be wishin' you woz in a cage.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking advice

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: You'll end up bein' supper for the spiders or the worgs.
node_data.context: NodeContext: mocking

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: And why did they turn on you?

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Cuz I'm loyal to Maglubiyet! Cuz I ain't havin' my 'ed turned by some upstart god!
node_data.context: NodeContext: insistent - ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Gods are fickle. Maglubiyet doesn't give a damn about you.

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Maglubiyet's looked out for me since I was knee-high to a worg-pup.
node_data.context: NodeContext: ma-GLUB-i-yet is his god, sincerely proud of his god

node_data.speaker: Brakkal
node_data.text: Bollocks to this Absolute, I say. And bollocks to you an' all.
node_data.context: NodeContext: annoyed

Saved.speaker: Brakkal
Saved.text: Ha! Look at where the Absolute's love got 'em. Dead!
Saved.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblin was saved from the cage and his attackers are dealt with.NodeContext: happy to see lots of dead heretics

Saved.speaker: Brakkal
Saved.text: Thanks for breakin' me out. Gonna find me a new tribe. One that appreciates the old ways.

session_synopses: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage.
session_synopses.Saved: A goblin who still follows the old goblin god, Maglubiyet, while the rest of his tribe have started to follow a new god, the Absolute. He sees them as heretics - they think the same of him, and have locked him in a cage. He thanks players after they save him.

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: So yer followin' me? Think yer intimidatin' now?

Friend2.speaker: Brawler Tiny
Friend2.text: I ain't scared. I'll claw yer eyes out if you come any closer.

session_synopses.Dead: SwD dialog for Crusher, an absolute legend (pun intended) among the goblin tribe.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Huk
node_data.text: Hmph.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: He waves you off, while he keeps looking at the goblin boss.

session_synopses: This goblin is watching his boss in awe and doesn't want to be sisturbed. When he speaks, he does so in hushed tones.

Parent.speaker: Brawler Birka
Parent.context: NodeContext: Proud that the bear died

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.text: Pardon the viscera. One should cherish all of nature's bounty... but goblin guts are quite far down the list.
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.context: InternalNodeContext: Intro happens only once, that's why Global FlagNodeContext: Hint of wry humour, Introducing himself after transforming from an owlbear and killing several goblins.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.text: You aided a bear without knowing if it would savage you? A true friend of nature - or perhaps a lunatic.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.text: Either way, I owe thanks. I am the druid Halsin.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat.text: Well, consider me introduced. And consider me grateful.

Kid_002.speaker: Three
Kid_002.text: It was so big but... it died so easy.
Kid_002.context: NodeContext: disappointed, doesn't really understand what's going on.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The bear is tucked away in a corner, trying to make himself small.InternalNodeContext: default - not met, didn't speak about leaving the captiveNodeContext: excited/in awe because he made a bear squeal.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: Giggle before the line. She's excited because the woman makes noises when they throw stones at her.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: stern - she's trying to turn this torture into a learning experience for the kids.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Three picks up a stone and throws it, hitting the bear in its faceNodeContext: A little humph of excertion while Three throws the stone.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks up at us, growling in pain.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.text: Again! Again! Make it squeal again!

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks at our backs as we turn away, as if begging us to help it.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear.text: That's it. I'm putting a stop to this.

Beastmaster002.speaker: Beastmaster Zurk
Beastmaster002.text: Ever tried cuttin' up an elf? All skin an' bones, the rangy gits. My arm's gonna be sore tomorrow.

Halsin_Following.speaker: Player
Halsin_Following.text: Gesture for him to wait here.

session_synopses.Parent: Goblin parent standing next to the goblin kinds throwing stones at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.HalsinsBear_AfterCombat: Halsin, arch-druid of the Emerald Grove, is  freed from the goblins and changes back from bear form, thanking the players. They can ask him about their tadpole problem, but he wants help saving the grove first - either by killing the goblin leadership or defending the grove, whichever is applicable. The player can insist on learning what they can from him to help with their tadpole, if they wish.
session_synopses.Kid_002: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.GroupDialogWithBear: Player finds a group of goblin kids throwing stones at a bear, spurred on by their mother. The bear is the arch druid Halsin, in bear form. He won't make this apparent to the player, even if they have Speak with Animals.
session_synopses.Beastmaster002: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.Halsin_Following: Halsin, arch-druid of the Emerald Grove, is  following the player inside the Goblin Camp in his bear form, trying to find and kill the goblin leadership. The player can tell him to hold his position.

Dead.speaker: Player
Dead.text: Tell me where I can find a healer.

Attack_AssaultCustom.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Attack_AssaultCustom.text: You defile the Absolute's name. Boys!

session_synopses.Dead: The player interrogates Dror Ragzlin's corpse about Z'Rell, Halsin, and Moonrise Towers. His N+1 info means he can be forced to talk even if the player killed him.
session_synopses.Attack_AssaultCustom: Goblin king sees player commit a crime and initiates attack.

Torturers_Spike_AssaultCustom.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_AssaultCustom.text: |I still have info to exctract from prisoner. Don't do anything funny!|

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: You been out there spillin' blood for the Absolute?
node_data.context: NodeContext: appraising the player

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I've been busy - other matters needed my attention.

node_data.speaker: Zurga
node_data.text: Wot's more important than rippin' into some soft-gut? Get out there and kick some arse!
node_data.context: NodeContext: frustrated

session_synopses: Sober goblin, tough, itching for a fight.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Gnat
node_data.text: True Soul, eh? Figured the Absolute had standards.

session_synopses: Goblin absolutely enamoured with his own king and less impressed with the player.

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin raises a club, ready to hit the adventurer, but then notices the player and stops.NodeContext: He's torturing an adventurer and getting sadistic pleasure from this.

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.text: You again? Wanna join 'im this time?

Torture.speaker: Player
Torture.text: Why are you still torturing him?

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.text: Some other git found the grove before we did. Made us look real stupid, 'e did.
Torture.context: NodeContext: a little sour at the memory

Torture.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torture.text: So now we're makin' sure this lad regrets not tellin' us.
Torture.context: NodeContext: deriving sadistic pleasure from this.

session_synopses.Torture: One of the goblins is torturing a prisoner, either to find out where the grove is, or just because he wants to. The player can try to get rid of him - if Shadowheart is present, she gives some advice on how to do so. If Shadowheart is the avatar, she has unique options criticising the goblin's techniques.
session_synopses.Rat_000: Rat in the torture cell who is starving because all the prisoners have been carted away.

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Ain't polite to stare, worm-wart. If you ain't got the guts to get branded, clear off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dismissive

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll be marked soon, don't worry.

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Priestess'll sort you out. Only thing she likes more than prayin' is burnin' folk...
node_data.context: NodeContext: amused

session_synopses: Newly-converted goblin is eager to talk about the virtues of the  the Absolute. He's full of religious zeal and relative good cheer, which is amplified if he finds the players are on the same side. Or pretending to be.

node_data.speaker: Tracker Tozad
node_data.text: If yer plannin' to talk ta the drow, watch yerself - she's in a right mood.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nervous and deferential (when speaking to a drow) Insulting (when speaking to a Tiefling)  Friendly word of advice (if speaking to neither a drow or tiefling).

session_synopses: A female goblin grunt. Nervous and respectful to drow, insulting towards tieflings. World-weary and advisory to others.

node_data.speaker: Polma
node_data.text: You. Not supposed to be here. Leave!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Slow, stupid. Identifying us, pointing on 'you'. Then figuring out we're trespassing before roaring at us to 'leave'.

session_synopses: An ogre that acts as a guard in the goblin priestess' chapel. Will warn players away if they enter the chapel area - will attack them if they escape from the priestess' dungeon.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Awshh... drink's goin' straight through me...
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk, to the point he's slightly unsteady on his feet

Goblin006.speaker: Player
Goblin006.text: The only cure is drinking more - as fast as you can.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: That's the plan! We looted an entire inn - brought back enough booze to drown a dragon.
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk - explaining the reasons for the party with respect and excitement

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Here's to them we nicked it off! Down one mug of ale for every throat we cut!
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: as if proposing a toast; he's drinking and celebrating

GoblinKid001.speaker: Five
GoblinKid001.context: NodeContext: "horns" line is a kid impressed by an adult who has ACTUAL HORNS - other line is dismissive and bratty

GoblinSleeper_01.speaker: Tracker Dullwill
GoblinSleeper_01.text: Try to keep it down, boss. My head's killing me.
GoblinSleeper_01.context: NodeContext: holding his head, wincing in pain from a hangover, trying to be respectful

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.text: You look like you got something jingling in your pocket.
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing in front of his goods, laid out on a blanket

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Ugh. You look like you've been kissin' a worg's backside.
GoblinKid000.context: CinematicNodeContext: waving his hand in front of his nose, exaggerating a bad smellNodeContext: disgusted and amused - reacting to player having dung smeared on their face. Worg is a wolf-like animal (

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Piss off, or you'll end up like this bleeder.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: cocky, aggressive - 'this bleeder' is a dead adventurer at his feet

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: Keep threatening me. See what happens.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Oh,  you're real tough. Bullying a kid.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: we fell for his bait and now he's mocking us

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Sod off or I'll fetch my mum. She was tough as worg meat before the Absolute came along.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: mocking- Like a teenager doing a "my dad could beat up your dad" bit. Heavy emphasis on 'before' to set up the follow-up in the following line.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Now... she could punch out a dragon!
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: Exaggerating but kind of believes it. Pause after 'now' as he punches a fist into his other palm

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Vaws-hak. My head hurts bad. You crash about like a drunken ogre.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: CinematicNodeContext: perhaps stmik walks into shot if the player is hitting the wall.NodeContext: (Vors-hack) means death - here delievered as an angry curse on waking. Not shouted. Seeting with anger, just woke and has a bad headache from drinking

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.text: Didn't think drow were so clumsy. Leave us to rest.
BugbearSleeper_00.context: NodeContext: annoyed, but doesn't want to start a fight with a drow so trying to appease

Goblin001.speaker: Warrior Sul
Goblin001.text: This ale tastes like hobgoblin spit. Who's been pukin' in the barrel?

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001.text: Meat ain't ready yet - dwarves take an age to roast.
DwarfOperator001.context: NodeContext: he's cooking a dead dwarf on a spit, thinks we want a piece

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001.text: D'ya fancy a hunk of dwarf meat, under-dweller? He ain't ready yet.
DwarfOperator001.context: NodeContext: he's cooking a dead dwarf on a spit - 'under-dweller' refers to the fact the player is a duergar, a dark dwarf

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator001.text: Where did you find a dwarf?

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001.text: He found us! Dunno wot he was doin' 'ere or where he came from.
DwarfOperator001.context: NodeContext: responding to player asking about the dead dwarf he's cooking

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001.text: Lads inside are tryin' to get answers out of one of his mates.
DwarfOperator001.context: NodeContext: 'tryin' to get answers' means 'torturing'. He's enjoying telling us this.

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Player
DwarfOperator001.text: I can get you answers. Where's the prisoner?

DwarfOperator001.speaker: Tracker Grikka
DwarfOperator001.text: Enjoy pokin' holes in people do ya?
DwarfOperator001.context: NodeContext: amused, we just told him we're willing to help his friends torture somebody

Bugbear_Wanderer.speaker: Bao'ek'nuk
Bugbear_Wanderer.text: You find the ones who poisoned that beer, you bring 'em to me. I'll take their heads for free.

Bugbear_Wanderer.speaker: Bao'ek'nuk
Bugbear_Wanderer.text: Poisonin' the only good thing in this dump...
Bugbear_Wanderer.context: NodeContext: grumbled, not really to the player.

Goblin004.speaker: Sharp-Eye Mirg
Goblin004.text: Quit pesterin' me - I'm tryin' to watch the game!
Goblin004.context: InternalNodeContext: Watching the chaseNodeContext: Friendly.

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: Hey... hey! You ain't roundin' me up for no raid. No way. I'm DRINKIN'!
Goblin005.context: NodeContext: She's boozy and aggressive - especially if you try to stop her having another drink. Friendly as could be if you join her in a drink.

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: Sorry yer drowship... didn't mean nothin' by it. I'm here to serve.
