session_synopses.Goblin006: A goblin at a party who has had far too much to drink already. He's celebrating the raid in which the goblins stole all of the booze they're now working their way through.
session_synopses.GoblinKid001: a young goblin kid hanging out with his friends on the periphery of a party. Insulting and rude.
session_synopses.Ogre_00: This ogre has two states: one where he's enjoying the festivities, and one where he is angry at the person who interrupted the festivities.
session_synopses.GoblinSleeper_01: A drunk, sleeping goblin. If woken, he's tired and angry, and likely to attack the player
session_synopses.Trader: Grat is selling items laid out on a blanket in the middle of a drunken celebration in the goblin camp. He's not participating in the drinking - he expects to make a good bit of coin off his drunk mates.
session_synopses.GoblinKid000: A goblin kid, hanging out with two friends at the goblin camp near the corpse of a dead adventurer. He's trying to sound tough, like a cocky teenager impressing his friends.
session_synopses.BugbearSleeper_00: A sleeping bugbear is woken by the players hitting a nearby wall. Like a very angry drunk, woken up with a sore head. Guttural voice - not stupid-sounding, but savage and sinister.
session_synopses.Goblin001: A goblin drinking merrily at a party - tipsy.
session_synopses.DwarfOperator001: This goblin is operating a spit, cooking a dead dwarf. He's in a festive area, where his friends are celebrating a recent raid. The dwarf was captured when attempting to steal something from the goblin camp, and he'll tell us a little about that.
session_synopses.Bugbear_Wanderer: A very grumpy bugbear guard who'd rather be sleeping.
session_synopses.Goblin004: A goblin enjoying the festivities following a successful raid. Fairly relaxed, not very drunk yet. Not particularly interested in conversation - occupied with the game of chicken chase happening nearby, drinking and trying to forget a painful wound.
session_synopses.Goblin005: A drunk goblin who is trying to get out of doing any more raiding

Tunnel.speaker: Narrator
Tunnel.text: *Decaying legs protrude from the hole - a failed escape, it seems.*
Tunnel.context: CinematicNodeContext: See the legs sticking out of the hole

Tunnel.speaker: Narrator
Tunnel.text: *It seems the tunnel collapsed mid-dig and suffocated him. A crooked heart is embroidered on his left shoe.*
Tunnel.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player is crouched and looking intently at the body

Guard.speaker: Warrior Plig
Guard.text: Steal somethin' or act the bollocks, will ya? I'm itching to throw someone in the brig. It'll be fun. I promise.
Guard.context: NodeContext: plig wants the player to act out so she can throw them in jail

session_synopses.Tunnel: A body is found protruding out of a tunnel in the GOB prison. For patch 6: After pulling the body out, the player can use the tunnel to instantly escape. Patch 7: the player will need to find a shovel to dig their way out, but this will be outside the dialogue.
session_synopses.Guard: Warrior Plig is a goblin on patrol around the wolf pens in the goblin camp. She's bored and wishing for some action.

PoisoningInterrogation.context: NodeContext: Spotting the player and accusing them of being the one who poisoned their beer (and comrades)

PoisoningInterrogation.speaker: Narrator
PoisoningInterrogation.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

PoisoningInterrogation.speaker: Player
PoisoningInterrogation.text: If I'd poisoned you, do you really think I'd still be here?
Or you just thought we'd be stupid enough to believe ya!
PoisoningInterrogation.context: NodeContext: We gave a lousy excuse and they're seeing right through it. They're going to attack us now.

session_synopses.PoisoningInterrogation: One of the goblins stops the player and accusses them of poisoning their beer and thus killing some of the goblins.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Clack
node_data.text: If yer close enough to talk with me, then yer too damn close.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Busy sharpening spears, a bit brusque.

session_synopses: Impatient goblin sharpening his spears while guarding a heretical goblin. A bit of an attitude to this one.

Melee_01.speaker: Yerle
Melee_01.context: NodeContext: Flat, stony-faced. You keep trying to talk to her and she has no interest.

session_synopses.Melee_01: This guard is more aggressive than her counterpart. She's a thug/bouncer, and you're trying to stick your nose where you have no business.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: That was... intense. Wouldn't want to bump into that thing while it was still alive.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little incredulous. The ritual is done, so he can speak freely.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: But goblins give you no pause?

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: Someone needs to keep an eye on these buggers.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. He's concentrating more on the ritual that is about to start/just ended.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: I don't make a habit of questioning the Absolute. Now quiet.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. Still a little hushed. He's concentrating more on the ritual that is about to start/just ended.

session_synopses: Human cultist watching the Goblin King perform the Speak With Dead spell.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Nrog
node_data.text: Priestess burned ya, then? Thought I smelled somethin' tasty cookin'.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sniffs player before delivering line.NodeContext: Sniffs at player again before delivering line. Tone is mocking but friendly.

session_synopses: This goblin is standing guard inside temple - he's a little more relaxed than his zealous companion. Offers 'beginners' advice to player. As hostile as any other goblin if you try to pass without his superior's permission.

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: Huh? What do you want? I'm tryin' to concentrate on readin'!
node_data.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Can I see the manuscript?

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: I ain't finished with it! There's enough readin' here to last me a lifetime.
node_data.context: NodeContext: indignant

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You should spend your time in prayer - not reading this nonsense.
True

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: S'pose you're right. Absolute rewards faith, not book-learnin'.
node_data.context: NodeContext: after being persuaded to give something away - pleased to have learned something

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: Take it. Maybe if I pray hard enough I can get some of that booyahg for myself.

session_synopses: He is smarter than your average goblin, and is reading a manuscript - loose papers, freshly written by Volo. It's a study of goblin behaviour that would give anyone who reads it an advantage in combat against goblins.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: That the jingle of coin I hear? You've timed it well, my friend.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Custom CamNodeContext: Warm and welcoming (a kind of mercantile 'Who do we have here?')

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Already turned quite the profit today, so I'm feeling generous.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Trying to coax you into a deal

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What business does someone like you have in a goblin camp?

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: You joking? Goblins sell the best prisoners - cheap, quiet, and eager to be elsewhere.
node_data.context: NodeContext: You've made the assumption that there's nothing worth trading with goblins - she's the expert correcting you. As if giving tips to a novice

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Till this crowd converted and started sending their captives to Moonrise Towers, at least.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Correcting herself. Tone is rueful - some of her best trading partners have fallen to organised religion.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: No complaints, mind - I just sold enough smokepowder to cover the loss ten times over.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Perking up - she still managed to make a profit. Always a bright side.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What do the goblins want smokepowder for?

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Ask the drow they're all bowing to. That glint in her eye is bad news for someone.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Shrug - it's not her problem, but she pities whoever the drow is planning to deal with.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Not my concern, so long as I'm paid. Speaking of - something to trade, or what?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Shrugging, getting back to the matter at hand. She's used to minding her own business - and everything is just business to her.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Now - much obliged for the chat, but I'm here to trade.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Insincere about the chat - she's just Impatient to get back to the matter at hand.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Let me see your wares.

node_data.speaker: Roah Moonglow
node_data.text: Pleasure.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Affable.

session_synopses: A trader from the Zhentarim (z-HENT-ah-rim) , a shady organisation of spies, assassins and dealers in illicit goods. The player may or may not recognise her as such, but either way her attitude is blunt, breezy and unscrupulous. She's there to make money, and you're either there to make a deal or wasting her time - she has absolutely no interest in indecision or moralizing.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Zami
node_data.text: Ain't you got sumfin' better to do?
node_data.context: NodeContext: dismissive

session_synopses: A goblin who doesn't have a lot of respect or time for players who are bothering her while she's trying to mingle with her fellow raiders

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: That's lovely stuff, True Soul. Only... we smack that drum so the lads know there's killin' on.
AlarmUsedReaction.context: NodeContext: Goblin repsects player and is impressed by the song they played.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: Not to worry! I'll set 'em straight. Bit of music never hurt anyone, eh?

Guard005.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
Guard005.text: I can see the Absolute from here. I can!

Guard004.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004.context: InternalNodeContext: fallback for alt entry pathsNodeContext: Player is allowed inside; 'leave me alone' intention here.

Worg_001.speaker: Klaw
Worg_001.text: Wearin' me muck. Muck on ya. Good muck.
Worg_001.context: NodeContext: Sniffing and snuffling at the shit on your face. Spoken quickly, primal.

CliffWarning.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
CliffWarning.text: Oi, thicko! This here's off-limits. Get to the main gate, or I'll plug you full o' arrows.
CliffWarning.context: NodeContext: Warning an intruder to leave  - shouting last line

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Well! Look who's gettin' dragged back. And by such high company! How badly did you mess up?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Olak to Sazza, a fellow goblin he doesn't have respect for.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Can it! I know something Ragzlin will want to hear.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Sazza is ragging on Olak. They don't like each other.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: I been in some druids' grove. This one sprang me. Now move over, so I can tell Ragzlin myself!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Sazza is arguing on the player's behalf to the hostile Olak.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Hold on. Where are the raiders?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Olak is full of gleeful malice.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Ragzlin's drow friend won't be happy to hear that.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: She'll be happy enough when I tell her where them looters is holin' up. Let me through.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Hard 'g' on ranga. Sazza's pride is wounded but she hates Olak, so doesn't want to show it.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Go on. I ain't gonna hold up a drow.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: CinematicNodeContext: Olak turns to the playerNodeContext: To player. Cool and malicious.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: C'mon! Gotta let the drow True Soul know where them looters is. We'll be heroes!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: To player. More bright and friendly.

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: ... an' the gnoll gnawed 'er arm clean off. So much for the Flamin' Fist, eh?
Backup002.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to other goblins at table.

Backup002.speaker: Devout Wasp
Backup002.text: The Fist? Merc pigs from Baldur's Gate. Good for one thing: feedin' to worgs.

Worg_002.speaker: Small Klaw
Worg_002.text: Good smell. Pack smell. Smell like papa. Papa?
Worg_002.context: NodeContext: Sniffing at the shit on your face. Quick, primal - as if looking for comfort.

Trespassing.text: Oi, stand back! Where'd you come from?
Trespassing.context: NodeContext: Affronted, player is trespassing and has been spotted

Trespassing.speaker: Narrator
Trespassing.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

session_synopses.AlarmUsedReaction: The player used the alarm drum, which is meant to alert other guards that there are enemies attacking. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.
session_synopses.Guard005: Goblin standing on a hill. Fibbing like a child about what he can see.
session_synopses.Guard004: Goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Laconic; gruff.
session_synopses.Worg_001: Squirrely, quick-breathing, animalian worg (wolf-like creature) stands guard at a checkpoint with its masters.
session_synopses.CliffWarning: Goblin warns an intruder to leave
session_synopses.ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin:
If the player released the captured goblin in Halsin's den, the CG will be waiting for the player at the checkpoint. When the player starts the dialog with the main guard at the checkpoint (or gets closer to him) and the CG is at the checkpoint, this dialog is shown. After this dialog, the CG leaves the checkpoint and the main guard gets his normal dialog back.

 Olak and Sazza have a very antagonistic relationship, ripping each other to shreds.
session_synopses.Backup002: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. Telling a story of the inn ransacking. Really into violence :)
session_synopses.Worg_002: An attack beast used to mistreatment stands guard with its masters. Fearful, vengeful beast.
session_synopses.Trespassing: The player can enter the trespassing area from the checkpoint side or from camp side. Different reactions from the checkpoint guards.

Spiders.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders.text: Yes, my desire. Closer, my sweet!
Spiders.context: NodeContext: Excited, drooling with desire to eat us.

Spiders.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders.text: I will wrap you, and bind you, and bite you, and eat you.
Spiders.context: NodeContext: Excited, almost to herself, thinking about how she'll eat us

Spiders.speaker: Player
Spiders.text: You should eat a goblin instead. They're delicious.

Spiders.speaker: Larger Giant Spider
Spiders.text: Delicious - I do not know. But cruel and sharp - yes. Bindable and wrappable and biteable - yes.
Spiders.context: NodeContext: delighted, preparing to escape and feast on goblins who have held it captive

Adventurer.speaker: Smythin
Adventurer.text: Thanks. I thought I was done for.

CapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
CapturedGoblin.text: Let me go. I'll sneak off and become a hermit - won't cause trouble for nobody.
CapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: pleading; just survived an attempted execution

session_synopses.Spiders: Non-critpath. Two giant spiders trap the player. The one that shoots the web is female. Her companion is her brother.  The player has a chance to convince the spiders they are friendly, setting the spiders loose on the goblins in the camp above.
session_synopses.Adventurer: an adventurer who survived being thrown into the goblins' spider pit
session_synopses.CapturedGoblin: Sazza after she survives 'execution' the the spider pit. Pleading to the player to let her leave (which she will if she's not killed)

ThreeWayDialog.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialog.text: Mistress! It's me, yer loyal servant, Sazza. I'm back - an' I brought a friend.

ThreeWayDialog.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
ThreeWayDialog.text: How thoughtful. And where did you find this friend?

session_synopses.ThreeWayDialog:
The players approach the drow commander at the goblin camp, escorted by a goblin who they rescued from a nearby druid grove. The drow is seeking that grove and upon learning its location from the goblin will prepare to raid it, demanding that the player help.

If the goblin recognises that the player is a True Soul - a figure of authority - her life will be spared. If she does not recognise this, the drow will execute her unless the player intervenes on her behalf.

Goblin.speaker: Brawler Rancer
Goblin.text: Tha's the that of it. Heh!

session_synopses.Goblin: He's super drunk and is talking to himself more than to you.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Roo
node_data.text: You a True Soul then, eh? The Absolute'll make me one too.

session_synopses: Goblin in camp, jealous that he isn't a true soul yet.

session_synopses.CINE_ClimbUp: Cinematic Cutscene with the character using a ladder to get from the Underdark to the Goblin Camp

Chains.speaker: Narrator
Chains.text: *You test the weight of the chains, looking for weak points.*
Chains.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The player chained with their arms behind, they're attached to a stone post

Chains.speaker: Player
Chains.text: Dislocate your wrist and wriggle free.

Chains.speaker: Narrator
Chains.text: *A sharp pain shoots through your arm as the bone pops out of place. The chains hold tight.*

session_synopses.Chains: Character is interacting with the priestess' chains.

EyeMurder_AD.speaker: Dror Ragzlin, Erna, GROUP_Goblins, Nightwarden Minthara, Yerle
EyeMurder_AD.text: 'S dead. Spied one too many bowels movin', I expect.
EyeMurder_AD.context: NodeContext: Satisfied contempt - the goblins hated this creepy thing and are glad it's dead

session_synopses.EyeMurder_AD: A one-time line triggered when a goblin guard spots the dead scrying eye.

Tiny.speaker: Smaller Giant Spider
Tiny.text: You are no goblin. Who are you? Answer me or die.

Tiny.speaker: Player
Tiny.text: Just a visitor. I mean you no harm.

Tiny.speaker: Smaller Giant Spider
Tiny.text: You don't mean harm. I do.

session_synopses.Tiny: A giant spider confronts players when they enter the pit where it is captive. It is hostile, but can be persuaded not to attack.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
node_data.text: Don't worry on the worgs, cavey. They won't eat anyfink wot grows in the ground.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Normal back-and-forth.NodeContext: Takes pleasure in trying to intimidate the player - if the player triggers the Underdark option, he's snide about it as well.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
node_data.text: Might still kill ya, mind.

session_synopses: Goblin is (gleefully) warning player about wandering down into the wolf pens.

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage.text: Don't go botherin' my pigeon! He's mine.
Guard_AtCage.context: NodeContext: annoyed, defensive - the 'pigeon' is in fact Volo, a human captive she's been forcing to sing; he's now locked behind a prison door

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Player
Guard_AtCage.text: Does your bird have a name?

Guard_AtCage.speaker: Gribbo
Guard_AtCage.context: NodeContext: thinking on the spot - 'Pidge' is the name she's just come up with for her captive (pronounced as the first syllable of 'pigeon')

session_synopses.Guard_AtCage: Drunk, excited goblin who's guarding Volo and forcing him to sing even though Volo's no singer.

node_data.speaker: Devout Cry
node_data.text: Boss put ya to work, eh?

session_synopses: Goblin observer part of ritual. Wants you to be respectful of the king.

WarDrum.speaker: Narrator
WarDrum.text: *This mighty drum is powerful enough to be heard for miles. You need only strike it.*

WarDrum.speaker: Narrator
WarDrum.text: *Chaos ignites in the ruins around you. Goblins howl and spit, clawing for their weapons.*
WarDrum.context: InternalNodeContext: The player might play the drum again when the Backup and Checkpoint goblins are talking or dancing

session_synopses.WarDrum: The dialog for the alarm system. If the player activates it then the first half of the camp will become hostile.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Sudden, barked - she's on guard duty and takes it very seriously, assumes you're a drunkard coming in from the party outside.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Shut it, Graw. Olak cleared us - got a visitor for the drow, I do.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: As if at a yapping dog. Sazza and Graw have bad blood, and Sazza loves being in a position of authority above her.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: My arse - what's a True Soul want with any mate o' yours?
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disbelieving - to Graw, Sazza is the lowest of the low but has always had high opinion of herself.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Private business, that is. Raidin' business. But if anyone wants a pisspot guarded, we'll call.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Putting on airs - Sazza has been chosen to go out on raids, Graw hasn't, and Sazza's rubbing it in.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Just get your friend branded proper, right Sazza? Got better things to do th-
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disgusted, dismissive. Trying to have the last word and claim a scrap of authority by telling Sazza to the player marked so she doesn't have to stop us again. Cut off at the end by Sazza's reply

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: No you don't. Come on, then.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, bored, matter-of-fact. Snubbing Graw and sweeping past, addressing us to follow with the second line.

Backup_02.speaker: Tracker Tizg
Backup_02.text: Go on. If you've business in 'ere, best not to keep a True Soul waitin'.
Backup_02.context: NodeContext: Bored, done talking to you, ushering you inside

session_synopses.3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins: A three-way checkpoint dialog if Sazza (Captured Goblin) was freed in the Den. The guard would usually stop us but instead gives player free access to the Goblin Throne region.
session_synopses.Backup_02: Guard is bored and would rather be at the party outside.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: after casting a spell to speak with a corpse - matter of fact despite the weird situation

Dead.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Dead.context: NodeContext: men-zo-BEAR-an-zon is a city in the underdark

session_synopses.Dead: players use a spell to speak with the corpse of a powerful drow commander at the goblin camp

node_data.speaker: Warlock Bolt
node_data.text: I'd do what he says. Ain't wanna make the boss any madder 'n he already is.

session_synopses: Standard goblin guard. Grouchy.

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *The tiefling's corpse stirs with the spell.*

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Corpse_Dead.text: *You realise the tiefling's body has been torn open by huge hands.*

Corpse_Dead.speaker: Player
Corpse_Dead.text: Anything of value you happen to have?

session_synopses.Corpse_Dead: The player can cast Speak with Dead on a tiefling the ogres tore open to feed on.

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.text: I don't like this at all.
Dinner.context: NodeContext: This place is in the Hells, though Karlach doesn't realize that yet. She's put off but trying to stay cool.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: The House of Hope. Where the tired come to rest, and the famished come to feed - lavishly.
Dinner.context: CinematicNodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.NodeContext: He spreads his arms as he dramatically introduces this place.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: Go on. Partake. Enjoy your supper. After all...

session_synopses.Dinner: The monitor has teleported you to a mysterious room and offered you dinner - and a deal.

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Goblin Warrior
CheckpointGuards.text: 'Allo and welcome to Bogrot! Now, kindly - giz all your stuff.
CheckpointGuards.context: NodeContext: A goblin's closest approximation of courtesty, faintly mocking. He's loudly welcoming you to the town he has dubbed 'Bogrot'

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuards.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Git over there. Surround 'em, like.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing to the other goblinsNodeContext: In a loud whisper

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I know you're there. Show yourselves.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: You spotted us. Good. 'S like they say...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands on hips, cockyNodeContext: Covering up their surprise

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: No fun in skewerin' a pig what doesn't know he's cooked.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A threat

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I don't want any trouble.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: An' I didn't want to be stuck moppin' up nosy trespassers like you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: The goblin is annoyed to be stuck on guard duty

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Ain't no one gettin' their way today.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Or you turn around, an' your backside gets the same treatment.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Out of my way, or I'll cut you down first.
False

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: I'd like to see you try.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Smiling wickedly.NodeContext: They're looking forward to the fight they think they'll easily win.

session_synopses.CheckpointGuards: This goblin is guarding the entrance to a town his squad have occupied. The residents are long-dead, the town abandoned, and so he's taken it upon himself to rechristen the village as 'Bogrot'.
session_synopses.PAD_SpottedAmbush: This PAD plays if players pass a successful Perception check when entering an abandoned village. Goblins are sneaking around in the village, setting up an ambush.
session_synopses: This dialogue triggers when players enter a village being guarded by goblins. The goblins are on rooftops - the player may either be on the ground or on the rooftops with them (if they've snuck in). If the player has passed a perception check beforehand, the dialogue starts while the goblins are still getting into place for an ambush. Otherwise, the goblins are already in place, surrounding the player.If the player is not a drow, the goblins will attack the player at the end of the dialogue unless players can talk them out of it.

Goblin_02.speaker: Brawler Brek
Goblin_02.text: Hey... boss. Lots of your sort around these days.

AD_Boss.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_Boss.text: Gotta be somethin' in this heap.
AD_Boss.context: NodeContext: with disdain. isn't there anything interesting inthis shithole?

AD_Subordinates.speaker: Goblin Warrior
AD_Subordinates.text: And the others getting drunk off their choppers in camp.

AD_GoblinsLooting.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_GoblinsLooting.context: NodeContext: looking for results from subordinates she perceives as being idiots

session_synopses.Goblin_02: This goblin is leading a band of looters in an abandoned house. They're too distracted by greed to fight, but if the player persists they'll attack.
session_synopses.AD_Boss: A goblin is scouting the village looking for loot, weapons, something of value
session_synopses.AD_Subordinates: Frustrated goblins searching a derelict building, finding little. They're bitter they can't be getting drunk in camp with the others.
session_synopses.AD_GoblinsLooting: Frustrated goblins looting an empty derelict buiilding

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: A wine bottle? A scholar with good taste, perhaps.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Or maybe a bit of a drinking problem.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for FOR. The player finds a book hiding a secret bottle of wine.

Cultist002_Dead.speaker: Brynna
Cultist002_Dead.text: Brynna... a faithful... servant to... the Absolute...

session_synopses.Cultist002_Dead: Novice Brynna, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, is dead. Here, the player casts a spell to grant limited and temporary resurrection for the purpose of questioning her. From her, they can learn more about the cult's hierarchy, specfically the meaning of the 'True Soul' rank that is frequently referred to. Her ability to communicate after death is limited - cryptic, broken or repetitive answers to a small range of questions. If she recognises her killer, she can refuse to answer or else lie.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: Wha', fun's over? All right then...

session_synopses.AD_Leaving: A band of goblins elect to leave the area where they've been 'playing' with gnome prisoner after the player convinced them to clear off, one way or another. One goblin reacts to the decision to leave with slight disappointment.

ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.speaker: Narrator
ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.text: *This fight could have been avoided, but now you've made it inevitable.*
ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.context: NodeContext: Hostile. A pre-combat utterance potentially spoken by any goblin or worg at the windmill

session_synopses.ApproachedUnfortunateGnome: Rather than openly approaching the goblins/worgs near the windmill, a player snuck by and then gets spotted once they're near the windmill. Combat starts immediately.

session_synopses.AD_Mocking: Mocking a gnome that's spinning on an windmill.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: Fezzerk does the talking here. Bother him.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fez-erk

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are rotating him around for their amusement.The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using the amulet of the Conquering God as a way to convince the goblins,  if they took it from the priests in the wilderness. GnomeGobllin2 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. He doesn't have much to say; either snarling threats or grovelling to those who intimidate him (drow, in this case).

node_data.speaker: Chock
node_data.text: Friend. No eat friend.

session_synopses: Ogre in the middle of a meal. Dumb as a box of rocks.

session_synopses.AD: Player clicks on a sign in an abandoned village and receives its name: Moonhaven.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You feel the quake of its heavy footsteps before you see it: an owlbear, its beaked face looming out of the darkness.*

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: What's this? Something weak, something tender...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sizing up the player.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: Won't even have to chew you before I feed you to my son, softmeat.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Sorry - wrong cave. I'll be going.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: I don't think so. You've seen my nest. You've seen my cub.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: That makes you dangerous. An easy meal.

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: The meat tastes better when it's afraid.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Let me go, or you'll watch your cub die before I finish you.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Tagged for non-barbarians

node_data.text: False

node_data.speaker: Owlbear
node_data.text: I'll tear you in half before you touch a feather on his head.

VB_CubResolution_1P.speaker: Player
VB_CubResolution_1P.text: Nature can provide for the cub. Perhaps it'll live.
VB_CubResolution_1P.context: NodeContext: Reasoning decision to let an orphaned owlbear cub fend for itself.

AD_HatchedEgg.speaker: Player
AD_HatchedEgg.text: Owlbear eggshells... an unhatched one would fetch quite a price...
AD_HatchedEgg.context: NodeContext: Speaking from knowledge or experience. The player recognises the egg they've spotted and the price that an intact one could fetch.

VB_EnterCave.speaker: Player
VB_EnterCave.text: That stench... dead owlbear prey, no doubt.
VB_EnterCave.context: NodeContext: Upon entering the den of a carnivorous beast. Rotting, half-eaten prey are strewn about. The player previously identified the beast as an owlbear.

session_synopses: In SwA, the owlbear speaks like a human. Her voice is deep and threatening - the voice of a seasoned fighter, at home in a fight and used to winning. However, she knows she's injured and at a disadvantage, but refuses to betray that to the player. Doing so might encourage the player to attack, putting her cub in danger.The player stumbles upon the nest of an owlbear; a large, predatory hybrid creature. They find themselves in a stand-off against the beast - if they get too close or act aggressively, it attacks. If they keep cool and back off when the opportunity presents itself, the owlbear will let them leave. The player may also notice that the owlbear is wounded - a broken spear protrudes from one eye socket. They may notice that the owlbear has a cub - this is the main reason for her aggression and territoriality.Additional note 1: the player may stumble upon this scenario by themselves, or they may have been pointed in the right direction after meeting some cultists who had a close encounter with the owlbear. If we won these cultists over, they may be available to fight the owlbear at our side.Additional note 2: If the owlbear mother is killed but her cub survives, we can decide the juvenile's fate. If we spare it, we may later find it being used for sport by the goblins in their camp.
session_synopses.VB_CubResolution_1P: The players comment briefly on their decision to let an orphaned owlbear cub live or not.
session_synopses.AD_HatchedEgg: The party reacts to coming across some large empty eggshells, from an owlbear. They may recognise the species, or may have already picked up an intact egg.
session_synopses.VB_EnterCave: The player enters a cave that houses an owlbear - a large, aggressive wild beast. They might comment on the stench of half-eaten prey, or note that some tracks they discovered lead into the cave.

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *A candy-sweet scent wafts forth: the sussur bark infuses the weapon from within the flames.*

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *The flames sputter away. The sword is complete.*

VB_TakePlans.speaker: Player
VB_TakePlans.text: Weapon blueprints. They call for sussur bark...

PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.speaker: Player
PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.text: If only I knew where to find some.

VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.speaker: Player
VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.text: What in the hells was that?

VB_FindWeakWall.speaker: Player
VB_FindWeakWall.text: A wonder this shoddy wall hasn't already collapsed.

PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.speaker: Player
PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.text: The bark is in place. Now, for a greatsword, dagger, or sickle.

session_synopses.ForgeWeapon: The player has all the ingredients and fires up the furnace to make their masterwork.This is all narration; narration needed as most of this scene will likely not be visually communicative.
session_synopses.VB_TakePlans: Player reads the blueprints of an incredible weapon.
session_synopses.PAD_NatureCheckOutcome: Player is commenting on a rare ingredient needed for crafting a powerful weapon. Sussur bark can only be found in the Underdark.
session_synopses.VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear: Player sees a phase spider slip in and out of reality.Probably not clear exactly what it was.
session_synopses.VB_FindWeakWall: Player finds a weak wall. Something's behind it.
session_synopses.PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined: After the player places the sussur bark he will react to it. If they know about the plans they will say to use one of the three weapons. If not they'll say that maybe they can do something with the forge.

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presenceNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog barks with extreme agitation towards your presence

Dog.speaker: Scratch
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog grows more aggressive

Dog.speaker: Narrator
Dog.text: *The dog lowers his hackles, his head tilted inquisitively.*
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/performance context - the dog tilts its head/shows uncertainty.

Dog.speaker: Narrator
Dog.text: *Convinced that you're harmless, he turns his attention back to the corpse.*
Dog.context: CinematicNodeContext: The dog looks to the corpse nearby, barks. The corpse is clearly dead.

session_synopses.Dog:
In SwA, Scratch speaks like a human. He doesn't have any kind of dog-like affectation, nor is he stupid - he's well-spoken, even when he's saying 'dog' things. Throughout the dialogue, he's stoic but heartbroken, deluding himself into believing that his master is not dead.We come across the corpse of a man being protected by his loyal dog, Scratch.The dog refuses to let us near the dead man or his belongings, forcing us to try and win him over (or else just kill him). We can use Speak with Animals to get further insight into the dog's perspective.
 If we cast Speak with Dead upon the courier, we can learn the dog's name and use this as an additional way to win it over.

PAD_PostScene.speaker: Player
PAD_PostScene.text: They spoke of the Absolute - same as that goblin, Sazza. Curious.

PAD_PostScene.speaker: Player
PAD_PostScene.text: Seems as though the Absolute's attracting followers from all kinds of places.

session_synopses.PAD_PostScene: An automated dialog by players, triggered after the scene with the Absolute Cultists in which the True Soul dies is over. The party wonders aloud what the cultists were talking about when they mentioned 'true souls' and 'the Absolute'. They may have a little more context if they already spoke to Sazza, a captured cultist goblin
session_synopses.VB_DiscoverPriests: Player spots the wounded True Soul and his minions, is wary about what's going on.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Devout
node_data.text: We're, eh, working hard for Absolute. Hope you spare a good word for us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Servile

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to windmill sail and are rotating him for their amusement. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possiblyby using their mind-influencing powers or otherwise convincing the goblins they're on the same side. GnomeGobllin3 is one of two lackeys, there to support the leading goblin, Fezzerk. She's abrupt and aggressive to most, though servile and meek if the player happens to be a drow.

AD_DoorMarks.speaker: Narrator
AD_DoorMarks.text: *Names and heights have been carved into the wood over the years. The last two read 'Maggie Terrens' and 'Marcus Terrens'. Twins, perhaps.*

session_synopses.AD_DoorMarks: Markings on a door frame in an abandoned schoolhouse showing chidlren's growth over the years.

Village_Trespassing.text: You sent from Moonrise, drow? 'Cos otherwise, I'll have to cut ya.

session_synopses.Village_Trespassing: This guard has come upon you sneaking through a village her force is occupying. She was bored and sees you as a potential source of fun (ie, someone to murder/bully).  Defaulting to she, but numerous goblins could deliver this dialogue as it's a dynamic crime one.

AD.speaker: Chock
AD.text: Dwarf better. Dwarf sweet like honey.

AD.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AD.text: Must you? This inane chatter pains me.

AD.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AD.text: Oh, for... shut mouth! Head hurt!
AD.context: NodeContext: He is exasperated. Then he speaks in typical ogre speak.

PAD_NotReturning.speaker: Player
PAD_NotReturning.text: You can't summon a dead ogre, it turns out.

session_synopses.AD: Three ogres have a meal time discussion. Chock and Fank are stupid. Lump is smart.
session_synopses.PAD_NotReturning: Player Blows ogre horn, but no one comes.

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_000.context: NodeContext: Exclamation during combat, ordering lackeys

Combat_GnomeGoblin1_001.speaker: Fezzerk
Combat_GnomeGoblin1_001.text: Gonna poke some extra holes in you!

BridgeSign.speaker: Player
BridgeSign.context: NodeContext: Reading a signpost. Elturel pronounced 'ELL-tur-ELL'. Baldur pronounced 'Ball-dur'

EmptyMindflayerPod.speaker: Narrator
EmptyMindflayerPod.text: *An empty mind flayer vessel. If its occupant survived, they're nowhere to be seen.*

session_synopses.BridgeSign: Sign near a stone bridge linking the Druid Grove to the Ruined Village. Establishes where the player is in relation to the city of Baldur's Gate. After reading this, natives of the city may pass comment, noting that they know broadly where they are now.
session_synopses.EmptyMindflayerPod: Players encountered an empty pod in forest.

AD.speaker: Player
AD.text: This trunk's rotten; shouldn't put too much weight on it.
AD.context: NodeContext: Cautious; just realising how precarious their position is (crossing a dangerously weak tree trunk bridge).

session_synopses.AD: The party crosses a fallen tree bridging a gorge. Their senses may perceive that the trunk is rotten and they mustn't cross all at once, or they may remain oblivious to the danger.

AD_FoundJournal.speaker: Player
AD_FoundJournal.text: Someone's diary. Might explain what happened here.

session_synopses.AD_FoundJournal: The party finds a old diary in the ruined schoolhouse of an abandoned village. They comment that it might shed some light on what happened here.
session_synopses.PAD_SeluniteRitualScroll: Reflection on the Selunite Ritual scroll found in the Owlbear cave

PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.speaker: Goblin Brawler
PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight.text: Oi! You fightin' them ogres, then you fightin' with me!

session_synopses.PatrollingGoblin_AD_JoinOgreFight: Goblin near the ogres joins the fight if player gets into combat with them.

003_Dead.speaker: Edowin
003_Dead.text: Edowin... a True Soul... a Chosen...

session_synopses.001: Novice Andrick, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, currently standing guard in the goblin camp. If the player met and won him over previously in the forest, he'll refer to this and speak deferentially.
session_synopses.003_Dead: True Soul Edowin has been killed by an owlbear. This is his corpse speaking. He is concerned about his siblings and still devoted to the Absolute.
session_synopses.002: Novice Brynna, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, currently standing guard in the goblin camp. If the player met and won her over previously in the forest, she'll refer to this and speak deferentially.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.text: I feel a breeze - I wonder what's down there.

VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.speaker: Player
VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance.context: NodeContext: This person doesn't trust it.

session_synopses.VB_DiscoverUnderdarkEntrance: The player finds the deep pit leading to the underdark.

node_data.text: CinematicNodeContext: Player walks through an empty doorway, slowly looking inside
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player walks through an empty doorway, slowly looking inside

node_data.speaker: Grukkoh
node_data.text: Ngh. W-what the hells are you doin'?
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: JLatino: A look of surprise and facination stretches across the player's face.
Offscreen the couple notices us, the camera catches them scrambling off as quickly as possible.NodeContext: Still busy with his ogress at first, then realises someone entered.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Back away slowly.

node_data.speaker: Buthir
node_data.text: Ruined! Smash - I'll SMASH YOU!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bugbear is getting off of the ogress and glares at me, if possible, he should be a bit ruffled. The ogress is behind hin and still getting up, adjusting the clothes around her waist. it should be clear they were having sex.NodeContext: The ogress is flying into a rage.

session_synopses.AD_OgreKilled: The players have killed the ogress (the bugbear's lover) and he swears revenge.
session_synopses.Bugbear_Dead: A dialogue with the bugbear's corpse after a player killed him. 'Butters' is Buthir, the ogre he loves.
session_synopses: The player arrives at a house and hears a strange noise inside. It might sound like a fight is happening inside, but upon closer inspection they can learn that a bugbear and an ogre are making love.

PAD_EnterSecretLab.speaker: Player
PAD_EnterSecretLab.text: A well-guarded laboratory. What were they hiding down here?

session_synopses.PAD_EnterSecretLab: PAD when you enter the Thayan lab in the cellar (after convincing the magical mirror to open for you). It's obviously long abandoned, but full of twisted glass flasks and other old lab equipment.
session_synopses.AD_QuasitReactsToTrap: The player has triggered a trap because the quasit gave the wrong answer. Quasit is DELIGHTED. Cackling madly as she runs about.

VB_BookDestroyed.speaker: Player
VB_BookDestroyed.text: Well done. The world's better off without it.

session_synopses.VB_BookDestroyed: Companion reaction to the player destroying the DangerousBook ('The Necromancy of Thay'). This book was clearly magical, whispering offers of dark power. You destroyed it by dropping it on the ground and blasting it with radiant damage. When you destroyed it, there were some spooky vfx. Most characters would see this as a good thing. Gale, Astarion wanted the book for themselves, however.

session_synopses.PAD_PlayerHeardEttercapWarning: The player has touched a spider web and heard an ettercap scream in response. They realise the ettercap has found out they are there.

PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.speaker: Player
PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.text: A prayer sheet. What's this symbol on it?

PAD_NoticeStashSeal.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticeStashSeal.text: There's magic keeping this chest sealed; I can feel its aura.

PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.speaker: Player
PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.text: Chest's unlocked. My prayers are answered.
PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a prayer unlocking a magically sealed chest.

session_synopses.PAD_PickupPrayerSheet: The player comments after picking up an old prayer sheet. They may or may not recognise that it could help them unlock a magically sealed chest.
session_synopses.PAD_NoticeStashSeal: Following a passive arcana check, the player comments that a chest discovered at a shrine has a spell cast over it, protecting its contents.
session_synopses.PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer: The player passes comment after they manage to open a magically sealed chest by reciting a prayer they found. If Shadowheart or a worshipper of Shar is speaking, the prayer does nothing.

VB_OwlBearPrints.speaker: Player
VB_OwlBearPrints.text: Looks like a beast came through here - a big one too.
VB_OwlBearPrints.context: NodeContext: Cautious. Spoken in reference to a large set of animal tracks they've spotted.

session_synopses.VB_OwlBearPrints: The player discovers a large set of animal tracks. They may be able to identify them as those of an owlbear.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The dagger still juts from the meat.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Carefully wiggle the dagger until it slides free.
False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *Strained by your clumsy technique, the blade snaps in two.*

session_synopses: Near a forest village, there are remains of an ogre campfire and meat spit over it. There's a cool dagger stuck in the meat. The player can attempt to retrieve it in a few ways (2 are listed here, but feel free to add another branch).

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: These things abandon their hosts as soon as they need to. Vile parasites...

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: The longer we wait, the likelier that we share in this fate, or worse. Let's get rid of these things.

session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleLeaves: The players reflect on having just witnessed a tadpole emerge from the corpse of a recently deceased Absolute cultist. They consider the creature that's been causing each of them so much trouble. Despair or determination.This happens at the end of a scene and the characters are interchangeable here. They can all be opinionated.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: No talk, only bite! Go to goblin leader for talk.

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.
session_synopses.AD_Mocking: Worg laughing at the unfoiruntae gnome getting tossed around.

SpeedUp.speaker: Narrator
SpeedUp.text: NodeContext: Intentionally blank for cinematic purposes
SpeedUp.context: NodeContext: Intentionally blank for cinematic purposes

SpeedUp.text: CinematicNodeContext: Unfortunate Gnome gets flung off.
SpeedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unfortunate Gnome gets flung off.

Dead.speaker: Barcus Wroot
Dead.text: Caught... by... goblins... killed... in... fray...

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome is tied to the (stationary) sail of a wind, begging to be cut free by the player. He's close to the ground and within normal speaking range.NodeContext: Urgent, panicked. The gnome begs to be untied from the sail of a windmill. The sail is at the lowermost part of its rotation in relation to the ground, and the gnome is within normal speaking range.

TiedUp.speaker: Player
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Incredulous. His good samaritan seems to be haggling for a reward before even freeing him.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Impatient. He's used to being extorted.

session_synopses.SpeedUp: Narration - the player senses the windmill's rotation is speeding up after a brake is released.
session_synopses.AD_RotatingFasterReaction: Said while being spun faster on the pane of a windmill. Should be in a panic.
session_synopses.Dead: This is the gnome's spirit once he's dead. He's still focused on Wulbren, his first love, who he believes to be in danger.
session_synopses.TiedUp: The player has stopped the windmill from rotating and can now cut Barcus Wroot, the captive gnome, free from its sails. They can do this immediately, or else demand payment first, much to the gnome's frustration.

Leader.speaker: Brathwen
Leader.text: Hey! Get back with the others. Now.

session_synopses.Companion: Short dialogues with this character after you have your main dialogue with him. He doesn't talk much, hasn't been the same since a rock slide.
session_synopses.Leader: Short dialogues when i'm done doing the main 'looting' scene with this character.

AD_NoAnswerFromGod.speaker: Narrator
AD_NoAnswerFromGod.text: *There is no answer from the presence.*

HighPriest.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
HighPriest.text: You've slain the pretender! We knew in our hearts the god BOOOAL was false.
HighPriest.context: NodeContext: In awe of you, rushing to affirm his faith - and absolutely means it

HighPriest.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
HighPriest.text: But you - we see you. We know you by your true name... MAHKLOOMPAH!
HighPriest.context: NodeContext: Kuo-Toa give overwrought, nonsensical names to their gods. Air of great ceremony as he bestows one on you

PAD_MagicGone.speaker: Player
PAD_MagicGone.text: Not much of a god after all. Whatever power he had, it died with those creatures.
PAD_MagicGone.context: NodeContext: BOO-al (not pronounced with extra emphasis, its just how the local fish people stylize it)

session_synopses.AD_NoAnswerFromGod: The player has clicked an altar from which a godly presence spoke previously.
session_synopses.HighPriest: The Zealot is a Kuo Toa obsessed with his new god - you. You've slain the 'pretender' he was just as dedicated to only moments before, and he's transferred all that zealotry to you.Mahkloompah = ma-KLOOM-pa.
session_synopses.PAD_MagicGone: This PAD triggers if/when the player kills all the Kuo-Toa and BOOOAL's magic disappates - the beat is 'he was no true god, his power came from those fish creatures'.
session_synopses.KuoToaMinion: A  node that plays when the player tries to click on a praying kuotoa. They will either praise you as the Chosen of their madeup god, or make you a new made-up god.BOOOAL - Booh-ALMahkloompah - mak-LOOM-pah

node_data.speaker: Mossy Myconid
node_data.text: ((*no peace*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Well look here - Nere's killer in the flesh. Make yourself useful, grab a cane and whip these drugnin' beasts into shape.
Guard_001.context: NodeContext: Hoon = outsider. Dorn = friend. Urop (YUR-op) - slave.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: That rubble needs clearing, and my patience is hanging on by an arse whisker.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Shouldn't be trouble for a brute like you.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Don't think I won't thrash you harder than the rothé.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Something's spooked the dumbshits. So stop your jawin', and get to workin'.

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: Not enough caning for my tastes, but you got the job done.
CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall takes out his weapon and enters combat stance.
RubbleAttack.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall takes out his weapon and enters combat stance.

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: I almost feel bad about this.
RubbleAttack.context: CinematicNodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.NodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.

RubbleAttack.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack.text: You'll be feeling even worse in a moment.

session_synopses.Guard_001: The taskmaster is another cruel duergar. He is whipping several pack animals to clear out some rubble, but his arm is tired and asks you to step in. You might discover they want the rubble cleared because a valuable forge can be found behind it. If you convince the beasts to break through, he attacks you because he doesn't want to share the wealth.
session_synopses.RubbleAttack: Duergar dialog that happens if the player attacks / destroys the wall  by fearful rothe.

DisguisedJournal.speaker: Narrator
DisguisedJournal.text: *The cover proudly announces this book to be: 'Flumph Mating Rituals'.*
DisguisedJournal.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Player holding the closed book, inspecting the cover
NodeContext: Flumph = FLUMF

DisguisedJournal.speaker: Narrator
DisguisedJournal.text: *If the drow's corpse is to be believed, it's something else entirely.*
DisguisedJournal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player holding the closed book, inspecting the cover

DisguisedJournal.speaker: Player
DisguisedJournal.text: Try to peer through the illusion.

DisguisedJournal.speaker: Narrator
DisguisedJournal.text: *Strain as you might, your eyes find nothing but an overly detailed description of the flumph's reproductive process.*
DisguisedJournal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player opens the book and studies the text before them

session_synopses.MyconidDrow_Dead: Xargrim is one of three drow wizards who was looking for the Adamantine Forge. Friends turned rivals, these wizards each compete to find the forge, trying to steal the knowledge of the others as they go. Xargrim ambushed one of his fellows and set a spectator on him, but the strain of the ritual killed him.
session_synopses.DisguisedJournal: This book is recovered from the body of Xargrim, a wizard searching for the Adamantine Forge. It contains instructions on how to operate the forge, but is disguised as a rather smutty "nature" textbook.Flumph = FLUMF.

node_data.speaker: Bonna
node_data.text: Stay on yer own raft.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: So those mushrooms can raise the dead? That's... interesting.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Handy magic, that. Maybe it'll be of use to us.

session_synopses.PAD: Players can find a few NPCs that have been raised by the myconoid to work as their servants. The party comments on this through a VB.This can fire on any character, and since it is not a result of direct player actions, the replies can be fairly opinionated.Can take one or two speakers.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: He hid from the Hells' forces - but they still got to him.

session_synopses.PAD: Players find the journal in the Panic Room after identifying the Merregon Masks. This belonged to a Dark Justiciar who hid from the orthon when it rampaged, and was trapped when rubble fell.

004.speaker: Player
004.text: Looks like the spectator got the best of you. Weren't you prepared?

004.speaker: Petrified Drow
004.text: Dhourn hired us. Promised riches. Then Xargrim came. Dhourn's old friend.

004.speaker: Petrified Drow
004.text: They fought. Loud and nasty. Xargrim summoned the spectator and ran.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spitting in between words, enraged

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: I offer to parley, and he brings a spectator? Twit. Quite ruined my ambush.

Wizard.speaker: Player
Wizard.text: I'm more concerned with this 'twit' who set a spectator on you.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: Pah. A rival - a mere footnote to my legend. You should be more concerned with who I am.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: I am Dhourn. Third son of House Ba'Tol, first rank evoker, and initiate of Gravenhollow's...
Wizard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)NodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: ... my crystal. My memory shard. Where is it?
Wizard.context: NodeContext: Rising panic as he can't find an item we stole from him.

Wizard.speaker: Petrified Drow
Wizard.text: You think it clever to steal from a statue, do you?
Wizard.context: NodeContext: To us, with suspicion and fury

MemoryCrystal.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal.context: CinematicNodeContext: CU on the stone sitting in player's hand. If possible, with a dull glow at the centre.

MemoryCrystal.speaker: Narrator
MemoryCrystal.text: *You heard its like described before - a memory shard, used to store brief mental impressions from the user's mind.*

session_synopses.004: This drow was petrified by a spectator.Now he is unpetrified.Worries about his companions and the group's leader - the wizard. He should seem in shock. Short sentences, short delivery.Leave after a long rest.
session_synopses.Wizard: Drow Wizard that has some info about the Adamantine Furnace.Paranoid after being petrified by the spectator.narrative feature: Used to kill his oponents and interrogate them afterwards (Disguise Self + Speak With Dead).
session_synopses.MemoryCrystal: This dialogue is for an artefact called a Memory Shard, a crystal taken from the Petrified Drow (Dhourn).The crystal can store memories - in this case, Dhourn's knowledge of the location of the Adamantine forge. The player either approaches knowing what it is, or can discover its function based on a check.

session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_03: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.
session_synopses.AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is taking his turn.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the duergar corpsesInternalNodeContext: Note: speaking of the duergar

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: You don't deserve the death you got. I should have made it last.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the duergar corpses

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: As for the rest of you slave-worms - you've caused enough trouble.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere rears back to cast a spell at the remaining gnomes

FollowUp.text: CinematicNodeContext: Nere fires the spell and the gnomes are dead.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere fires the spell and the gnomes are dead.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: This was meant to be a simple operation - I arrive, those pack animals clear the debris, and I walk into the temple.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: Instead, I've been beset by incompetence, treachery, and now this. The Absolute's business remains unfinished.
FollowUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: On 'this' he gestures to the broken bridge in front of him.

FollowUp.speaker: Player
FollowUp.text: And what business is that, exactly?

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: Important business. My orders come from General Thorm himself.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: I need you to deliver a message to him. Tell the General that I did what I could, but that the route through Grymforge is impassable.

FollowUp.speaker: Player
FollowUp.text: First tell me what happened to this place.

FollowUp.speaker: Nere
FollowUp.text: When the General entrusted me with this mission, he warned there may be some damage caused by a monster let loose in the temple.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: *A faint voice echoes in your mind.*
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld: Nere is calling out to player from a distance

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: I sense you, True Soul... come to me, come to Nere... the poison spreads.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: NodeContext: Voice goes in and out, as if the connection is weak

session_synopses.FollowUp: After fighting and killing a group of duergar servants that mutinied against him, Nere takes his rage and frustration out on one of their bodies by kicking it. Once he's done, he takes the players to a nearby broken bridge and explains that he needs reinforcements. The player can promise they'll inform his boss - Chosen Ketheric - or not.
session_synopses.Mindmeld_LeavingRegion: When trying to leave Grymforge before freeing Nere, you get a mindmeld from Nere, warning that he will die if you leave. Nere is not physically present in scene - only his voice is heard.

node_data.speaker: Alchemist Argram
node_data.text: You tryin' to tip us over? Stop moving, idiot.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

02.speaker: Mirthis
02.text: Drugnin' Nere - glad you offed him. Ain't no one divides the clan and lives to tell the tale.

Spider04.speaker: Lur Fu
Spider04.context: NodeContext: Quickly, rhythmically, like a chant

session_synopses.Spider02: Followup after the spiders have killed their sister Xanta for being disloyal.
session_synopses.Spider04: Followup dialogue with spider after they attack and kill Lur Xanta

02.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02.text: If you aren't here to inspect the stonework, then get lost.

02.speaker: Stonemason Gergerann
02.text: And if you are... well, I doubt you've got anythin' useful to say.

session_synopses.02: Stoneworker who has no time for the player.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The hole offers only pitch-black nothingness.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: HellooooOH!

node_data.speaker: Voice from the Deep Hole
node_data.text: *Roar!*
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Extra-angry.This is the roar of an unseen creature deep down in the Underdark. Exactly what it is will remain a mystery, other than it sounds big, threatening and unappreciative of the player's noise-making.NodeContext: SFX only

session_synopses: A deep hole in the Underdark that you can click on and shout "Helloooooo" into, hearing an echo. Something growls from down below in response; if the player can speak with animals, you may get a disgruntled reply. The creature is unseen, but sounds large, aggressive and very unhappy at being disturbed.First speaker is added for ease of scripting. 2nd speaker is the creature.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Too loud, sun-scum. Heard you stumbling. Can hear you blinking.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A low growl

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Noise gets you eaten down here. Reckon I'll hush you, before something hungry comes along.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A grim statement of fact. He intends to kill you rather than let you bumble around.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His gnarled fist grips an axe.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand doesn't need to have attention drawn to it.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His fist grips an axe. On his gnarled, grey skin, you see the Absolute's brand.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand visible if possible (or just leave it to the narrator)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Turn to leave.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: You're a liability, hook-bait. I'll decide how many steps and breaths you've got left.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'One more step, and you're dead'. Hook-bait refers to a hook horrors - a species of predatory beast in the underdark, which might be attracted by the player's noise.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His fist grips an axe. On his gnarled, grey skin, you see the Absolute's brand.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand visible if possible (or just leave it to the narrator)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Show him your brand.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Huh. Burning those into just anyone now, are they?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Weapon lowered a littleNodeContext: He's discovered you're his ally, but isn't particularly impressed. Weapon lowered a little all the same

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: No harm. Every army needs grunts to run in and die first. Even the Absolute's.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: But spoil my hunt, and you're dead.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A pointed finger. He isn't kidding.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Turn to leave.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Didn't say you could leave, did I? Another step and you'll get a kiss off my axe.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What do you want?

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Shut up and listen.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: I'm on a hunt. Got a runaway slave to kill. Need to fetch back the boots she stole from Sergeant Thrinn.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Got to kill the slave and fetch back the leather, or the bosses in Moonrise'll have Thrinn's hide.
node_data.context: NodeContext: It's his job. He has no moral qualms about this.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm not helping a slave-catcher.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: A bleeding heart, are you? Reckon I'll just roast an' eat it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Brutal and matter-of-fact. Combat ensures immediately afterwards

DeadDuergar_Dead.speaker: Player
DeadDuergar_Dead.text: What were you doing when you died?

GCB_ForbiddenRaft.speaker: Novice Garmor
GCB_ForbiddenRaft.text: Speak for yourself - I've got plenty of harm intended.

Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.text: I will split your corpse and roast the pieces!

session_synopses: A duergar scout sent by his superior to track down an escaped deep gnome slave and retrieve the valuable Boots of Speed that she stole from the scout's superior. His progress has been hampered as the escapee his hiding amongst some myconids - fungal creatures with telepathic powers. He confronts the player, who may convince him they aren't a threat. They may be able to assist him agains the runaway and myconids, or could betray him, In general, Gekh is a gruff, vicious type. If the player convinces him that they're his superior (a true soul, for instance) he'll show a little more deference.
session_synopses.DeadDuergar_Dead: The corpse of a duergar follower of the Absolute, who was part of a group sent to hunt down an escaped deep gnome slave in the Underdark. This duergar died after encountering some myconids - sentient fungal creatures with telepathic powers.
session_synopses.GCB_ForbiddenRaft: A henchman of Gekh Coal, a duergar follower of the Absolute, stops the player when he sees them interacting with a raft that'll let them progress across a lake and beyond his reach. If they haven't yet fulfilled their promise to help him, he warns them to leave the raft alone.

LootingCorpse.speaker: Narrator
LootingCorpse.text: *Deep gnomes - killed under the yoke of slavers.*
LootingCorpse.context: CinematicNodeContext: Panning over small field of dead bodies.

LootingCorpse.speaker: Player
LootingCorpse.text: I will take the lives of those who took yours.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: Where's your pickaxe, gnome? Thrinn know you're over here?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spits on the groundNodeContext: Said like a threat.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Player
CorpseDisposers.text: She asked me to inspect the bodies for anything useful.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: You know - I don't think she did. I think you're trying to escape. We aren't gonna let that happen, are we, Viss?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: NodeContext: Said matter-of-factly and threateningly, about to start combat.

session_synopses.LootingCorpse: Player having a contemplative moment while observing the corpses of dead gnomes.
session_synopses.CorpseDisposers: Two grouchy duergar, one a talker and one who somewhat mimics/ repeats what his partner says, are responsible for dumping dead gnome bodies into the lake. You can convince them to let you loot the bodies.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Seems the 'shrooms are letting in more people every day.
DwarvenAlchemist.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You see a fella on his own on your way in? Dwarf. Baelen's his name.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Knock yourself out. But don't come begging for coin if you find him.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: If you try to ransom him to me, you'll find yourself skint and stuck with a fat old lout.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Restless Myconid

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator

CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

DeepRothe.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe.text: Master sounds different, like old self. Angry self. Don't like.
DeepRothe.context: NodeContext: SWA line. Reproachful. A simple beast of burden senses his master has returned to a crueler demeanour.

AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.speaker: Noxious Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.text: ((*you will fall. and in death, we will raise you*))

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.text: I must complete this study. Entertain yourself elsewhere.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: How do you survive? Don't you need... brains?

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: In the beginning, I had an arrangement with a lich. Excellent company, despite what one would expect.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I required brains, he required souls. A perfect symbiosis.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: But our ambitions eventually splintered. I wished to better the world, and he preferred its rot.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: So I left his company, and thus I now feed from those who... act against the Society's goals.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: I cannot change my appetites. Although I am experimenting in reducing them with magic.

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Omeluum
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: Perhaps with time, it can be one brain a year instead of one a month...

SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.speaker: Player
SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer.text: There's no trusting a mind flayer. Attack.
