session_synopses.DwarvenAlchemist:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_001: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.VB_GlutDead_1P: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_000: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DeepRothe: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_MindFlayer: Omeluum is a friendly, neutral mind flayer and member of the Society of Brilliance, dedicated to improving life in the Underdark. If attacked, it will teleport away rather than engaging in combat.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.ServantHookHorror_01: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.
session_synopses.DirectToSovereign: If you speak to a myconid after the guards speak to you but you have not yet spoken to the sovereign, his voice will speak through them.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_004: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.RapportSpores_Alone:
Non has met: Triggers if the player is alone when first hearing the myconid circle's collective voice.

Hasmet: Occurs second time, regardless of how mnay players are in party. Player hears a strange voice, and has a reaction to it. Second time: Tries to respond to it.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_005_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.DeadMyconid_Dead: Speak with dead on Myconid sprout. Sprouts are children. This one should sound young. It describes being killed by grey dwarves (duergar). Should not sound like hivemind.
session_synopses.MushroomField_Warning: Myconid warns you that mushrooms explode if you get too close.

01.speaker: Player
01.text: Who hung these drow out to dry?

01.speaker: Murmath
01.text: Me - who else? My spiders sussed 'em out of hiding, then Nere taught 'em a thing or two, and I let 'em fly.

session_synopses.01: Drow hang from the bridge. PAD as we see them - “Duergar rarely stand up to drow so boldly.”One duergar is here, patrolling with a crossbow. He tells us he’s keeping watch over the lake - these drow were trying to infiltrate the settlement, and more may come.

session_synopses: Player clicks on the scrying eye patrolling in Grymdark. Passing an Insight check lets you look back into the presence watching you (one of the scryers at Moonrise Towers). This dialogue uses the same template as the dialogue with the scrying eye in the goblin camp.

session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Raft: Glut says he cannot follow you across the lake, and must remain on shore.

session_synopses.Dead: Baelen was out hunting Noblestalk when he was trapped in a field of explosive mushrooms. He's now dead - most likely because the player triggered those mushrooms to explode. He speaks in short, cryptic fragments from beyond the grave.

Speak with Dead dialogue with Derryth Bonecloak, a dwarven alchemist from Baldur's Gate who came to the Underdark along with her husband, Baelen, in search of a rare and valuable mushroom - the noblestalk.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The wall is riddled with holes. A suffocating stench of long-rotten meat wafts out.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: camera on holes in cavern wall

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Reach into one of the holes.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The passage narrows and bends, becoming impassable before you're even elbow-deep.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: player has arm inside hole in wall, up to the elbow, frustrated

session_synopses: The player encounters a wall riddled with small holes. A successful Survival check reveals that they were created by carrion crawlers. Small characters can reach in for loot.[Editor's note: try to think of some alternate ways of getting to the loot that don't involve choosing a gnome or halflng at the start of the game.][Scripter comment: we have spell Enlarge/Reduce planned, but I've also added Mage Hand support. Thanks!]

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A slender drow blade impales the stone before you, keeping a silent vigil.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise your goddess' rite - a warrior's sacrifice. Only blood, freely given, will honour the fallen.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Grab the sword with both hands and pull.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *It feels like you're warring with ten people for the blade, but with another hard yank, the weapon slips free from the stone.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: character struggles with sword, but eventually pulls it out. what a feat of strength!

session_synopses: Player discovers an improvised shrine to a dead drow warrior. There's a helmet resting on a sword that's been rammed into a stone. You can take the helmet, but you'll need to think of another way to get the sword free.

node_data.speaker: Narrator

Saved.text: Thanks again for offing that drow. Only made it here 'cause of you. But I can't stop thinking about the rest of us...

Saved.speaker: Beldron

CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down.

session_synopses.CampIntro: Another duergar greets you on the other side of the lake after sailingthere with captain Greymon.Both duergar are surly, but Morghal in particular. She is suspicious of Absolutists, but happy to take their coin. She should be gruff, and absolutely not listless. She tells you that Nere is trapped above.

session_synopses.AD_BeckonPlayer: An amulet calls out to the player amid the rocks surrounded by lava in Grymforge.
session_synopses.AD_FailedWisdomSave: After resting and leaving camp, the haunted amulet curses the player with periodic fits of laughter if they use the amulet's ability  if they do not pass a wisdom save. Amulet speaks this dialogue. Shar-allied clerics and paladins get different lines: the amulet is happy to drive them mad.

session_synopses.PAD_RecogniseWatchword: The Sharran Inquisitor's diary documents the Harper Spy's interrogation. The spy is quoted reciting a Harper Watchword during the interrogation. Players that pass a History Check will recognise the watchword, and understand that the Light spell is required to bypass the spy's trap

Mutineers.speaker: Elder Brithvar

Rothe_03.speaker: Deep Rothé

RebelGreedyExtort.speaker: Elder Brithvar

RebelGreedyExtort.speaker: Elder Brithvar

session_synopses.ElevatorWarningGnome: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby gnome  butts in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
session_synopses.Mutineers: Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny).Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.
session_synopses.Rothe_03: The rothe is trying to sleep while her fellow rothe talk. She is tried from a long day's work and knows there is little time to sleep before her next shift.
session_synopses.RotheDiscussion: This occurs between two Rothe. The first is a younger Rothe who desires  freedom and a life without pain. The other Rothe is older and more stern. He has worked since the times of Ketheric.Player can speak with them or listen in on their conversation with an animal handling check.
session_synopses.RebelGreedyExtort: In this dialogue, you have killed Nere without doing the duergar mutineers quest. As a result, they want you to pay for the trouble you've caused. You can give them money, persuade them to let you live, or attack.
session_synopses.Rothe_02: An older Rothe. Focusing on eating before he is called to work.

session_synopses: Tombstone on the grave at Sussur Tree. Digging the grave unveils a collar of a pet (cat or dog). The pet was of cleric of Mystra who lived in the Arcane Tower nearby. This collar has no use on the first sight, at least there's no magical properties. But the secret is it allowed cleric's pet to have food or navigate inside the tower.

session_synopses.DeadFF1_Dead: The Cult of the Absolute has ransacked the inn at Waukeen's Rest and kidnapped Duke Stelmane of Baldur's Gate. The player arrives after the carnage, finding corpses strewn about. The player casts 'Speak with Dead' on one of these corpses - a member of the Flaming Fist who was sworn to protect the Duke. She was among the final Fists left standing. She was killed guarding the Duke.
session_synopses.VB_DeadDrow1Armor_WithDrow: Party with drow in it comes upon a dead drow and comments on the armour. The second speaker is always a Dr

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for PLA. The player comes across deep scratches in rock. Passing an Arcana check reveals the creature responsible to be a dragon.

True

AD_Freed.speaker: Benryn
AD_Freed.context: NodeContext: He's just barely escaped a burning building with his life, only to emerge into the remains of a bloodbath.

PAD_TooHeavy.speaker: Player

PAD_Door.speaker: Player
PAD_Door.text: The heat coming off that door... opening it could spell trouble.

session_synopses:
Benryn finds himself faced with multiple crises in this dialogue. When the player finds him, he is frantic and coughing, trapped beneath a collapsed beam within a burning building. If the player rescues him, he frantically and desperately searches for his wife, who was outside when a band of goblins and drow attacked the inn they were staying at. Finally, if the player finds his wife's body, he is heartbroken - he believes her death is his fault, because of a silly argument that they had.

When players first encounter Benryn, he is trapped beneath a heavy beam in a burning building. If the player helps him escape, Benryn joins the party until they exit the building safely. Once outside, Benryn is in shock at the carnage around him - bodies of goblins and humans litter the inn's courtyard. He snaps out of his shock when he thinks of his wife, who was outside when the raiding party arrived. He pleads for the player to help him find her - when players do, she is already dead. Pointed to her body, Benryn breaks down - the weight of guilt immediately crushing him.The barbarian class will have advantage in a strength check to lift the wreckage off Benryn, however if they fail, they can try again with a higher DC. Failure the second time will lead to more debris collapsing and killing Benryn.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundChest: An AD that plays when you notice the dowry in the stack of hay.
session_synopses.AD_Searching: Benryn is searching for his wife in the wreckage left behind by a goblin attack on an inn. She's dead, but he doesn't know it yet.He's on the edge of total panic, but keeping it together enough to try to find her.
session_synopses.AD_Freed: This AD plays after the player has freed Benryn from beneath a fallen beam. The building they're in is burning around them - he's desperate to escape.
session_synopses.PAD_TooHeavy: Player's trying to lift the beams off the half-elf, has previously failed the skill check, and cannot enter interactive dialogue. There is no cutscene or animation - you lift it or you don't - the half-elf is just suddenly free. In this PAD they failed the check and can't lift it.
session_synopses.PAD_Door: This VB plays when players near a door that will explode upon opening. It serves as a warning to players that opening the door will require quick action, suggesting the use of turn-based mode.

DesireDoor.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
DesireDoor.text: I'm trapped! Someone, open this door!

DesireDoor.speaker: Player

DesireDoor.speaker: Narrator
DesireDoor.text: *The door remains intact, despite your efforts.*

session_synopses.DesireDoor: You approach a door inside the burning building. Someone is trapped behind it.

session_synopses.AD_Detour: Sign before the Risen Road detour around SCL.

session_synopses: This dialogue can happen in two phases: while pushing agianst rubble outside of the inn, or in a more generic setting (either searching the inn or clearing rubble).A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on her way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night.

AD_FlamingFist1ComeIn.text: We don't have much time. Find her!
AD_FlamingFist1ComeIn.context: NodeContext: Barking orders to her fellow Flaming Fists.

session_synopses.AD_FlamingFist1ComeIn: Ravengard's counsellor is trapped within a burning building. The Flaming Fist is one of several that forces their way inside. She calls to them when they enter, and the FF yells back to her.

PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.speaker: Player
PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.text: Are we really going to hunt a devil on their behalf?

PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.speaker: Player
PAD_RefugeesAreCultists.text: The truth is, if there is a devil running wild, we might have to deal with it one way or another.

session_synopses.PAD_RefugeesAreCultists: Reflection dialog that plays after discovering that the paladins hunting Karlach made a deal with the arch-devil Zariel. The party reflects on whether these people deserve to be punished for dealing with a devil, or whether we should help them.Speaker 1 has agreed to help them. Speaker 2 comments on th is decision. Karlach cannot take part in this dialog.

session_synopses.AD_AlertingYapping: After hyena sees the player, before running and calling other gnolls, it skips it's first turn in combat nervously yapping.
session_synopses.AD_CallingHowl: After hyena sees the player, it runs to the nearby pack of gnolls and howls to get their attention.

session_synopses.AD_Trapped: Desire calls out to anyone that can listen, as she is trapped in a room in a burning building.
session_synopses.AD_FF1: Yeva calls out when she realises who is calling from behind the fire.

002_PostEA.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA.text: If you want to go poking around in the cellar, be my guest. Plug your nose first though.
002_PostEA.context: NodeContext: Turning her attention from a trapdoor to the player. With a smirk on the last sentence

002_PostEA.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA.text: Corpse, half-rotted to mush. Must have been down there a tenday or more.
002_PostEA.context: NodeContext: with a shudder on the first sentence - of disgust rather than horror. 'tenday' is an in-universe term similar to 'week'.

001_PostEA.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA.text: Our scouts told us you'd come. The devil's ally. Come to finish us, have you?

001_PostEA.speaker: Player
001_PostEA.text: You must mean Karlach. I know the truth about who you are.

001_PostEA.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA.text: I'm sure she's invented a fascinating history of our crimes. The truth is far simpler.

001_PostEA.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA.text: We are paladins of Tyr, Lord of Justice. He sent us after an infernal being, straight out of the Nine Hells, hiding in the form of a one-horned tiefling - Karlach.

001_PostEA.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA.text: She's slaughtered countless refugees fleeing the Absolute. Yesterday, she butchered an entire family. We were lucky to survive our encounter with her.

001_PostEA.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA.text: First I was burned within in inch of my life, and now I'm stuck playing pantomime. I can't take it anymore.
001_PostEA.context: NodeContext: the mask drops; he reveals his true nature. not a suffering paladin but an agent of evil

001_PostEA.speaker: Anders
001_PostEA.text: Karlach is going back to Avernus, and if she won't go quietly, she dies. It looks like I'll have to kill you first, which I quite look forward to. Bye-bye.

Dead_PostEA.speaker: Narrator
Dead_PostEA.context: NodeContext: describing a corpse that the player just cast a speak with dead spell on

Dead_PostEA.speaker: Refugee
Dead_PostEA.text: ... infernal... servant... so long I've forgotten... why...

session_synopses.002_PostEA: Wary and abrupt. Disguised as a noble paladin of Tyr, this young is actually in league with the archdevil Zariel. She's hiding out in a tollhouse with her companions.
session_synopses.001_PostEA:
These paladins signed their pact with Zariel for riches and power and serve her with relish. They've agreed to capture and kill Karlach, one of the origin characters.

This cultist is the leader of the group. He's friendly, but badly injured after his fight with Karlach.
session_synopses.Dead_PostEA: A speak with dead dialogue triggered when talking to the corpse of a refugee who was killed by gnolls. The dead man had signed a pact with an archdevil before his death.

TieflingScout.text: So... you not looking to make trouble for me, are you? Whatever you are?

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: ... good. I've enough trouble as it is - look at that lot down there.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Those things you're masquerading as. Armed to the teeth. And they've a dragon.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: I was counting on crossing that bridge and heading to Baldur's Gate. To safety.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Now I've got to find another way around. Take your chances against that lot if you like.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Don't follow me - find your own way.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Nobody. Just another hrasting fool trying to stay alive. There's plenty of us around.
TieflingScout.context: NodeContext: Hrasting pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Common language equivalent of damned/fucking,

PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.speaker: Player
PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.text: Dead - by her own kin's hand.

AD_LaezelSidesWithGith.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelSidesWithGith.text: I should have ended you when I had the chance.
AD_LaezelSidesWithGith.context: InternalNodeContext: She was never a companion

AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn.text: You are outmatched. An inglorious bloodletting awaits.

AD_ScoutLeaves.speaker: Ellyka
AD_ScoutLeaves.text: Mrag! That's it - I'm getting out of here!
AD_ScoutLeaves.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced 'mRAG' (means 'shit' in infernal language). The tiefling decides that things are getting too dangerous and runs off while she still can.

AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.speaker: Ellyka
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.text: Helm protect me, where'd that beast come from...?
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.context: NodeContext: A tiefling refugee reacts with terror and awe upon seeing a dragon fly overhead.

AD_StandOff.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff.text: Your babbling tires me, istik. Move your carcass!
AD_StandOff.context: CinematicNodeContext: Authoritative demandingNodeContext: Authoritative demanding. 'istik' =  'Stranger' - Catch-all term for non-gith. Pronounced Iss-tick

AD_StandOff.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
AD_StandOff.text: B-by order of the Flaming Fist, halt!
AD_StandOff.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unintelligent confusionNodeContext: Unintelligent confusion

AD_StandOff.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff.text: Or what? Show us what you can do, worm.
AD_StandOff.context: NodeContext: Htak'-a meaning "Die!" in gith language

PartyReaction.speaker: Player
PartyReaction.text: These gith are formidable - but not infallible. We can take them in battle, should it come to that.

PartyReaction.speaker: Player
PartyReaction.text: Let's see if they want to have their blood spilled.

AD_SearchingCorpses.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
AD_SearchingCorpses.text: Get to work, Baretha! Search the dead!
AD_SearchingCorpses.context: NodeContext: Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

AD_SearchingCorpses.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_SearchingCorpses.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

AD_SearchingCorpses.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_SearchingCorpses.text: You heard him - search every corpse!
AD_SearchingCorpses.context: NodeContext: Directed towards the other two gith warriors who are present.

session_synopses.DragonEvent: A Flaming Fist detachment tries to confront a githyanki war band. The Flaming Fists are completely outmatched, however; the githyanki warriors dismiss their demands. Moments later, a githyanki controlled dragon roasts the Flaming Fists in a fly-by. Afterwards, the dragon rider, a senior gith, berates his subordinate for her slow mission progress.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelRunsToKnight: Non-recruited Lae'zel calls out to the gith knight.
session_synopses.PAD_Shield: Comment on acquiring or moving a shield of a Flaming Fist mercenary killed by the dragon on the bridge.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelReadMap: After reading the Githyanki Map, Lae'zel Avatar urges the rest of the party to go to the crèche.
session_synopses.TieflingScout: A tiefling scout from the Druid Grove hides and observes as a Githyanki war party massacres some Flaming Fists. The tiefling may warn the player that they are too weak to take on such opponents, before running off.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelKilledByGith: Player returning to the Gith Chokepoint area after leaving Lae'zel behind -- she has been killed by the gith
session_synopses.AD_LaezelSidesWithGith: |Player manually attacked the githyanki, bypassing the normal flow. Lae'zel is still a NPC. She sides with the githyanki in this combat.|
session_synopses.AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn: Small remark that the players don't stand a chance.
session_synopses.AD_ScoutLeaves: The tiefling refugee/scout declares she's clearing off when she realises the situation with the nearby githyanki warparty is getting too risky.
session_synopses.AD_ScoutReactsToDragon: A tiefling refugee observes a war party of githyanki warriors guarding a bottleneck in the main road leading out of the region. The githyanki are alien and fearsome to the tiefling. She reacts with shock when she sees how they have a dragon circling overhead in support.
session_synopses.AD_StandOff: A flaming fist solider nervously attempts to challenge a githyanki warrior. The gith is essentially an alien to the lowly soldier; he can't help but feel intimidated.
session_synopses.PartyReaction: Companions react to the gith chokepoint (dragon flew by and killed the flaming fists). Lae'zel is handled in a different dialog.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelPostConfrontation: Non-recruited Lae'zel speaks ADs after the battle with the dragon rider. She alternated between the beat of the dragon rider and looking for a creche.
session_synopses.AD_SearchingCorpses: Kith'rak Voss, a high-ranking gith warrior, berates his underling, Sarth Baretha, and orders her and her warriors to search the corpses of some humans they'rve just killed. They are looking for 'the weapon' (in fact a strange puzzle box in the possession of our party).

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: describing a corpse after casting a speak with dead spell on it

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with dead dialogue initiated when speaking to the decomposing corpse of a toll collector found in an abandoned tollhouse basement

Agent_003_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_003_Dead.context: NodeContext: After casting a speak with dead spell

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Hear that? Someone's fighting the gnolls! We should help!
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: Upon hearing a fight break out between players and a gnoll pack - Shouting to his friend who is nearby

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Don't be a fool, lad. Shut your mouth, and keep your head down.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: shushing his friend on first line to avoid getting spotted and involved in a fight

Agents_AD_Retreating.speaker: Rugan
Agents_AD_Retreating.text: Leave the heroics to them that don't value their own skin.
Agents_AD_Retreating.context: NodeContext: in a hushed voice, to a companion rather than to players as a fight they're avoiding unfolds nearby

Agent_002.speaker: Olly
Agent_002.text: Gods, I thought you were one of them beasts!

Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks.speaker: Olly
Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks.text: I'm out of flasks! They're coming!
Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks.context: NodeContext: terrified, shouting desperately during a battle - the 'flask' are like flammable grenades he was using to hold back monsters, and now he's run out they're coming for him

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Olly
AD_BetweenAgents.text: We should make a run for it.

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.text: They'd tear us apart. You saw what happened to the others.

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Olly
AD_BetweenAgents.text: That fire won't hold them forever.

AD_BetweenAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_BetweenAgents.text: I know! But we don't stand a chance out there.

Agent_001_CrimeSevere.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_CrimeSevere.context: NodeContext: furious, beginning hostilities with player who is stealing his belongings

Agent_002_Dead.speaker: Narrator
Agent_002_Dead.context: NodeContext: after successfully casting a speak with dead spell

VB_BloodSymbol.speaker: Player
VB_BloodSymbol.text: That symbol, in the blood... what does it mean?

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: Looting the bodyNodeContext: sad but pragmatic - standing over a dead companion

Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.speaker: Rugan
Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: pocketing the moneyNodeContext: said while pocketing the money looted from his dead friend

Agent_001_TiedUp.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Character is tied to chair.NodeContext: badly beaten, eyes closed, barely conscious, expecting to be killed

Agent_001_TiedUp.speaker: Rugan
Agent_001_TiedUp.text: ... you beautiful bastard... thought my luck had finally run out...
Agent_001_TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: either slumping in chair (no longer tied) or falling to knees, rubbing his wrists where he was boundNodeContext: exhausted and badly beaten - we just untied him from a chair where he was being tortured. Grateful and relieved but almost passing out from the pain

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.context: NodeContext: surprised shout as we tamper with his cargo

Agent_002_Crime.speaker: Olly
Agent_002_Crime.text: Leave the bloody chest, and concentrate on the monsters!

session_synopses.Agent_003_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Amnos, a zhentarim mercenary who was killed by a pack of gnolls
session_synopses.Agents_AD_Retreating: One-shot AD for Zhent shipment survivors when they hear/see players starting a fight with the gnoll pack that have them (the agents) cornered. They back away, somewhat cowardly, not wanting to get involved
session_synopses.Agent_002: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks: Zhent agents panic as they prepare to be attacked by gnolls
session_synopses.AD_BetweenAgents: Non critpath: conversation between two zhent agents while they are trappedwaiting in a cave. In the first three branches, they are desperate and out of breath as they throw flasks of fire at the cave entrance to hold off a pack of gnolls. In the final flow, the gnolls are gone. The characters are more relaxed, but traumatised by the experience.
session_synopses.Agent_001_CrimeSevere: Angry and surprised, a zhent agent prepares to attack as he calls out to a player stealing an item that belongs to him.
session_synopses.Agent_002_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Oll, a young Zhentarim agent
session_synopses.VB_BloodSymbol: The party character comments on the blood symbol near the wrecked caravan. They player might reckognize the symbol.
session_synopses.Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction: One-shot AD for the Rugan just after he fought gnolls. If Olly is dead Rugan approaches his body to say alternative node.
session_synopses.Agent_001_TiedUp: In situations where Rugan survives after being beaten and tortured by the Zhentarim, players can interact with him in the chair he's tied to. He's exhausted, badly beaten, and barely capable of speaking full sentences.
session_synopses.Agent_002_Crime: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The chest's clearly worth a lot to the Zhentarim, if it's returned unopened.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: It's our chest now. We can do whatever we want with it.

session_synopses.PAD: This PAD was converted from a RD where the party were discussing what to do with a valuable chest they've found. It triggers when agents are not nearby and a character picks up the chest or tries to open it, or deals with the agents and then notices the chest in the cave.
The player sees dead flaming fists and a collapsed tunnel near the Toll House.

session_synopses.AD_Backup: Plays when Salazon spots an NPC he can't have a dialogue with (summon, animal, party follower)

Zhent02_CaughtUp.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_CaughtUp.text: What did you have to come creeping in for? Sorry - we'll make this quick.

Zhent02_CaughtUp.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_CaughtUp.text: No prisoners! No mercy! Take them!

Zhent07.speaker: Vol
Zhent07.text: Didn't I tell you to move along?

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: Well, won't get that letter sent this side of the Underdark.

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: 'Dear mother - saw my first gibbering mouther, and sorry I ever compared you.'

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: 'At least the mouther had to stop for breath.'

Zhent04_AD_Idle.speaker: Garias
Zhent04_AD_Idle.text: Wonder if the Fist pay better than this lot...

AD_InvestigationCheck.speaker: Player
AD_InvestigationCheck.text: There's a breeze down here. Wonder where it's coming from.

Zhent05_AD_Idle.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Idle.text: Thought I was paid to crack heads, not stack bloody boxes.

Zhent02_AD_Idle.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Idle.text: Lamps, lads - sealed lamps! Don't want open flames where we're going.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: That's far enough. What's your business down here? Answer honestly, and maybe we'll kill you clean.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Neutral but firm - she's not remotely afraid of us but

Zhent02_Stage1.text: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1.text: I don't want trouble - I just want to trade.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: Trade with what? Your life was ours the moment you walked in here.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed - our life is in her hands, and she's stating it as a simple matter of fact.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: But... maybe I'll let you buy it back. I have a job needs doing.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Considering us - normally she'd kill us but we just tried to talk our way into her base, and she could use skills like that.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: We've disarmed the traps. Come down.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: An order, not a request - we're entirely in her power as far as she's concerned.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: Wanna pick out the true Zhent? Tell 'em they're going down into the Underdark.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: While everyone else is bawling, they'll be the ones asking about hazard pay.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: What - come to kill me yourself? You might as well.
DoubtingArtist.context: InternalNodeContext: Peacefull situation, the artist is still captive, already met the playerNodeContext: Intense, eager - waiting for us to tell him he's free

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist.text: Relax - I'll speak to your captors.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: Now I don't mean to hurry you - but if you could hurry, I'd be most obliged.

Zhent02_AD_Stage2.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Stage2.context: NodeContext: A barked order to her men - but not rattled, she's a consummate soldier

Zhent01.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01.text: You're a friend of the family now. Just as well I didn't blow you up, eh?
Zhent01.context: NodeContext: Chummy - he was ready to kill you just a few moments before but knows you're an ally now.

DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives.text: Wait! They've got oil everywhere - and bloody torches!

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Olly
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: You lot are always making fun of me.
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.context: InternalNodeContext: Only plays if Olly is alive and all speakers are available.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: Oh, lad. That just shows we care!

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Zarys
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: I do it because it makes me hate him less.

Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: A little bit of this will turn your blood to treacle.
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon in poison.

Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.text: Don't just paint faces. People got other parts, too.

Zhent02_Stage3.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage3.text: You're making a bad mistake, my friend. Last chance to turn back.

VB_Entrance.speaker: Player
VB_Entrance.text: A cave beneath the tavern. I wonder how deep it runs...

Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: Let's see how you like a little rot.
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon with poison.

Zhent06_AD.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD.text: Down into the Underdark. Reckon I'll be old by the time I see the sun again.

Dog_03.speaker: Istor
Dog_03.text: Careful! No stone-scent. No stone-sound. Strange-stone here.

Zhent03.speaker: Brem
Zhent03.text: Something I can help you with?

Zhent03.speaker: Brem
Zhent03.text: Well now! If we're talking, my guess is you've got coin to spend.

Zhent07_AD_Combat.speaker: Vol
Zhent07_AD_Combat.text: We've buried tougher than you. Come on!
Zhent07_AD_Combat.context: NodeContext: A threat shouted during combat.

Zhent06_AD_Combat.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD_Combat.text: You've messed up. At least you won't live to regret it!

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're the one who recruited me, Rugan.
Zhent02_Trap.context: CinematicNodeContext: For this entire exchange, Zarys is standing about ten feet above us on a raised platform.NodeContext: She's overseeing the torture of an agent of hers - one who originally recruited her to the organisation. Tone is chiding and also vaguely disgusted - he should have known better.

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're the one who taught me rule number one, remember?
Zhent02_Trap.context: CinematicNodeContext: A shot of the torturer from behind, the moving aside to reveal Rugan.NodeContext: As if reflecting on 'good old days', but with a harder edge

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_Trap.context: NodeContext: <Bound to a chair> Any moan / gurgle of pain or fear. He's been tortured for quite some time and is too exhausted to scream

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're dead the moment you steal from the Zhentarim.
Zhent02_Trap.context: NodeContext: All joviality dropped - flat and icy-cold.

PAD_NoticedFakeWall.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticedFakeWall.text: That wall's an illusion! Hiding what, I wonder...

Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: I've been wanting to try this venom...
Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: Mid-combat, character is coating their weapon in poison.

Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied.context: NodeContext: (Zar-iss, Sword-har) Your leader just died in combat - dismay, anger.

Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.speaker: Garias
Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.text: Did that artist really paint all those things?

Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.text: Says his muse made him do it.

Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.text: Gods, little brother - read a bleedin' book.

DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.text: Shitting hells, will this never end?!
DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.context: InternalNodeContext: The artist has been freed by the player, He is leaving the cave, but on the path he feels threatened by something

Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness.text: Our visitor's taking out the lights! Fall back!

Zhent07_AD_TrapsActivated.speaker: Vol
Zhent07_AD_TrapsActivated.text: Run! Rugan's friend set off the traps!

session_synopses.Zhent08_AD: Karad is standing around on guard duty, bored.
session_synopses.Zhent02_CaughtUp: The player has snuck into the miiddle of a Zhentarim outpost and been spotted - the Zhent would usually run but choose to fight as the player got too close before discovery. In some cases, friendly members of the group recognise the player.
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Idle: Brem is chatting to himself as he packs to leave the Zhent hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent04_AD_Idle: Garias is talking to his brother as they prepare to leave their secret gang hideout.
session_synopses.AD_InvestigationCheck: Player is chasing someone down into a seemingly sealed room - they'll either realise there's another door or just be confused that their quarry has disappeared.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Idle: Bellar is a cheerfully violent thug who is happily chatting to himself while his companions prepare to flee their hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Idle: Zarys is barking orders at her minions as they prepare to leave the hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage1:
Zarys is standing on a raised platform just as we stumble into her secret outpost, speaking to us across a gap of about 15 feet. We have to convince her we're friendly or she's ready to have us killed.

Her gang are preparing to burn down their hideout when they leave, and in some cases she'll give the order to start that process if she thinks we're a threat.
session_synopses.Zhent06: Jarg is a veteran of the crime organisation - as friendly as they come but would plant an arrow between your eyes without thinking twice.
session_synopses.Dog_01: Younger dog is following her master on patrol duty, mindful of all the beastly scents in the underdark.
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist:
An artist captued by the Zhentarim, Oskar is being forced to paint against his will. He'll discreetly approach the player and beg them to buy him, mindful that he's within earshot of his brutal captors. 
If he is freed by whatever means, he'll regain some of his old haughtiness but will ultimately still be grateful as he relates his story - that he's torn between two loves. The first is the patron who has offered to marry him, and the second is a first true love from his pre-fame and -wealth past.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Stage2: Zarys is pulling her troops back as we intrude on their hideout
session_synopses.Zhent01: Salazon is a guard the player will have encountered on entering the dungeon he'll either have fled from us, tried to blow us up, or let us pass.
session_synopses.Zhents_AD_ZhentAgentEscape: The player has freed a Zhent prisoner - tied up and beaten because he failed to return to the hideout with a valuable shipment. The NPC sees the prisoner freed and running for the exit.
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives: The doubting artist warns the player about the explosives inside the Zhent dungeon
session_synopses.AD_ZhentShipmentAgents: Back and forth between Olly, Zarys and Rugan in their idle states .
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics: Brem is commenting on paintings by the doubting artist.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage3: Zarys is fleeing while her hideout blows up around her. Player is pursuing.
session_synopses.VB_Entrance: Player exclaims on entering a hidden underground cave.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Zhent06_AD: Jarg is a veteran of the Zhent - but he's on guard duty and he's bored.
session_synopses.Dog_03: This dog is guarding an illusory wall. It looks solid to him (and the player), but he can't smell it.
session_synopses.Zhent03: Brem is a trader for the Zhentarim. When we meet him, he's holding an artist prisoner and offering us a portrait. We can persuade him to release the prisoner or just buy him outright - or just trade normally. He'll indicate that there are more illicit items he can show us - once we prove ourselves to his leader.
session_synopses.Zhent07_AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the zhent is taking her turn.
session_synopses.AD_UseLift: On interacting with a broken elevator.
session_synopses.Zhent06_AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the zhent is taking his turn.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Trap: We walk in to find Zarys overseeing the torture of an agent that handed over special cargo to us. The agent is currently bound to a chair and badly beaten, and we're due to get the same treatment in her eyes - unless we can talk her out of it.Volume is likely louder than normal conversation but not shouting - she's standing on a raised platform perhaps ten feet above us and the tortured agent,
session_synopses.Dog_02: This older dog is following his master on guard duty, uncomprehending the endless circles they walk but happy to do it anyway.
session_synopses.PAD_NoticedFakeWall: In exploring the zhent dungeon, the player has discovered an illusory wall.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied: One-shot combat AD to play when the leader of the Zhentarim - Zarys, - dies.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Dead: A SwD with Zarys, the Zhentarim leader. She can tell us about the situation in the outpost, and the missing agents and cargo she's waiting for.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage2: Zarys is fleeing the player, setting traps as she goes (ADs account for if she is unable to do so)
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Zhent04: Brem and Garias are brothers, ADing back and forth about the artist they've taken captive (or sold)
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering: Doubting artist is cowering because something potentially harmfull is happening. He don't want to talk until it is resolved.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness: Zarys is responding to the player trying to creep up on her crew, based on whether we've met her before or not.
session_synopses.Zhent07_AD_TrapsActivated: Plays if the player sets off the explosives after winning the Zhent over.
session_synopses.PAD_HiddenEntrance_Opened: Player has opened a secret entrance hidden behind an elaborate sliding-wardrobe setup.

PAD_KarlachAfterEnraged.speaker: Karlach
PAD_KarlachAfterEnraged.context: NodeContext: Relieved and self-satisfied, a little tired after raging out

session_synopses.PAD_KarlachAfterEnraged: After Karlach's enrage she will feel a lot more relieved.

AD_FoundDeadDesire.speaker: Fist Recruit Aelis, Fist Recruit Ito, Fist Recruit Pavel, Gauntlet Yeva
AD_FoundDeadDesire.text: Florrick... we had better send her body home.

PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon.speaker: Player
PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon.text: They do seem a bit short-handed.

session_synopses.AD_FoundDeadDesire: Reaction from the Flaming Fists if they run into a dead Councillor Florrick.
session_synopses.PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon: The player has just told a Flaming Fist guard that Zhentarim are hiding in a nearby cave. The guard brushes it off because they don't have the numbers to take on a Zhent stronghold.

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Ephren
node_data.text: More drow. Fist - at the ready!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Ephren is standing, and ready to fight. She notes your presence, then calls out to her comrades. (Fist: at the ready!)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Think carefully, colnbluth. Do you truly wish to anger Lolth's favoured?
False

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Ephren
node_data.text: Save your breath.

session_synopses: Flaming Fist praying over a dead colleague. Jacek = "YAHT-sick."Drow players: Ephren believes you are another attacker, and either initiates attack or you persuade her not to.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: Hey. Hi. You're here. What're you, then?

Hyena_002.speaker: Player
Hyena_002.text: I'm a god, walking in mortal flesh.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: What does godmeat taste like? I... I gotta know.

Flind_Wounded_AD.speaker: Flind
Flind_Wounded_AD.context: NodeContext: Gnoll idles - SFX only - A gutteral, demonic roar.

session_synopses.Gnoll_FangOfYeenoghu_01_AD: Gnoll idle sounds that play as this gnolls performs blood ritual over the dead Zhentarim agent's body: bites its teeth into the flesh and rips it apart howling in frenzy.
session_synopses.GnollRanger04_AD: Gnoll idle sounds that play as this gnolls fest on dead Zhentarim agent's body. Cackle and growl as with other gnolls, crunching is bones cracking as it eats the corpse, 'chew' is as it devours flesh,
session_synopses.Gnoll_FangOfYeenoghu_01: A Fang of Yeenoghu (magically gifted gnoll) communicates with a barking hyena-like laugh
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_01: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Hyena_002: A hyena with a pack of gnolls is anxious and curious about players who get close enough to speak without being attacked by the rest of the pack
session_synopses.GnollRanger02_AD_Angry: Gnoll yaps angrily after being instigated / attacked by Flind.
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_02: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
session_synopses.GnollRanger03_AD: Gnoll idle sounds that play as part of a pack of the monsters waits near a cave entrance where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_04: A gnoll pack-member lurks outside a cave, gnawing body of a dead Zhentarim agent.
session_synopses.GnollRanger01_AD_Angry: Gnoll howls angrily after being instigated / attacked by Flind.
session_synopses.Flind_Wounded_AD: Flind gnoll one-shot AD, when it is first heavily wounded or realy really angry.

VB_PostFight_2P.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_2P.context: NodeContext: After a fight, you're reflecting on the monsters you've killed.

VB_PostFight_2P.speaker: Player
VB_PostFight_2P.text: We'll have to keep an eye out for more.

PAD_HyenaRunning.speaker: Player
PAD_HyenaRunning.text: Watch it - that hyena's going for help!

session_synopses.VB_PostFight_2P: Two players hava just finished a fight with gnolls (biped canine-type monsters). Before or during the fight, they saw new-born gnolls bursting out of the stomaches of dead or dying hyenas. Dialogue changes depending on if players know what gnolls are already.
session_synopses.04: A second player using Speak With Animals talks to a hyena while the first player speaks to the Dying Hyena. This will always end in combat.
session_synopses.PAD_HyenaRunning: When the party starts the combat with dying hyenas, one of them - healthy hyena - will run away to call the gnolls nearby. This PAD is to ensure the player will understand what hyena is up to.
session_synopses.SickHyena_AD_Groaning: Sick dying hyena whimpering in pain: a new gnolls is about to be born from it.
session_synopses.AD_GnollBorn: A hyena erupts, whining in agony as it dies, and unleashing a new gnoll into the world.

PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.speaker: Player
PAD_EnteringGoblinCamp.text: There are many memories I wish I could erase from my mind - the stench of this place is chief among them.

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: You're that True Soul that's been chumming around with Minthara, aren't you?
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: Didn't expect to see you grubbing around here in the muck and the leftovers.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Where are the rest of the goblins?

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: On their way to Moonrise, with her ladyship. They left me here to make sure we ain't left nothing valuable behind.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly

session_synopses: After Goblin Hunt Celebration night and persuading Minthara to spare their lives, player can observe Goblin camp being empty with only one goblin trader looting what's rest in the Festivities area.This is that goblin's dialog.

HalsinDiedBearform.speaker: Narrator
HalsinDiedBearform.text: *The corpse before you is no longer that of a bear, but an elf - albeit a large one. Curious.*

session_synopses.HalsinDiedBearform: If Halsin is killed in bear form in the Wolf Pens and the party knew about Halsin, the companions comment on the fact that the large dead elf who can turn in to a bear was probably the druid they were sent to find. Oops.

AD_HagCackles.context: NodeContext: A set of different cackles for Ethel. All evil. All nasty. All mean. At least three different kinds.

AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor.text: 'A thief who tried to steal from Auntie. Now the good little pet guards my home.'

AD_VictimSign_004.text: 'My sweet Calim, whose beloved asked that his beauty never fade.'

PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.speaker: Player
PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.text: They're not attacking. Must think I'm one of them.

PAD_AtEntrance.speaker: Player
PAD_AtEntrance.context: NodeContext: Wyll's line: a bit sing-songy but not too much.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: Ungh... what... argh... what in the bloody hells is going on?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: You were turned to stone and you're just coming out of it. Dazed, confused, touching your head.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: I - I remember that bit. I think. She...  turned me to stone. Because of the Bite! Of course.
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: Your memories are coming back. You remember going to the hag for a spell to save you.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: I can't believe you fixed it. How did you cure me?
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: . You have an incurable disease and you can't believe they player managed to fix it (spoiler: they didn't)

Victim_001.speaker: Player
Victim_001.text: I fixed your petrification - nothing else.

AD_VictimSign_005.text: 'This poor dear wished never to lay eyes on her family again.'

VB_BurningCage.speaker: Player
VB_BurningCage.context: NodeContext: You're trying to save a woman. She's trapped in a cage that is one fire.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.text: Hah! Catch me if you can, petal!
AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.context: NodeContext: You've turned invisible and disappeared during the fight. Laughing and joking with amused menace.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *You feel crushing waves of fear as a presence within the door recoils. It can't let people through. Not again!*
TalkingDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Just a shot of the player and the door - no visions yet. Player pressing a hand to their head as waves of fear hit them.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *You see the gallery, its walls lined with the hag's victims - their bodies and minds twisted beyond ruin.*
TalkingDoor.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the gallery - the huddled victim in the mirror, the headless victim, the vacant bleeding eyes sockets

AD_VictimSign_002.text: 'My darling Magron. She wished for the mind of a genius, but the silly head crossed me.'

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.speaker: Mayrina
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.text: Get me out of this hellhole!
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.context: NodeContext: The hag has sent out illusions that look like you. You're horrified and crying out to the player, running towards them for safety. It's in the middle of a fight and you're scared but still being your usual bratty and petulant self.

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Dead.text: How did you end up in the cave?

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead.text: Trapped... between two choices... I made a deal... to see my fate...

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead.text: ... but all I saw... was death... so I ran... ran here...

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake.context: NodeContext: This is the fake illusion. She has Mayrina's voice and is pretending to be Mayrina. Crying in the fight - begging and pleading for the player to believe that they are the real Mayrina and the other is the fake. It should ring a little false.

AD_SummonVictims.context: NodeContext: You're forcing two people to come help you in battle - it's a spell and they have no free will. Soft alluring voice as you call our to them across the room.

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Player
Victim_005_Dead.text: Is there anything I should know about this place?

VB_MayrinaInCage.speaker: Player
VB_MayrinaInCage.context: NodeContext: You've spotted the woman you're trying to save.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I was a fool. I wanted to know my fate. I had a choice between two lives, and I was frightened of choosing wrong.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Player has asked how you ended up in the hag lair. Your voice is filled with regret.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I asked the hag to help me see what the future would hold. Got what I wished for, too.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I saw my future self - a corpse, rotten with maggots. And everyone around me dead. Putrid and dead.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Dazed horror as you recall the visions that pushed you to the brink of insanity.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Freed.text: You mentioned choosing between two lives. What were they?

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: A boring story. Stay or go. Marriage and kids or a life of novelty.
Victim_003_Freed.context: NodeContext: Your voice is filled with regret. You gave up everything because you were too afarid to make a choice.

Victim_003_Freed.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Freed.text: I lost my best years rather than just... choose.

AD_VictimSign_003.text: 'My gentle Lorin. He wished to know what was to come.'

AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.context: NodeContext: Calling out from a cage. You're scared but determined - yelling for the fighting to stop

AD_DoublesIllusionRevealed.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of the fight - the player has figured out which illusion is the real you and hit you. You're PISSED. Furious at the player, yelping in pain for one of them, and roaring at the player for the others. Furious, vengeful and MAD.

Victim_004.speaker: Narrator
Victim_004.text: *The mirror glints in the light - the screams from within now silent.*

VB_MirrorScreams.speaker: Player
VB_MirrorScreams.context: NodeContext: Confused at the sound but you can't tell where it is.

ControlledByMask.text: Stay with me, petal. Stay with Auntie. Forever.

Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer.speaker: Player
Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer.text: A mind flayer. No intention of letting that happen.

AD_ViciousMockery.text: Think you're a person because you're walking on two feet? Adorable.

AD_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
AD_Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: One the ground - cowering. Curled up - looking in front of you at a mirror and then ducking behind your hands. NodeContext: Panicked and afraid. You're severely traumatised and not really aware of your surroundings.

AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.speaker: Demir, Johl
AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of a fight. The hag has assumed the form of your sister but you can tell it's fake. Calling out a warning to the player - fear in your voice.

AD_DoubleDied.context: NodeContext: You have created illusions of yourself. The player is attacking you - but getting the illusion instead. You're laughing and taunting them - rubbing it in their face that they can't find you.

EntranceDouble.text: You are as thick as they come, sweetness.
EntranceDouble.context: NodeContext: Threatening smile while taunting player.The old lady act is gone.

PAD_Explore2.speaker: Player
PAD_Explore2.text: The work of the hag. No doubt about it.

AD_HagAttacksCage.text: You want the girl so bad? Fine. Have her roasted!
AD_HagAttacksCage.context: NodeContext: You've just set the cage holding a pregnant woman prisoner on fire. Middle of a fight. Laugh and a vicious smile.

session_synopses.AD_HagCackles: A set of different cackles for Ethel to be used in the lair.
session_synopses.PAD_Explore1: Players have wandered into the Hag Lair without Ethel being present and are commenting on the creepy environment. This is the first to fire.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor: This person has been turned into a door and is unable to speak. Sign attached to it.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_004: This person is trapped in a mirror and mute.
session_synopses.PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral: You are wearing the mask and the other masked victims do not attack you.
session_synopses.PAD_AtEntrance: Combat has started with the hag. She's fled downstairs. You've gone through the fireplace and have just appeared in her lair. Furtive. Looking around for Auntie Ethel.
session_synopses.Victim_001:
The dwarf was turned to stone by the hag to stop the spread of an deadly disease - Laduguer's Bite. Little does he know that the hag was the one who cause the disease in the first place.

Should you remove the petrification spell BEFORE the hag is dead, the disease will kill him.

Should you speak to him after the hag is dead, you can figure out that the hag is the one who made him sick in the first place.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_005: An eyeless woman - dead. One of the hag's victims. You're reading a sign in front of her eyeless body.
session_synopses.VB_BurningCage: This occurs when the hag sets the cage on fire.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2: The hag turns invisible and disappears during the fight.
session_synopses.TalkingDoor: The door guarding the entrance to the hag's lair. It's actually transparent and the player can walk through it. It's a cut scene as the door tries to project images onto the player and communicate to them. Pleading with them to leave. The door was a thief that was taken by Ethel and torn to shreds, with the remainder of his body transformed into a door.Much of this is a 'cut scene' as the door projects visions into the player's mind instead of communicating.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_002: A victim holding their own decapitated head in their hands. This is the sign attached to their corpse.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real: Triggered during the fight with the hag. She has sent out illusions mimicking Mayrina. The real Mayrina is trying running towards the player. Her voice and mannerisms should be a clue to the player that this is the real Mayrina.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Dead: The characters has died and player is using the 'speak with dead' spell. Character is at peace. He lived in fear of his own death. Now that it's happened, he's at peace.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake: These are fired during the fight. It's the hag pretending to be Mayrina.
session_synopses.AD_SummonVictims: Auntie Ethel summons victim_001 and victime_003 to aide her in battle.
session_synopses.Victim_005_Dead: A dialogue with the corpse of a hag victim with her eyes gouged out. She is happy to be dead-- she lived a terrible life and carried family secrets heavily upon her. Her voice should be meek and delicate. She has borne too much in this life already and is ready to be done.
session_synopses.VB_MayrinaInCage: Triggers when the player enters the lair and sees Mayrina trapped in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Freed: This occurs if Lorin survived the fight with the hag. He is dazed and out of it. This is the victim who first say the player as a mind flayer and freaked out. 1) In scenario one, he was never summoned by the hag2) He was summoned and attacked the player and saw the player turn into a mindflayer3) He was summoned and attacked the player but never saw the player as a mind flayer
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_003: This person is alive but severely traumatised and hysterical.
session_synopses.AD_SurrogateMotherInCage: ADs fire by Mayrina when she is trapped in the cage. In the first set it's when combat has started and she is cheering the player on, in the second set she just wants the player to leave her alone. In the third set the cage is on fire, and in the last the fighting is over but she's still locked in the cage.
session_synopses.AD_DoublesIllusionRevealed: This fires during the fight with the player. The player has figured out which illusion is the real hag and hit it.
session_synopses.Victim_004: A victim of the hag's. They're trapped inside a mirror.
session_synopses.VB_MirrorScreams: Trigger near mirror - someone is trapped inside.
session_synopses.ControlledByMask: Hag mode. Player has failed a wisdom save while wearing the mask and the hag has taken over their mind. Cruel and triumphant. The other origin characters realise what has happened.
session_synopses.Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer: This occurs after speaking to the prescient victim in the hag's lair, who sees the player turn into a mind flayer in a vision.
session_synopses.AD_ViciousMockery: The Hag will cast Vicious Mockery on the party in combat. Whoever she targets will be insulted by origin or race. If a character is targeted multiple times, another insult in the chain will be used.
session_synopses.AD_Victim_003: This is a victim of the hag. He was cursed to see the future - he's severely traumatised. In the first AD he's been summoned to fight by the hag. In the rest, he's curled up ont he ground and talking to himself. Severely traumatised.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion: The hag assumes the form of Mayrina in the boss fight. The brothers are able to tell who is Mayrina and who is the hag.
session_synopses.AD_DoubleDied: This fires during the fight with the hag. She's created doubles of herself and the player has attacked the double - missing her. She's taunting them.
session_synopses.EntranceDouble: This fires when the player enters the victim gallery, She appears to taunt them and then vanishes.
session_synopses.Victim_001_Dead: Dialogue with dead hag victim using Speak with Dead. He's relieved to be 'free' at last after haivng lived a life petrified/ afflicted with Laduguer's Bite, a terrible illness.
session_synopses.PAD_Explore2: Players are wandering around the Hag Lair and have gotten into her workshop. It is filled with blood and bones. The hag may or may not be alive at this point.
session_synopses.AD_HagAttacksCage: These are fired during the fight with the hag. The first occurs when Mayrina's cage is set on fire, the second if she dies.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Blood everywhere. This camp was ambushed.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: No ordinary creature did this. Redcaps ripped the place to pieces.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for HAG. The player comes across a wrecked campsite that is covered in blood and clearly abandoned. Passing a Nature check reveals the culprits to be redcaps.

MaskedVictim1.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1.text: We need to leave. You're not supposed to be here - she'll be furious.
MaskedVictim1.context: CinematicNodeContext: panicked, confused, as if coming out of a stuporNodeContext: confused, afraid

MaskedVictim1.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1.text: You served her - give me one good reason to let you live.

MaskedVictim1.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1.text: It was the mask. It dug its roots into me... took away my will. I tried to fight it.
MaskedVictim1.context: NodeContext: explaining something she barely understands

HagLair_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
HagLair_Victim_003.context: NodeContext: *With a gasp, the corpse shuddered.*

AD_ControlledByMask.speaker: Player
AD_ControlledByMask.text: Get out. GET OUT OF MY HEAD!
AD_ControlledByMask.context: CinematicNodeContext: Clutching head NodeContext: Panicked and afraid as the hag invades your mind. Lae'zel's line; Pa'vrylk = Stop! Pronounced; PAH-vrill-ck

AD_ControlledByMask.text: Quiet, little one. Auntie will make it all better.
AD_ControlledByMask.context: NodeContext: Soothing and cruel. A vicious insult as you take over their mind.

AD_WearMask.text: Stop fighting me, petal. Let me take care of you.
AD_WearMask.context: NodeContext: You are attempting to break into someone's mind and take over from afar. Voice is low and seductive - enticing.

MaskedVictim2.speaker: Mask of Servitude
MaskedVictim2.text: Don't touch me. Don't touch me!
MaskedVictim2.context: CinematicNodeContext: panicked state, warning us awayNodeContext: quiet on first phrase, then shouting - panicking, driven mad by the hag and afraid of everything

MaskedVictim2.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim2.text: Don't panic - I'm here to help. The hag's dead.

MaskedVictim2.speaker: Mask of Servitude
MaskedVictim2.text: Auntie's dead? No no no no no.
MaskedVictim2.context: NodeContext: confused on first phrase, then quiet panic on the repetition of 'no' - close to a panic attack

MaskedVictim4_AD_Resist.speaker: Mask of Terror
MaskedVictim4_AD_Resist.context: NodeContext: in pain, trying to resist telepathic commands from the hag who is ordering them to kill the players in combat

MaskedVictim3.speaker: Mask of Vengeance
MaskedVictim3.text: Somebody hurt Auntie - I'll open their veins.
MaskedVictim3.context: NodeContext: confused - mind almost completely lost - 'hurt' is past tense (ie 'somebody has hurt auntie')

MaskedVictim3.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim3.text: That mask is warping your mind - I need to remove it.

MaskedVictim3.speaker: Mask of Vengeance
MaskedVictim3.text: You can't take Auntie's gift! I won't let you!

session_synopses.MaskedVictim1: A victim of the hag, forced to wear a mask that takes away her free will so that she fights for and serves the hag. If the hag is killed, this character regains her senses and resolve. She's deeply shaken by her experience, but courageous, telling the player that she'll inform the people of Baldur's Gate of our heroism, and vowing to hunt down the hag's accomplices in the city.
session_synopses.AD_ControlledByMask: The player has failed the wisdom save while wearing the mask - and fallen prey to the hag's control. Auntie Ethel takes over your mind.
session_synopses.PAD_FreedFromControl: Player breaks free from the hag's control.
session_synopses.AD_WearMask: This occurs when the player puts on the hag mask and on ever subsequent 'turn' thereafter. The player must continually succeed on a wisdom save or risk the hag taking over their mind.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim2: A victim of the hag, bound into her service for so long that their mind is almost completely lost. This victim is wearing the Mask of Terror, which fills them with fear of everything but the hag.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim4_AD_Resist: Lines that play in combat when the hag's masked victim resists the commands of the mask.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim3: A victim of the hag, bound into her service for so long that their mind is almost completely lost. This one is wearing the Mask of Vengeance, and is brainwashed to take revenge on anyone who hurts the hag.
